Zk99TPkdDtwGEwH0BxGTuw.text: Great dim sum spot in Vegas with very authentic food and good service. The ladies with the carts full of food will automatically come to your table and ask what you would like. I'd recommend most dishes except for the har gao and siu mai; those two are still made better at Gold Coast. But otherwise, dig in!   Also, if you're a fan of egg tarts, this place makes it with the flakiest crust I've ever had and they quickly sold out. The last few times I went I had to ask the waiter to bring it to me once they are ready from the kitchen. I actually saw a table arguing with their waiter when they waited for the egg tarts to come out and, when they did, they were all reserved for everyone who had the sense to pre-order. Ha!

77liPSAMpb-3XQ2vAbEWbg.text: I would have rated below one star for this restaurant. It's such Horrible experience and poor customer service. We waited for an hour to be seated, yet there were two jerks walked pass us, cut the line, and took our table in front of us while the host already prepared the table  and called our number just because they are seven stars. I understand that seven stars have better benefits than regular customers, but they should at least have a separate system for other card members. If anyone who has seven stars card can walk, doesnt that mean we have to wAit here forever to be seated?????? However there was one server who was brave enough to say something to these two guys but she couldn't do anything else because the jerks kept saying something in Chinese and made it a scene. All we heard was "seven stars, seven stars." Besides that the host just let them seat there at the table without even apologize or do anything.

GSj0JWUlJbs8CAonUUavnQ.text: My new favorite Chinese restaurant in town. Owned by the same folks of KJ kitchen on Spring Mountain. This location at The Rio is even better. I didn't think it was possible! The food is incredible, amazing service.Warning, it is pricier because it is more upscale and in a "casino", but worth it!  It's brand new, thus very clean, the decor is gorgeous, the ambiance has a romantic, gourmet feel. 20% I you're a local. I'm in heaven here

CqZh8gPZ03_zw585uCYs2A.text: I picked up take out from this resturant during my recent stay at the Rio in Las Vegas. I asked what the 'House Combination Special' and was told it was a mixture of things from their appetizer menu. After I ordered a gentleman came to me and told me that it wasn't what I wanted. This resulted in a long conversation where i had to justify my choice- which was beyond frustrating. I got order, which consisted of 3 things, all cold. I specifically said I didn't want the cold platter when offered it. It wasn't what I was told I was ordering OR what I expected. The food I ate was fine, however having a resturant decide what I want for food is not acceptable. I would never recommend it for that reason.

JwbhiMCKroBFI1mEE_YmZQ.text: The five-star rating is absolutely deserved here!   I could not explain how much I fell in love with this place. The Chinese servers are all unexpectedly very nice, polite and accommodating. The dim sum cart wandered around continually, so we did not have to wait. The food is excellent. The bill came up rather small comparing to the amount of food we had consumed.   Definitely the recommended spot to check out for yummy Dim Sum in Vegas!!!!

bASkdYON9zvk6tKrYEUwDw.text: Not satisfied, service was poor and could tell the host was lying to us. We ordered "dual-shrimp and chicken fried rice" and  "beef pan fried noodles".   The beef wasnt all to bad, but nothing to get excited over. Not sure if our other dish even had shrimp in it with small bits of chicken here and there, not worth the price for that dish what so ever.   This place is right up the street from chinatown. Go there instead.

yMxBg3Lyl_NuK6tcF2dISQ.text: Love the dim sum here better than the other local dim sum spots in town. Be aware that it's super busy on weekends & there can be a long wait for a table.

ElasL52xjrzGv6wY4sTD9Q.text: If someone think that their dim sums are actually good and tasty, then we have a serious palate issue... This is awful! I felt like I was eating a dim sum out of a frozen box. I have traveled through China and I know what a good dim sum tastes like, this is not it my friends!  Then had the Peking ribs, which resembled to fat and bony pieces of pork drowning into a sweet and sour sauce. Ridiculous!   Sorry, but if you want really good Chinese food, this is NOT the place!!!

T6QHzb9k4bUx-hNXk5uYGA.text: Consistent with past reviews, their food was decent, although service was mediocre at best. When we arrived, the hostess was on her cell, after she ended her call, she proceeded to pick up and read a newspaper. We had to call to her attention that we'd like to be seated (she did notice us when she was chatting away), she then mumbled something to a server who clearly didn't hear her. We went ahead and seated ourselves since we weren't getting anyone's attention.   We noticed a few other groups arrived and were getting much superior service, they appear to be frequent visitors or friends of the waitress, as they greeted each other. Guess you need to be in the inner circle to get any decent service.  We then ordered tea and requested chili sauce, the waiter had forgotten our request and we had to request them a second time. Right off the bat we were put off by the poor service. Likely won't return again. These restaurants need to learn the lesson that poor customer service can be costly, as I've seen time and time again. Such a shame.

GZb4cSzyYgVE70jHDwGVbg.text: Came here with the family and it wasn't a bad place for dimsum. Surprising for sure! I didn't think to expect much but the food and selection was pretty good!  Nothing really stood out but everything was really good. Wouldn't be surprised if I came back if I was craving some dim sum.

TQmpn03tZwyecoLnqcMvFA.text: It starts with a hostess with a very bad attitude couldn't say good morning good afternoon. then the waitress with the attitude that I ordered wonton soup and I just happen to ask for dried noodles and she was insulted. the food used to be great now with the bad service and food they should pay me to eat there. and here's the best advice have someone that knows how to speak English

Fm0yKAhzZYERn9YLi8ehRg.text: This was my first experience at a dim sum restaurant and it was amazing! We went around 10:30 am and it was pretty busy. They had every kind of dim sum imaginable. I would  suggest looking at a menu before hand so you know what dim sum to look for so you can fill up on what you really want. My favorite was the pork steam buns and the taro muffins.  I really had no idea what to expect when the bill came because we ate so much food but to my surprise the bill was only $50! Another important tip is you can get a to-go box, so when in doubt always grab more! I will definitely be back next time I am in town.

7wwxFyO5IANo_nIP856f4A.text: It's NEW! Dim Sum inside the RIO casino!    After so many yelpers raving about the dim sum here I just had to try it for myself! Thanks to all the wonderful yelpers out there, I wasn't disappointed.   Good quality and freshness made the dim sum items taste pretty good. There was always a good amount of food circulating on the carts. I really recommend ordering the rice rolls here! They are probably the BEST rice rolls I've had in a LONG time!! My only complaint is that there wasn't enough variety of dim sum items and the portions were kinda smaller than what I'm used to getting in LA.   I didn't try dim sum anywhere else in Vegas, but I'm going to trust the other yelpers and agree that for the quality of the dim sum items here, the price wasn't too bad. The bill came out to be around $50 for 4 people, which is more than what we are used to paying in LA but it is Vegas so I guess it's expected that it's a bit more.   Overall: I would totally recommend dim sum here!

CWbpznJfYkSr2TOM0vVvow.text: Quite possibly the best chinese outside Shang Hai i've had. its that good.  Inexpensive, high quality, Go. Now!

st7P7GI8LIndIFdonCyjiQ.text: Good Dim Sum, Service Terrible..Asked 3 times for high chair. No response. I even got it myself. This was at 10 am.Flagged down a server for beverage  etc. Cart ladies were  helpful. Again No Service. I expected more from RIO. Seems as if we were just a butt in a seat.

EhOwWiJrhgfxxkBOZ63xZw.text: Newer place inside the Rio. Clean, great service, prices are reasonable.  Dim sum was the best I've had in Vegas compared to some of the places in the Chinatown Plaza on Spring Mountain Road.  I would recommend this as your first choice for dim sum! I will try their dinner menu next time.

z1Y0JdSpPT-19ftZEDBJqw.text: Service sucks!  I cant believe service can get this bad.  We got seated and was super hungry.  All the server tries to ignore helping us but 1, and her name is Queenie.  Many people there was hungry and many walked over to the dim sum cart but got yelled by dim sum cart lady to tell us to be patient and go back to our table.  Other server, especially Matthew (unbelievable, totally ignored us) refuse to bring us some orders and told us to wait until dim sum cart came.  We only got a chance to order few items.  End up most food was brought over by Queenie.  Reallie didnt want to tip anyone but for Queenie, we did.

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thanks for the unbelievable service.

13k8PYh7hG-lwvsOESb1EQ.text: My husband and I decided to take a weekend trip to Vegas. Since it was only a couple days, we didn't stay at the Westin at Lake Las Vegas. Instead, we chose the Rio, a good second choice, off the strip, and not a total party spot. After poker, my hubby came home as most restaurants were closing. After a bad experience at the All American (see my review on them), we decided to try KJ's. Hubby had never tried dim sum and I am always in the mood for some. Lets just say impressive! The food was on point. I have never been impressed by dim sum before, since its usually hit or miss (too soggy, not cooked enough ect), but this place was on point. I do wish they had a bigger night time menu, but the helpful employee explained that it was the off season, so they only had the traveling dim sum tray during the day. I ordered what was available and waited. The only reason this is not 5 stars is because of the staff. I understand it may be a cultural thing, but I don't need to be watched while eating. And setting the cloth napkin in my lap for me made me feel like I was 5 years old again. Other than that, amazing food.

vFMmhx295ryDlFUycQ7exQ.text: Didn't let me order dimsum as an entre even though I was willing to order enough to make it to the price level of an entre. That's what I had come here for. Service isn't that good and decor doesn't match the price. Better eats elsewhere

OkacoKvy-O8njGwkZCNo3w.text: I really wanted to like this place. I came here with my mom for a quick brunch one day and I was less than impressed...  Out of the 8 little plates that we ordered, only the shu mai was really worth raving about. We got egg tarts, bbq pork buns, steamed shrimp rolls, and some other things I can't remember.  The service was pretty good, the carts came around multiple times and there were plenty of waiters walking around with separate plates of food.  I may be too biased, having had dim sum in California, but it wasn't any better than the other places in town. The only difference is that this one just happens to be nicer looking and more pricey, which does not make up for the very ordinary food.  I might come back and try some of the other plates. Like the fried noodles or maybe the congee, but I feel like I going to one of the two near my house would be a better choice instead.

-uD2sr1bdzXDh2i4fGDjHw.text: We came here for their DIM Sum only, 2 of us only waited around 20 mins. We ordered 20 items, I can't believe everything is just delicious, very very busy but service is always there. except one of server: Kit  He is just mean and rude. He really is the only one we feel should have not work their. He brings down the team. It would be a prefect review.  Overall I will definitely recommend for their dimsum and just try to avoid Kit as your sever.

Je3oAUejFB6xFDBfR_dQ_w.text: The service was mediocre  The food was ordinary  Nothing was really tasty here, it was pretty plain and I was really disappointed. I'm pretty sure I didn't come 4 hours from California to eat bad dim sum. Everything was rushed out of the kitchen so it didn't taste like a lot of effort was put into the food.

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It&#39;s aight

m6dIkCKkLIqMnMDP9O9goA.text: Definitely in my top 2 of favorite dim sum list. This is located near the Carnival World Buffet inside Rio so take that into consideration when parking. We ended up parking on the opposite end. It's busy here but we only waited 10 minutes to get a table (on a  weekend). This has got to be nicest, fanciest and cleanest dim sum restaurant I've been to.  There were carts that would pass by every 5 minutes. I didn't see my favorite dim sum items though like the roast pork and deep-fried minced pork/beef dumplings. We were there for at least an hour so, I doubt we missed it.  We got har gow, siumai, chicken feet (I don't eat feet of any animal), roast duck, shrimp wontons, baked cha siu bao, steamed cha siu bao (BBQ pork buns), crispy shrimp roll, salt and pepper shrimps, egg custard, shrimp balls, calamari and sweet tofu. My favorites were: roast duck, shrimp balls and sweet tofu - they have the best version of these dishes in town. I've had sweet tofu that has a strong ginger flavor...KJ's version is just right.  Gimme sum dim sum!

s7zwPSyyQQxH8RLuKsfoKg.text: This restaurant is a popular one amongst the locals who dine frequently in Chinatown because the owner has another location on Spring Mountain. The food is authentic and delicious.

irr_UxRuyRhSAq88jyiRSg.text: This place is probably the best in the Rio. They serve some really good fried rice. Do try it. The ambience is neat and spacious. The waiters and owners are really friendly and helpful. The prices are reasonable for Las Vegas standards. Our fried rice was around 15 dollars. The portions are good enough for 2 people. So definitely worth it.

05TtQW5y044JRGb-OOx47A.text: Landed late and had dinner at this restaurant located inside of the Rio Hotel. The service and food were very good. It's a large restaurant and nicely decorated. The rice soup and baby bok choy was awesome.

RnmS0LPcfcAlX-mJYLdyfA.text: I am a dim sum connoisseur, I've been eating it since I was 10.  When I visit  a city I want them to show me what they've got. I visited KJ Dim Sum & Seafood the day after I visited  Ping Pang Pong. I arrived at both restaurants late for typical dim sum. I also showed up at both locations with 2 different sets of people who'd never had dim sum before. The difference in the experiences was night and day and difficult not to compare. It didn't help that both restaurants are across the street from one another Ping Pong Pang is in the Gold Coast which reeks of old smoke, cheap liquor and the sweat of desperation. The other is in the Rio which may be as old as the Gold Coast but it's kept itself in better shape so you aren't turned off by your experience and your nostrils aren't assaulted with funk before you even get to the restaurant. KJ  Dim Sum is also close to the exit of the casino.  We were seated fast and maybe because we were late and they were empty the trays came often and fast. What didn't they have? By the time my cousins came back from the restroom our table was pretty much covered with dim sum and my mouth was full. By the way you should know that the restrooms are a bit of a trek from the dining room so govern yourselves accordingly.   The food was good so I'll be honest I didn't really want to stop and explain what everything they hadn't seen before was. Can I just tell you I'm tempted to give this place a 5 because they had duck. So few dim sum eateries have duck and their duck was delicious. The only drawback was that the duck was a little on the cold side and filled me up so much that I couldn't really do much but peck at the other dim sum dishes we ordered. What I had, I enjoyed and was prepared in a style I've become accustomed to over the years. My newbie cousins actually asked where dim sum had been all their lives. To which I explained that much of America has been deprived of quality authentic Chinese food which is a crying shame.  While I found the prices at Ping Pang Pong to be a little bit higher than I'm accustomed to. I walked away from KJ Dim Sum feeling like I got a deal. I might just stay out at the Rio on my next visit to Vegas so I can eat there every day of my stay. I don't like having to travel miles for good Chinese food. Call me spoiled. If you have only have a chance to choose one of the two go with KJ Dim Sum. Looking forward to my next visit to Vegas to sample the other Dim Sum Spots.

4lDRVtTgmQ0tCvK35MdFhA.text: We usually go here for dim sum and the food and service is good.  The dim is a little pricey but that's expected being that it's inside a casino.  So tonight we decided to stop by for dinner.  We weren't too hungry so we just ordered crab meat with fish maw soup and their "Imperial Peking Duck".  Soup: it was ok. Nothing special compared to other soups at restaurants in LA. $20 a bowl.  Duck: This was a total rip-off and I'll tell you why. The dish alone is $42 bucks !  That's about $10-$15 dollars over other restaurants in the area.  But we accepted the price since we knew Peking duck comes 2 ways and that would sort of make up for the price.  The usual crispy skin with bao buns and then minced duck with lettuce wraps is usually how the dish is served.  So they bring out the duck and it is the "complete" duck, meat and skin and all.  So we asked about the minced meat part with lettuce wraps.  They informed us that it would be extra charge.  $15 dollars extra to be exact.  The waiter kept telling us that they don't do it like LA restaurants. I don't know what he's talking about since restaurants in the area do duck 2 ways when you order Peking duck. I don't care where your at. When you order Peking duck, it is always served 2 ways and not charged EXTRA. The price on the menu is the price you pay!  Anyway.  We settled with what we had and asked about ordering more bao for our duck. We only wanted a couple more. The waiter first told us that you have to order by 3 or 6.  Then he comes back after checking with manager that minimum order is 6. The baos' are $.75 per !    At this point we were totally dumbfounded and furiously frustrated by how badly we just got ripped off and how this restaurant tries to nickel and dime you with their outrageous extra charges.    The waiter, sensing our great disappointment, offers us free dessert. It was taro with tapioca and was good, but not enough to dissuade me from writing this poor but deserving review.  The food was good and they did try to give us some sort of comfort with the free dessert.  For that, I give them 2 stars.

x1REXUTE5rVBumNwAeflIQ.text: Food: 4/5 Service: 4/5 Cleanliness: 4/5 Decor & Style: 5/5  The food is pretty good overall however not the best i've had. Some of the dishes are slightly dry but at least still tasty. For Vegas this place has good prices. Love the large room so wait times is not as long as some of the other smaller places on Spring Mountain Rd, at least for my first time experience here at KJ.

NKJt2ABP_sFXKVipyMkU4Q.text: This place is awesome! Best dim sum in Vegas. I always go there when I'm in Vegas. The quality of food is consistent. I've been there for lunch, dinner and at midnight. All times the food has been good. The service is great and the place is kept clean.   T would bring his friends to this place.

n2I6ziOq5j46QBKhVD-HuA.text: This restaurant serves fresh authentic Chinese food!  My husband and I were so satisfied with our meal that we returned the next day for lunch.  You must try the beef tendon appetizer!

7EZ6hzn1wXM1NuSjgu1xoQ.text: The Mongolian Beef is not delicious as we hoped. Too soft meat with some fats. To compare the Mongolian Beef, PF Chang offers better taste than KJ Dim Sum.  We will not come to this place again.

SE9t1SNAmpBTMswFl-VtOg.text: DINNER REVIEW, NOT DIM SUM  im pretty sure this place was the reason why I threw up all night and until the sun came up... after I ate this, a couple of hours later, I hurled my brains out. Everything I ate came right back out... I slept next to the toliet... the night before new years eve lol  The food was alright... I guess I'm a little snobby when it comes to Chinese food and this place was probably one of the weaker Chinese food place I've eaten at. Although their chrysanthemum tea was really good, their food was alright. Also, they charge for hot tea so make sure you don't mindlessly agree to hot tea when they ask you. In socal, the tea was always free.:(  The best dish we had was the beef chunks that was still sizzling as it was placed on our table. Everything else wasn't worth mentioning. The food portion was a.bit smaller for the price we paid for it... but then again we're in vegas.   Anyways, be safe my friends. Be cautious of what you eat.

LbHPxxf2LVQ5WNp07hOnAg.text: I was upset about my last visit. However, after a new interaction with the device provided I'm more satisfied. Overall the food was good and they have very traditional Chinese Dim Sum.

bhdIX4jB0uHZnnJjXqiQAg.text: Located inside the Rio close to the Carnival Buffet end, KJ is pretty much on par with Ping Pang Pong, another dim sum place at the Gold Coast.  These places reside in the older hotel casino places that are designed to attract more value-minded Chinese people who are looking for cheaper limit gambling and are comfortable having something familiar and convenient without having to leave the premises.  We were attracted to KJ because someone told my wife that they had the best dim sum in Vegas, but that just makes me feel more leery of the local standards for such food...  The dining room is large and expansive, especially when compared to PPP.  The feel is like that of an 80's style HK or Cantonese dim sum house complete with old school push carts making their rounds.  On the day we went, the dining room wasn't half filled at 1130am, but ebbed and flowed while we were there and seemed busier by the time we were finished.  The crowd was not very diverse, about 95% Chinese which was probably a good sign actually...  The three of us each picked the items that we liked although I wasn't feeling particularly adventurous this day as I only went for the items that I personally wanted.  Usual staples such as haw gow and siu mai I didn't even bother trying myself this time.  Some of the items were disappointing because they were not piping hot like the Vegetarian Pan Fried Rice Noodles (haw fun) and the Fried Turnip Cake (low bok go) was downright cold, to the point that we had to ask them to return it to the kitchen where they reheated it as opposed to replacing it with a fresh one.  The service didn't balk when we asked them to do this and was polite and attentive all around and the push-cart ladies were mostly cheerful...  I had the Sticky Rice (new my fon) wrapped in leaves and the Thousand Year Egg Porridge (pay don sow yuk juk) and was generally satisfied  although both of them were not particularly special and maybe even a little flat or bland tasting...  I found the Green Tea Buns surprisingly good.  Their outside texture was not unlike a pineapple bun with a crumbly, crusty top but the flavor of the filling was not quite as sweet as a pineapple bun.  Two out of three of these on the plate had a lighter color than the third one which I can only assume meant that they came from different batches...  Since it wasn't too crowded during our visit it was nice that we didn't have to fight over the items in the carts with other patrons, but the bad side is that you worry about food turnover and items becoming stale and in some cases cold.  I was generally satisfied with our experience although nothing particularly felt special or stood out to me, but my expectations could be affected by my experience with places like Ping Pang Pong where I had very low expectations but was pleasantly surprised, and then coming here after being recommended to us.  I would return but probably not come out of my way, aside from being in LV in the first place...
