aqwAiUyB98jLVp9qHB8tqA.text: Food are awesome and price are reasonable, it cost our family 30 dollars for lunch. good lunch

CouEfuwjTMjS4dCEY2uj9g.text: Yummy Dim Sum starting at 10 am. They do not serve DimSum all day/night, so you can't walk in at 11pm and get it, but very authentic Chinese food!

KhY7Ry8g-g4NnVnQhLK9-Q.text: Food: dim sum in The Rio at lunchtime. Hai gow, steamed BBQ pork bun, lobo gao, steamed rice in banana leaf, juk, fried mochi with pork inside. I was disappointed that they didn't have more dumplings or the green tea buns. Taste was better than Chang's and Yum Cha. I guess comparable to Ping Pang Pong (which can be inconsistent). We like KJ Kitchen so we will probably be back.   Service: I actually thought the service was very attentive. They refilled our hot water on our tea without asking and also fetched soy sauce and vinegar when requested. Dim sum pushed in carts but there were probably only about 4 different carts. Would like more variety.   Ambiance: elegant, clean and nicely appointed in shades of red.   Location: in The Rio across from Carnival Buffet.

UGlJvYMETVUjDLe8YTgntQ.text: Nice, clean with a semi-elegant ambiance Chinese restaurant, inside The Rio Hotel & Casino. They offer Dim Sum, but we were there for dinner. We ordered the Beef with Mixed Greens & the Orange Peel Chicken with a side of white rice. Overall, the food and service was great but my friend and I were a bit annoyed by our waiter because, we had just literally sat down and just started picking up the drink menus, when he is already barking at us what we want to drink!!! I had to firmly tell him to give us a few minutes to at least glance at the menu!!! The restaurant was not busy & you could tell the waiters were dying to be busy. They kept hovering over our table, anxiously awaiting to bus our table...annoying when you are trying to enjoy your wine & conversation with your dinner companion...minus one star!!! Other than that, I would come back again. The dishes we ate were delicious!!

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice Ambiance
Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jyhDH51tm1iNlPIo8X0ibQ.text: I have never had a bad dish from KJ, and I have been told that I'm a pretty picky eater. The place may be a bit loud, but the food arrives quickly and the taste is always consistent.

9-c_xhPXDGL0K2VLgAB_UQ.text: I came in to have dim sum with my parents but unfortunately they only serve it for lunch. It was too late to turn back so we ordered a couple of dishes which included the egg soup, the beef with vegetables, fried squid, and sizzling scallops. The egg soup, sizzling scallops, and fried squid were decent. However the beef with vegetables was sooooo hard to chew to the point where I didn't bother to try it. The food is very bland and needs more flavor/salt. The steam rice was also very hard too.   However, the service provided was wonderful. Maybe because there were only 3 small groups in the restaurant? They continued to check on us and made sure we had refills on the hot tea. So that's why I'm giving them a 3. I will definitely be back to try the dimsum.

Kn-NZ8Gp9r4MsXOPP8MnsQ.text: If you are craving dim sum while in Vegas, well then KJ Dim Sum & Seafood should more than satisfy your craving.  I came here with a big group of friends for a friend's birthday lunch. We were staying at the Rio and I was pretty surprised that they had an actual dim sum restaurant there rather than off the strip near Chinatown.    The carts went around pretty frequently with a vast variety of hot and freshly made dishes.  Everything was pretty tasty. My favorites were probably the shiau mai, fried turnip cake, and tripe.  Of course, I also enjoyed their pork and thousand year old egg congee-this always helps cure a hangover. Their portion is prettty small for the congee, so if you're not feeling so well, I suggest one congee per person.  We also ordered their duck and barbeque pork fried rice and fried noodles, all which were fulfilling as well.    Coming from the San Gabriel Valley and having had my share of Dim Sum experiences, I would definitely recommend this place.  Check it out and see for yourself.  Our group left with massive food coma-satisfied and ready for a nap in prep for the evenings debauchery!

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LfPd6kPOHZWrClqRDCDxqQ.text: Right off the bat, this place is pretty clean compared to the rest of the other dim sum establishments in Vegas. Interior is nice, food selection is pretty standard as with other places.  The food is quick, there are carts constantly circling around a pretty big place. It's quick, it's pretty normal dim sum.    The only part that doesn't give me a reason to give more stars is the service. The younger servers dressed in polo shirts are pretty nice and will do what you ask.  However, we had one lady in the standard button-up and vest. I'm assuming she's been working here for a while.  Well, if you're working at a casino restaurant, you should know how to treat customers.  We asked our server for drinks. They didn't have Pepsi, she said they only had diet pepsi and other sodas. Okay, cool. So we ordered two other sodas and a water. However, when we came out, she only brought one soda and two waters. We said thank you and apologized, and that we actually asked for another soda (and not the second water). So she rolled her eyes, huffed, threw her hands up and said, "Can you guys order all at once?" She pointed to the kitchen at the back of the room, (we were seated near the entrance) and continued to say, "I just came all the way from over there.", making it seem like getting drinks was sooo hard for her to do.  My dad apologized to her and explained that she must've heard us incorrectly. Before she left to get our soda, my dad apologized again. Not our server. Must be a generational thing for him to apologize to her for the miscommunication, but she definitely should have not given us an attitude about it.

NLQtLu1N64kht6cJIGE_zg.text: Not to be a hater but - This is one of the worst dim sum experiences I have ever had. From the Har Gow's lack of freshness to the overpriced $18 snow pea leaves, this place is just ridiculous. It's brand new so I would assume this is them at their best and their best stinks so much!  This place obviously is biased towards Chinese speaking people. I asked the server if I can order some snow pea leaves, and she said it wasn't available. OK, well, a short while after I see a table getting exactly what I ordered delivered to a Chinese family. I then hailed the server and pointed at it. Well, they served it warm not hot and also it was $18.... Later I checked the menu and it should have been $12.   Vegetable fiasco aside, the dim sum was so bad. Even ruined my dumpling experience. BOOOO. Go next door to Ping Pang Pong cause that's where the good dim sum is in Vegas. This place STINKS!

1yRjqzwEB8yuxz9txTtRsw.text: 5 star dim sum in my book!  There were some "BEST-Ive-had" dim sum items here!  For example, the Roast Duck. Easily the best I've had at dim sum! Skin was crispy, meat was tender and flavorful. Awesome!  You can find better if you look REALLY hard in Chinatown, but for dim sum, there has been no close second!  The Fried Shrimp Balls. These were easily the BEST I've had! I really don't know how they get ALL that flavor inside, but they are awesome!  Seriously, I have NEVER ordered items to take to-go...usually dim sum is oily and gross reheated....THIS was my first time, and surprisingly, they were actually good the second time around too LOL!  Salt and Pepper Squid. Another winner! This was soo good...so much flavor here, and much better than the shimp version!  If you like this kind of dish, do yourself a favor and order it :P  Shu Mai. This was very tasty and better than the others I've had before. Lots of flavor in the shrimp!    Cha Siu Bao. These were tasty, but very small compared to all the others I've had before. Still one of my favorites!   Egg Custard Buns...So good!  Again, very small portions, but they pack tons of flavor inside! This version was a little more "runny" inside than most.   And remember to finish off with the Sweet Tofu! It is a tasty rendition here :)  Got a new favorite in town!  Pics :

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rice Noodle Wrapped Beef. Good overall.
Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steamed BBQ Pork Buns. Yummy!
Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg Custard Buns...So good! Very small portions but pack tons of flavor inside! This version was a little more &#34;runny&#34; inside

UhQ21NV0Fyu4PrhcXBFuvg.text: Usually have decent luck with this place, today 7/14/17 is probably he worse food I've ever eaten at a Chinese restaurant. The food came out cold when we were the only 3 tables here. Never again will I eat here, we came here with a party of 37 and no one was happy with their food.

5tXz3g8C9RxiaB9Zz_si7Q.text: Whenever I come to Las Vegas, it's a must that I stop by KJ Kitchen for some dim sum. I've been to other places in Vegas for dim sum but this is by far the best.   The wait is never too long here, but even when there is a line, it is well worth the wait. All the dishes are fresh and come out steaming hot. They have a wide variety of dim sum dishes, from shrimp dumplings to pineapple buns. They are moderately priced and comparable to other dim sum places. The wait staff is attentive and friendly. You never have to ask for a refill.   I always leave KJ Kitchen satisfied and with a full stomach.

GxDZlfdMUR_lk4hsva6-oQ.text: Very good for the price. Fast service. I am amazed by the variety. It is in the Rio with a great staff. My buddies and I loved it. Great food and environment

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HkF0_5mefJFYEr4ZowiYtA.text: Our servers weren't very friendly.. And the price we paid for the food was far too expensive for the quality and quantity.

D5m9gDugXbK0FaG79vWesg.text: Came here for dinner.... But food was okay, not the greatest. We order 4 items. The sweet and sour spareribs, weren't fresh. The meat that was use wasn't fresh and just didn't taste right. Also ordered the salt and pepper shrimp and that didn't look fresh either as they had use very cheap shrimp to cook the dish. The color of it didn't look appealing like other places. Overall the food was okay.

Q8ydmgfbdo1QmGEP_QLh1A.text: This is a hidden treasure off the Vegas Strip. Located in the Rio Hotel. It's a great spot to grab some Dim Sum. The carts are always on the move and the food is really good. I gave the 4 Potstickers...

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qpU3Ltg-lojmPWuUzTOMoQ.text: I'll update my review tomorrow when I actually eat here, but for anyone wanting dim sum, don't bother coming after 3p (at least in a weekday) because they don't serve it then. Why have dim sum in the name of the restaurant if it's only served limited hours? And only lunch, at that.

p1bH8Lw1Bj3cpDPeN90yrQ.text: Food had too much onions and less meat or shrimp. Flavors for orange beef and sweet and sour shrimp where too overwhelming. Service a little slow.

B_dMRdbi5jhFK67e3NTX-Q.text: This is my first time here. Food was great! Thats why i gave it a 4 star. Fresh, hot and the flavor was perfect. The salt and pepper shrimp could've been better. Maybe because it sat out for a bit before we got to it but still good. The service was horrible. I thought as this restaurant was inside the casino the service would be better but they just proved me right again as another sterotype of horrible services in any chinese restaurant. We had to constantly as for water refills, no one asked how we were enjoying our meal and they kept clearing the dishes when we clearly werent done yet. We had to tell them no, we are still eating. The servers catered very well to chinese families but ignored others. Had to flag down any server standing around for our check. I would only go back for the food if i am really really craving dim sum. Again the 4 stars is for the food only.

RHnZHsAc8EaJij_F5S5lZQ.text: With a casual atmosphere, this place is a wonderful place for family, friends, large groups, etc.. I have eaten in plenty of dim sum restaurants in Vegas and was a bit "meh" in their food today. Some of the dishes that I got were lacking a little in the salt/taste department: -Ham Sui Gok (fried dumplings w/ mixed meat) -Fong Djau (steamed chicken feet) I'm still willing to go there again and hopefully taste some improved food.

sDzLtsvys71G5EmIPyZi0Q.text: You know a restaurant is good if there's a lot of Chinese people who eat there. Wait a second, that's only relevant at Chinese restaurants. Hold the phone! This IS a Chinese restaurant and there were a ton of Chinese people and the food was incredibly delicious. I love delicious food. And I love awesome people. And on the day that I visited here, I was surrounded by both.  This is one of those little gems that you'd want to bring family from outta town to. Unfortunately, I do not know what to expect for pricing. It was a birthday brunch and two people surprised everyone and paid for the bill. That was nice, but there were a ton of people. I'm certain all 16 people left satisfied. I know I left satisfied. That's what HE said. Ha!

ZLuO-ysuu_iEeoehrW-nwg.text: The portions are really small compared to the what I'm used to back in Boston at authentic chinese dim sum places (but this is Las Vegas for you right?). Everything also lacked any real flavor. The salty duck egg buns were pretty good, as the top part are similar to the pineapple buns you get at chinese bakeries (killing two birds with one stone). For a quick and simple breakfast around Rio, this place isn't too bad.

S65kSxqmJikhERfeqWMkaw.text: My friends and I usually come to KJ for dimsum just because it is less oily than other places. Their service is actually better than other Chinese restaurants, but their variety of dumplings are too small compared to their competitors. I wish they had a wider choice and a little more improved customer service.

tlmqnmGLk40GeHtldBPfoA.text: As a Cantonese, I think their dim sim are very authentic, fresh, and delicious. Every time we went to Vegas, this is the place we must go to. Highly recommended.

NCEKd4_Vl_4NEvWtBSB0sQ.text: Must be Chinese to get good service... But its like that at most Chinese businesses. You get the usual dim sum plate selection and most of the cart runners don't speak much English... Again, this is usual of most dim sum restaurants. Would I come again? Why not.

hhY3wrXkPtYbhPXOJIiMqA.text: 1. They charged us $1 per cup of tea for each person in our group even though only 1 person actually drank the tea (the remaining 5 cups were upside down on turntable).  The rest ordered sodas or water, so in addition to a $6 tea bill, we also had a $6 soda bill. 2. Their menu was not available because they were changing things, so when we ordered chicken fried rice off the menu, we had no idea how much it cost, and we were shocked to see our bill for $13.95 for a small plate of it.   3. There were no prices on the dim sum either. Not even dishes marked A, B, C, D and no price points on any paper indicating what dishes A, B, C, D might cost so we were ordering blind.  When we asked, the dim sum cart ladies did not speak any English. 4. The dim sum cart ladies were scamming us by stamping our paper for more than they placed on our table.  I had to watch that stamping process very carefully and question everything (with hand gestures) and for some reason, we ended up being charged for 5 A dishes, 9 B dishes, and 4 C dishes, which is odd because the same items I order at other dim sum restaurants seem to be A dishes with an occasional B or C dish - again I felt scammed. 5. The bill for 4 adults, two children for lunch was $89 plus tip.  Typically when we eat dim sum at other restaurants with our Chinese friends, we have 5 adults and two children and our bill averages only $50-60, which is why we love dim sum so much.  There is usually so much value for the price. 6. Some of the food was good, but some of the hot food was cold.  Not impressed with anything.  We will never eat at KJ Dim Sum again.  There are just too many other great and trustworthy dim sum restaurants to eat at and those restaurants offer English menus with prices in plain sight so customers know how much they are paying and are not shocked by the bill.

vBg-f1-bGXtMTHWHZPl1Bg.text: The dim sum was amazing, but the service could have been better. We went on a day that wasn't very busy, but we were left sitting with the check until we finally walked it over to someone.

DSnYXl4_ISt6levytsnyPg.text: If it were possible to give 0 stars, this place would get it.  First, we ordered dim sum but they were out. The restaurant has dim sum in the name...  Well, okay fine. We then tried to order potstickers - nope, completely out of all appetizers.  Then we order our food. Each dish comes out 10-15 minutes apart, which is fine... except for the rice which by the time we got it I was full.  The last dish we ordered never even arrived.  We asked 3 times for soy sauce and never received it. And the soup needed it.  Finally, when we asked to see the manager he argued with us, saying the dishes coming out at different times is a Chinese custom. Okay... Really you're going to argue though?  We declined the final steak dish as we were done eating by this point and they made a huge show of "we'll pay for the steak for you." Maybe if you had brought it out ever we would have wanted it.  All in all, it was a very uncomfortable experience and I couldn't wait to get out of there.

KuBVSFgTJ-nOju2fdRWGGQ.text: YAY! This place is amazing, i have absolutely no complaints except for the decor The food was amazing  we ordered the Cantonese steak, the steak was a good cute and cooked medium to medium rare ordered the honey walnut shrimp, it was really good, it's really hard to get that wrong House style rice noodles, amazing, it was one of my favorites Beef and Fish fried rice, SOOOO good BBQ Pork buns were really good also  This is by far my favorite Chinese place, by far

wWHLbci09b2wEakryi4H8g.text: We've been here 3 times, and the food is generally salty. It's good, but it's salty. If you like your food on the salter side, you will like it. The service is pretty great considering it's an Asian place. No one is screaming at you or giving you a look of death when you refuse a dish. None the less, I prefer Ping Pang Pong over KJ.

Xhvnp8d9Rw3rUx5Q1WVYmQ.text: The restaurant is located inside the Rio. I hadn't had dim sum before in Vegas, and this was a good experience: many dishes to choose from, fast service, great for large groups, and reasonable prices. Although I ate only the shrimp dishes, I enjoyed them all. Other people in the group ate different kinds of things. No food was left untouched.

_VPM8EefnnqbB4lxh6ooxQ.text: Very underrated dim sum.  Well made brought to you on carts circulating around the restaurant.  Needs to be more of a selection.

-O6cCavZwcVT7JXDnN0CpQ.text: The food is still good...but the service is atrocious.  We went for dimsum on a late Sunday morning (11am) and the restaurant was 1/4 full.  We asked our server for some tea, hot sauce, hot mustard, soy sauce, and ice water...but he left halfway through our order and we were yelling at him as he was walking away from us.  He didn't even turn around to acknowledge us as he was waking away!!!  I've been to my share of dim sum restaurants around the world, from Hong Kong, NYC, SF, and LA, so I get that good service isn't considered to be important to most operators...especially to non-Chinese customers.  However, being in the Rio Casino, I would think that KJ would make more of an effort to elevate their level of service.  At the least, I would think that the Rio would demand a minimum level of service standards to uphold their rating as a top level hotel.    KJ fails in the level of service, but there aren't many dimsum restaurants in town to compete with so they probably get away with it.  It's disappointing but hopefully somebody else decides to open up a dimsum spot that provides the same level of food but focuses on a higher caliber of service than that found at KJ.

eLxzA5SehTsoIqfD2yijdA.text: I have to admit before I visited this place Ping Pang Pong was my number one dim sum spot in Vegas. KJ actually has better location in my own opinion. It's really close to Rio's parking lot! (no need to walk all over of casino and stuffs) Both their food and deco are more delicate than Ping Pang Pong. Service here was really good. We constantly had waiter checking our table even when they pretty much had full house of customers. price is very friendly too (small dish:$2.28 / med dish:$3.18/ large dish:$3.98 / special dish:$4.98) I definitely recommend their dim sum time!!

mmTRbjYOxwPy_Fk1pTCRlg.text: I really enjoyed this place.  So far as I can tell, it and Ping Pang Pong are the lone restaurants inside casinos that serve dim sum daily.  We had gotten in on a Sunday and missed dim sum at Bellagio, where we usually go, so on Monday we went to KJ's at Rio.  We arrived at about 11:15 am and the place was already packed.  The dim sum here is very fresh and they offer a wide variety.  My only complaint is that the service is kind of bad, but it's what you expect in a typical chinese restaurant.  Prices were very reasonable and you can get twice the amount of food here for the same money that you would pay at a strip dim sum restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vWHP3giN13HHIgZPLJiUTA.text: Chinese people love their dim sum. I took my entire family, including my 90-YO dad Chuck, to KJ Dim Sum at the Rio for my birthday. It wasn't cheap, but the food quality was off the charts. We had all the usual delicacies plus specials like chicken feet, beef balls and a full steamed red snapper fish. Absolutely delicious. It's in the Rio casino-hotel near the race and sports book. Easily one of the best dim sum restaurants in Las Vegas.

iAtsiReuJvZv9V8ogvPvzg.text: Food is just ok nothing to write about and service is lacking. I can't recommend thus place to anyone.

mkcOqDEHzzS7HpyQsf3-DQ.text: Same ole, same ole dim sum in a loud cavernous space with all of the charm of a DMV. The food was rather blah, the carts were frequent enough, and the drink service was non-existent. Plus, it is inside the Rio - a casino as fresh and energetic as a morgue. But hey, there was one spinach-shrimp(?) dumpling thing that was tasty. So, if you hate drinks and love mediocre food, make sure to get the spinach-shrimp(?) dumpling thing. You'll thank me later.

2ARoue1mkRPuS654Ks2z1A.text: Strictly stuck to dim sum in the morning/early afternoon on my last trip and was pleasantly surprised. The dim sum was delicious and the prices were quite reasonable. Service, as far as dim sum restaurants go, was excellent.

yFOXEPUSp1mg72kTdqDq7g.text: Very good! I come from Los Angeles' lovely area of dim sum and this place was surprisingly delicious. The price range is $3-6 per dish, with $3-4 per plate for the classics shu Mai and har gow.  This is reasonably priced considering its a restaurant inside the rio hotel.  PS. They do charge $1 per person for drinking tea. :)

nJnr4IXXR_SxYZoJcl3p8Q.text: i usually go to eat dim sum on Decatur of las vegas, and the reason i came to this restaurant was a lot of people tell me they serve the best dim sum in las vegas.  first, i don't make any common on the taste of food, because since i start to eat dim sum, i think every dim sum restaurant taste same. i  didn't eat any dim sum that is bad on taste, i also didn't eat any dim sum that is perfect.  i wont say don't go this restaurant to someone, but i will not suggest this restaurant.   their service is too f**king slow. i am OK if a popular restaurant get a little bit slow. but if a restaurant can make me mad because they sooooo slow, then they do have big problem on their management.  if you have eaten dim sum, you know they are served on little tapas style plates. One dish has little food on it. i started to eat at this kj restaurant at 10:30, and i f**king only ate got 4 plate in 2 and half hours!!!!!!!! finally, i asked the server if they can order my food for me, they say, go check the food cart, but where is the f**king food cart.!!! i finally take the to go, because i cant sit at there any more.

71KTjVM12keeQ7L6zx3Z1g.text: Quite yummy dim sum dishes! Nothing too spectacular. Was in Vegas for a few days and this was our first stop after arriving. We were recommended this dim sum location by someone who lived in Vegas locally. I actually don't know what the total was on the bill, so I can't compare the prices of the dishes here to other dim sum locations. Food wasn't "WOW", but customer service was defitnetly GREAT!   We came on a Friday morning a bit after 10:00am so we were able to grab a table and was quickly seated. A little over an hour later, when we were leaving the restaurant, there was a waiting line to get a seat outside the retaurant! So I would defitnetly go early if you can unless you don't mind waiting for a table.

qmliDttLGKFZBCHgRDVnpw.text: Do not come here!!!! The worstttt service EVER!!! They charge you for freaking tea!? We had 6 people and it was $6 for tea. Wtf is that!? If I could give 0 stars, I definitely would! They do not care about their customers. We didn't get to eat much because no one came around to serve us. Avoid this horrible dim sum place. Their food isn't even good either. STAY AWAY!

HM291Py_4m1VCCp7VIfnaQ.text: This is the worst Chinese restaurant I've ever eaten at in Vegas.  The food was subpar, portions were small, ridiculous prices, no free refills on soft drinks, and the waiter was a little rude.  No wonder when we came for dinner, the place was empty.  We should have went down to Spring Mountain road, where the REAL Chinese restaurants were.  Three thumbs down (if I had a third thumb).  Beware of this place and avoid at all cost!!

S-VN_MCzhW8ATI4LV7zH0g.text: 3 of us, $40 bill, and the most silky tofu flower I ever had. This is only dim sum place I go in Las Vegas.

_L9ayNCMCsIosObQwcy4aQ.text: My first real dim sum experience was just the other day at KJ Dim Sum and Seafood.  I must have looked lost to everybody I was with.  I didn't know what was going on.  I sat down with a group and the next thing I know the table was filling up with little tins of food.  It all looked great but I did not know what most anything was.  Luckily I was with people who did.  They were telling me what everything was and translating some for me.  I am not even going to tell you what I had by name because I honestly don't know and don't want to insult those who do.  I can tell you that everything was very good.  There were so many little dumplings each with their own uniqueness.  I tried one with mushrooms, one with pork, one with soup.  There were buns with BBQ pork.  Some sort of muffin filled with custard.  Beef and/or shrimp wrapped in noodle sheets and topped with soy.  It was all so overwhelming and delicious.  I would love to go back but I fear I would be just as lost as before without the help of my Yelp friends who made this a fun experience.

t_aLJ9QsDnYbUKSOblx_Zw.text: As a bay area born and raised local Vegas resident, I would say the dim sum is not comparable to that of California, but it is one of the best in the city.   Food: Sure it's not as good as Cali, but they don't take shortcuts here. The food that comes out of the kitchen taste and looks like what its suppose to be. The texture of the food tastes like what's it is suppose to. Most of the dim.sim is hot like It's suppose to when it is served to your table. I cannot vouch for the plate dishes as I've only had the dim sum.   Atmosphere: It's clean, spacious, nice air conditioning, great service, and there's four LCDs for you to watch while you eat. They have TVB Mwhahaha  Come back? Yes, and I would recommend this place over places like Orchid, East Ocean, and even Ping pang pong. I would still recommend Chang's if you are on a budget, but you get what you paid for and your experience won't be as great.

1noYePzRE3hTi9XnszDcWg.text: The service is much better than most Chinese Restaurants! The food is very authentic! We came here for dinner and was very satisfied.

TYn6l7SqNNxS4oAu0KsKnw.text: Nice clean environment...  very extensive selection of Dim Sum, good service, Con... a touch heavy on the MSG.

K04bVWKvCwS9pkIBgmXlNg.text: when having dim sum, you've got to have the proper service to go with it in order to enjoy it.  If the right variety of carts don't come around to your table it can totally affect your dim sum dining experience.  I usually don't write reviews based on the service but during a dim sum experience its all about the service.  It was also hard for us to enjoy the dim sum especially since we had to wait so long for the soy sauce/chili oil to get delivered.  The dim sum was not bad but they lost a star and 1/2 due to the lack of service.  The only plus is the location at the Rio, which is one of my favorite hotel/casinos. =)

Ni2WCVnej8vJITqgvhjzTA.text: My boyfriend and I ordered the sweet and sour chicken was delicious! We ordered fried rice to go with it but there was a mix up and we didn't get it until after we had finished our chicken. The fried rice was the best that we had ever had though! The vegetables were cooked to perfection and the flavor was amazing. Would've been even better to have it with the sweet and sour chicken though.

TKqKlDmhRSpUIwnCbg8LwA.text: I didnt know what happen, but this time we came the foods all taste really bad, this is the first time we ate there and foods very dissapointed.

UJKvIlfl3lPlNc4vNe4NOQ.text: Terrible service. Food was so-so but why would you come here when China Town is literally 2 blocks away & has WAY better options that are more affordable.

-T8J6DP2-VZfXyWFeAunKA.text: We planned to have dinner at the Seafood Buffet, which is in front of the KJ Dim Sum. However, we end up in KJ Dim Sum for the dinner because of a long line waiting for tables in the Seafood Buffet.  The food was not good as I expected. After handing them my credit card, we have to sit there more than 20 mins waiting to get back my credit card. I don't know what the hell they were doing with my credit card.  3 days after that (which is today), I saw KJ Dim Sum charged me twice. WTF? I had to spend 30 mins calling my credit card customer service to dispute this transaction. And it will take time to resolve this.   WILL NEVER GO TO KJ DIM SUM AGAIN.

LdUhp5zPtVCR4p0Kn0nm4w.text: This is a brand new restaurant open in Rio, very spacious and nice decoration. I came for lunch on a wednesday, the wait wasnt too bad only 10 mins, kinda confusing though coz u dont know whether u are supposed to stay in line or get a number from the host.  Talking about the foods, we only had dimsum. There were like 5 carts, not enough for the size of the restaurant in my opinion. Their routes wasn't well distributed. Some carts have never gotten to us, and we had some passing by for at least 10 times. The foods wasnt hot and  I like my food hot. The flavor is alright. The skin of har gow and sui mai was too thick and powdery.  The price was 1.99 for a small, 2.99 for a medium, 3.99 for a large and 6.99 for special item.  Their pastry was so yummy, so delicious. Try the egg custards, durian balls and salted egg buns. The salted egg buns was my favorite, so tasty.  The service was alright. They are newly opened so its understandable. I hope it will get better.

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best egg custards tart and durian balls.
Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ye-b5UgZyQGmEXrHpQPDSw.text: Had a free room at the Rio, so we used it (not why 4 stars). 49ers broke my heart that night.  49ers lost. To themselves. They would've won the superbowl.  UGH.  So we went down to KJ. The line for Carnival was horrendous.   We got seated immediately.  It was just my fiance, our three year old, and I. So we got some chow fun, some dim sum, and..... duck feet. I actually just changed this to five stars thinking about the duck feet.  The chow fun was great, exactly how you'd expect it. The dim sum (I grew up in Hong Kong) was great, exactly how you'd expect it (if you know what to expect). The duck feet. Oh. My. God. The duck feet is why I'm going back, it's an appetizer so not tooo pricey but they perfected the flavor.   I didn't win (I only play poker-against people, not casino) at the Rio on my free stay,the 49ers lost because of themselves, but I consider the trip a God Send because of KJ.   And yes, we had breakfast, and dinner at Carnival, which was really good. I dream of the next time we goto KJ and try the Sea Cucumber.  If you haven't been to KJ, in my opinion. Try. This. Place. Don't settle for the Dim Sum. Try. This. Place. Order at least one dish from their MENU, not the dim sum menu. Their menu.... (So, my advice is TRY MORE than dim sum. Hell, they advertise themselves as a seafood restaurant!!)  The ambiance was great. It's so awesome to actually have Chinese servers in a Chinese restaurant that all speak English you speak respect, or humanity? Towards them first... I was slightly intoxicated and stumbled upon open kitchen doors, and are you kidding me? There were Chinese cooks!  There is a really great picture of recent Hong Kong Island on one of the walls, my son loved that as we have smaller versions in our house.  Food was 5 star service 4, in our three person experience. Maybe because I'm a white guy that speaks Cantonese?   I'll be going back. Soon.

bpGQmovTyIe3ryG3KgtWtA.text: Eating dim sum by your self is not something I recommend.  Just get to full trying everything.  Sticky rice was great and all the dumplings were rocking.  I will be back with friends

VzHtn--mMmWStM7DoAuUOw.text: Good dim sum if a bit inconsistent.  Looooong wait on the weekends.  Beats the shitty atmosphere of the dim sum joint next door at the Gold Coast I think it's called.

Auug4R57k3mIcc6ThVYTjg.text: NO STARS ACTUALLY!!!    DO NOT COME HERE FOR DIM SUM!!!!  I REPEAT...DO NOT!    My family and I frequent this place regularly for dim sum.  But yesterday was the last and dual final time I will be coming here.    1st - they now charge $1 per person for tea, which normally I wouldn't mind, I understand tea gets expensive and can add up.  But the jasmine tea tasted like hot water with a hint of color to it, no Jasmine taste what so ever.   Service is slow and servers all looked unhappy. I'm Chinese, and trust me I'm used to Asian restaurants with bad or no service, it just comes with dining at an Asian restaurant. Especially Chinese.  But this has got to be the worst I've had in a long time.   Sat down, was asked what kind of tea would you like. Not aware $1 per person. I ordered the stream rice rolls with cilantro n green onion with the server.  15 minutes went by, not a single food cart. Entire restaurant 4 carts, steam cart, congee cart, miscellaneous food,  and Chinese broccoli cart.  The ladies were pushing them like the wheels were broken or something!  Finally the stream cart came by. We ordered 8 dishes my Mom, boyfriend, n myself) figured we load up since it took so long.  The same cart with the same food came by 3 times after that, no new items.  I asked for steamed tripe, and shrimp rice rolls and she looked around at the other carts and said "I don't have it."    I finally get my order of cilantro and green onion rice roll, only to see a plan ol' plate of steam rolls, no herb. I told the lady I wanted cilantro n green onion. She walked up to the waitress that I placed my order with and told her next time not to write the word white in the order, white means plan. The waitress then comes over to the table and says, "the lady just started working a few days ago so she made the mistake. We have to make your another one."  In the meantime, no other carts came by but the 4 carts that had nothing that sparked my interest. Asked for egg custard tarts, nothing. Not a single one to be found. As time pasted, I got more and more frustrated as I watched the lady bring out cilantro green onion rice rolls to all the other tables that were seated AFTER us!  The table next to us had 5 orders of egg tarts delivered to their table.  So I decided to place one order and ask for the check...we were fed up at this point.   The waitress took the check to tally up and added the order of egg custard to the bill.  She came back and said 15 minutes wait for the egg tarts.  So damn frustrated I said NO!  I can't wait anymore, I have to leave now (by now it's 90 minutes).  She walked away, went up to the cashier, came back n said ok 6 minutes ok because she already added the tarts on your bill.  I finally said fine and agreed.  15 minutes later...no tart in sight and the waitress kept dodging our table because she knew I was trying to get her attention.  Finally got her attention and she went to get them. I felt played for a fool.    $50 later and we were all still some what hungry. Because of this almost 2 hour lunch, I was almost late to work.    NEVER EVER EVER AGAIN!!!!!!!

7sJJvUhl9nZl1a-KBuqKSg.text: Bummed.  We took our family here for Christmas and the food was good, the service was ok.  Recently went back for my sis's 30th b-day and the service was deplorable.  They got our order wrong and before they had even fixed the issue, the staff was eating and counting tips. When we asked for a specific soup the waiter refused, saying we would not enjoy it.  When I asked him why, he couldn't give me an answer.  The wine selection is embarrassing.  We won't be back.  The dim sum and service is better at Beijing Noodle 9 at Caesar's Palace.

BlNntl7zySOjorxUDEhxnw.text: Great Chinese food dim sum was ok har  gow was kinda off but Sui mia was on point also had the fried rice fun was good and the fried noodles with chicken I would definitely come back for more...

uMl7nT-c_YUTOZsJiU_0vw.text: Overall, Kj dimsum is an average dimsum place. But I have to bump its ratings up because it is in a Casino and the service was excellent. We went on a Sunday afternoon and a few tables were occupied at the time. We basically had 4 carts chase us to our table as soon as we were seated which was great.  The prices are fair and the quality was what you would expect.  I think this is better than PingPangPong over at the Gold Coast.

lhgyv-8CjRV-WRyF2FHMXQ.text: We went to KJ inside the RIO Hotel and Casino.  I think they have couple other locations in Vegas.    We were looking for a place for dimsum and the Chinese dealer at Bally's recommanded KJ.  We were there around noon on Monday and waited for about 10 minutes for a table.  There were a dozen people before us and the wait wasn't too bad.  Once inside and seated a waitor came and asked what type of teas would we like and we order the usual iron buddha tea.  The seating is confortable.  Tables ae well spread out.  Did not feel crowded although the place is pack.  The dimsum was suprisingly good.  I think better than Ping Pang Pong at Gold Coast.  The food tastes freshly made and flavorful.    Once thing I noticed that set this place apart from many others is that the waiters come to check on the tea pot quite often which is a good thing because usually you have to call them to refill the pot.  Didn't have to at all at this restaurant.  Service was fast and courtesy.  Did not go there for dinner so can't say if the experience would be the same.  Next time in Vegas, definetely will go there for dimsum.

qAmF4xVaKWmsL5G8qP1cOw.text: Food is good. Servers walk around restaurant with dimsum carts and kept heated/ steamed. I like how they do that so we can have faster service and pick which varieties we want while it's all there. Clean environment so u know the quality of the food was handled well. I noticed they stay busy and that's a plus. I learned from a friend that some chinese restaurants are sketchy with dirty dining, so she recommended me this place because they are under a hotel and casino establishment which means they have to have qualities set high if they want to keep open under a big name industry. Safe, clean, fast and tasty. Price is decent here

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dimsum! Fresh off the cart lol

DDYBSZt0cLffARzbN6nUGg.text: Where was all the food today? My husband were there for 45 minutes and only 1 cart came by...twice. We ended up asking the lady for other items that we wanted and she went and got a couple of them for us.  Har gow (shrimp dumpling) was not available.   Other tables consisted of Chinese speakers who didn't wait for the carts to come around (the carts really weren't moving) and we're ordering from whoever they could stop. If you can flag down a waiter and lost all of the items you want, then your table will have food. If you want carts to visit your table, then you will be waiting a long time.   The food was bland! I got fried taro, bean curd, a shrimp roll, and shu Mai and it was all bland. I was looking forward to ordering triple as much food but after getting to taste the few items they had, I decided not to.   Even for Chinese standards, this place is bad. Don't go. But if you want to try it, avoid the weekends.

9Jv-Gz4bMKl7IuLq-4-Ixw.text: Maybe I'm a dim sum snob because I'm from the Bay Area and am fortunate to have eaten great dim sum. Other than in the Midwest, this may be some of the worst dim sum I've eaten. When frozen dumplings from Trader Joe's or the Asian supermarket taste better, you have a problem. Unless you really have a hankering for dim sum and can't get it anywhere else where you live, I would recommend eating something else.  This is located inside the Rio, across the from the buffet. We didn't have a problem getting a table for 7 when we arrived around 11 am but there was a wait when we left around noon.  The service for the carts was extremely slow - I don't know if that's normal, or if was a function of where we were sitting.  Best Dishes:  Har Gow - Shrimp Dumpling - This actually tasted normal, and 4 pieces per order. The size of each dumpling was smaller than you usually get elsewhere.  Crab & Shrimp Dumpling - This was one of my favorites from what we ordered.  Mediocre / Nothing to Write Home About: Sticky Rice in Lotus Leaf, Steamed BBQ Pork Buns, Chinese Broccoli, Shrimp in Rice Noodle (the rice noodle portion was a bit on the thick side and the shrimp was a little sparse)  Pass: Fried Calamari - this tasted like it had been deep fried yesterday and nuked in the microwave. Not fresh at all. Veggie Dumplings - These actually have shrimp in there, but the veggies and shrimp didn't taste very fresh.  The one saving grace was that it was inexpensive - our bill pre-tip was $65 for 7 people, but you also get what you pay for. The food was edible, but I wouldn't crave this or make a special trip to go here. There are far better places to eat in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Har Gow - Shrimp Dumpling

kpV96BP-J-AKC0lc8cI6FQ.text: Great Dim Sum! Great service! Nice location--ambience, decor, convenient! Located right at the entrance of the Rio--you don't even have to walk through the casino to get to it.   We were seated right away. We had the shrimp noodle, shrimp har gow, shui mai, and steamed BBQ pork bun. But, the best item was definitely dessert; the egg custard buns were absolutely delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Oyn2FIjFjo1WM4kUxoyNGg.text: Pricey, mediocre at best. Homemade potstickers are OK, not amazing. Clams with ginger-scallion sauce are good quality, but the sauce is a too oily and unappealingly thick and not usable as a sauce you would actually eat on your rice. If you must, get the black bean sauce and request 'low oil'. You'll probably get 'high saliva' ha ha ;) House Lo Mein comes out kind of oily as well. Again, ask for 'low oil' if you gotta get it.  Management is a bit odd, a holdover trait from the original Spring Mountain Road location where you get a completely different menu w/no specials (and a fork) if you don't speak Chinese.  Dim Sum here is pretty average - it may even make you realize that you don't actually like Dim Sum. Kind of like jazz. We're told that it's good and that we should appreciate it, but the nuts of it are that it kind of sucks. Eating lukewarm food that was cooked 5 hours ago off of a rolling cart is just dumb.  If you're hankering for Chinese and are staying in the Rio, you're probably better off hitting the Rio Buffet and at least getting some crab legs out of the deal.   Free tea is cool. Good on them. I was expecting to get snuck for at least $2 per tea drinker, but didn't.

DytvARvTwHcwZMOMJd99hw.text: Really, really good for inside of a casino with pretty good service. Yay! Full and Happy.

fA8s8HGw5XOARHNpM7CVPg.text: Drama in the room! My extended family came rolling in here 20 people deep to have dim sum on a busy Saturday. The restaurant was packed to the brim with people at the tables and a large crowd waiting inside and out. We had two tables split between us all. We ordered Chrysanthemum tea and iced waters. They came to the table with red solo cups  which I found a little hilarious. But they only had the same three carts rotating for the entire time we were there. The food was mediocre at best. Towards the end we special ordered shrimp rolls (ha churng) because they didn't have any in the carts. So we're waiting for them to arrive. As soon as an order arrives to our table, a guest, from the table across from us, erupted and started screaming at us for getting the order first. He is cussing up a storm and yelling at us. I was so taken aback from his behavior. My family starts to react to his behavior, yelling back at him for being LITERALLY HANGRY! It was so ridiculous. The staff came to restraint and calm the man. It was so embarrassing to watch this guy. But a moment later, he finally got his dish. Smh. Everything after that was ruined. But the food was just not up to par and lacked flavor.

rwykqzk9I8PRNm3V1jH5YA.text: Best dim sum in town at a great price. I visit every time I'm in Vegas. I'm usually the only non Asian person in the room. That's always a good sign of any culturally authentic restaurant. I deducted one star for having to go to the take out counter to pay my tab. I waited 20 mins for a server to bring the check and was almost late to a show. I will still return though.

VyeQJcj6X5ycrKv73Ofa-g.text: Surprisingly really good!!! Even better than LA and San Gabriel Valley area in California! They have different dim sum that I never have tried and very tasty! Best one is the scallop dim sum.

LlGBlw-XNtRu-jQOGaQEBQ.text: Located inside a bright and cheerful dining room in the Rio, and offering much better quality than other dim sum spots in Vegas, I'm a fan of KJ! They will make items for you if you ask, and serve dim sum all day and late into the night. Five of us threw down a pretty eclectic variety of breakfast, my favorite items:  Congee: comforting with Century egg.  Salt and Pepper Squid: perfectly executed. Walnut Shrimp: deliciously decadent!  Shrimp Balls: bite sized balls of goodness :)  Egg Custard: my favorite in Las Vegas.  Red Bean Bun: savory, fluffy bun. Shiu Mau: appreciate the roe.  Chive Balls: not at all greasy.  Sweet Tofu: flavorful without being cloying.  Taro Bun: so very good, real taro flavor.  Chinese Broccoli with Garlic: superfreshTM Sesame Balls: sweet, nutty, tasty balls!  XLB: everyone loved them: I don't eat pork, but they were soupy for sure!   Service is pretty good, they are very busy during weekend prime-time. New items are added to the menu occasionally, and there's more hits than misses, IMO. 3.5* rounded up.  * bright, cheerful & bustling room inside Rio*  ** wide array of dim sum options, served all day (open late- till 2AM DAILY) **   *** will make items for you if asked ***   **** new offerings added to keep it fresh ****

EAp2ESOV3OTXc5jQ_Q4YnA.text: This is my new favorite dim sum place in Las Vegas. First experience, went with my parents. The wait for a table was maybe 10 minutes as I went during prime time for lunch (around 12pm). After I was seated at my table, I ordered the usual things you'd usually get when you go dim sum. Siu Mai, Steamed chicken feet , and sticky rice wrapped w/ lotus leaves. Very fresh, flavored well, and steaming hot ! When even I say hot, its HOT.   The chicken feet were flavored well. Not over seasoned, though tendons still a little chewy (could have used a few more minutes in the steamer) but still pretty well done.   The pork siu mai was topped with some masago (capelin roe). Steaming hot. Flavor was good. The pork was "chewy", not in a bad sense but it has a slight resistance that shows it was made properly. There is a fairly decent size shrimp piece in there as well, that was not over cooked.   The sticky rice wrapped in lotus leaves was nice. Wrapped normally with a few lotus leaves. Did not fall apart as i was taking the leaves off. Flavored well, good amount of ingredients inside the sticky rice.   After a few other items were ordered, ranging from a few different buns, shrimp rice noodle, pan fried chives dumpling, and egg tarts.   There were two types of buns i had ordered. One was called (directly translated) leaking sand bun which was made with i believe a salted egg yolk mixture which when you pull apart the bun, the rich, egg yolk mixture oozes out. perfectly made. that's the result you'd look for when you get this bun. hot from the oven, before the bun itself soaks up this yolk mixture. very delicious.   the other bun (directly translated) is called the snow mountain bun. Has a white crust on top with i believe a lotus filling. Very good. Nice and hot off the cart.   The shrimp rice noodle was well-made also. Good thickness to the noodle and a good sized shrimp lined in the middle of the noodle, topped with a soy sauce that was prepared to be slightly sweet.   The pan fried chives dumping is one of my favorite items to get. Parts of the outer skin layer crispy due to the pan fried technique while the size is still nice and soft. The filling had ample amounts of Chinese chives, shrimp, and pork. Seasoned really well, not overpowering the natural tastes of the chives or meats.   Last but not least, is the egg tarts.. Fresh out of the oven, nice flaky golden crust with a glimmering, shiny egg filling in the middle. The crust was warm and flaky but still unable to taste the butter? they use to create the flaky crust mixed with a bite of the the slightly sweet egg center. One of the many favorite dim sum items or snack items among the chinese communities.   Unfortunately this was my first meal, so I didnt get to order much before I was stuffed. I will not hesitate to come back again for another round of dim sum.   A little suggestion, try going with 4-6 people in your party if you want to try a good amount of the dishes they offer during lunch. Lunch is served between 10 AM and 3 PM. Don't hesitate to go early or late ! They will specially prepare the item of your choice even if you don't see it available on the cart.   The prices are very reasonable, especially considering this restaurants sits inside the Rio Casino & Resort. The prices are as followed:  Small: $2.28 Medium: $3.18 Large: $3.98 Special: $4.98  *edit*  I went again recently. One thing to note was the service was quite lacking. Forgotten orders or took a while to serve us.

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crystal Shrimp Dumpling (Ha Gao)
Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Rice Noodle (Ha Cherng)
Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan Fried Chives Dumpling (Gau Choi Gao)

23xgDnyRxxK9fVnKOKZr5w.text: This was the highlight of our eating experience in Las Vegas over our Christmas stay at the Rio. The food and Service was outstanding.   The prices were a little a bit high but in all fairness the quality of the seafood was worth the money.  I can't wait to try this Asian gem again my next time in Las Vegas. Wish I had this place here in San Diego.

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outstanding
Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A 4 1/2 Pounder

iTmo-GlH6nLHQ8_TgcrVJg.text: I have been fan for several years but recently the chicken and duck are no longer as great. Last two recent visits were bad, felt like old meat reheated and served. Miss the old day high food quality.  Dim sum however is still ok to me.

LOnwQBi6VcU7LWzrARgWdQ.text: This review is for dinner service. I pretended I didn't know Chinese and I was treated very differently.   There is a Chinese menu, only given to those who ask. Otherwise an English menu is provided.   We chose the walnut shrimp and the chow fun without gravy. Very small portions and guess what your dish doesn't come with rice .  I have never been to a restaurant where your dinner entree doesn't come with rice. Make sure you order that!   Food pics attached . 4 star for food and 1 star for service, waiters treat you different if you don't speak Chinese! Learn it before you come!

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Walnut shrimp, doesn&#39;t come with rice, small portion for dinner
Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chow fun

8BJgg5DofmBMEDoXZ_fLeQ.text: So I usually am one who likes to prove other reviews wrong, but unfortunately I have to agree with my fellow yelpers.  I had roast duck and expected quite more for a casino restaurant.  My duck was soaked with water and wasn't cooked thorough enough for the meat to fall off the bone.  Sorry, but duck isn't that hard to cook.  My second opinion is that of the staff.  They speak very broken English and it was very hard to communicate about what was on the menu.  I had to make an uninformed decision on what to order, because nobody could understand me.  I also felt rushed to order.  My iced tea tasted stale and was never offered refills.  I came here with another couple and we felt somewhat ignored.  My final complaint was that when the entrees did come, they came separate which is rude for guests who are trying to enjoy each other's company.  Fortunately, I will not be coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I ordered roast duck.

WUPgr-F5QfjmO1KzjRKu_w.text: My favorite dim sum place in Vegas. Even though i usually stay at the rio, I've tried a few places in China town, and I honestly think this is the best. Always fresh, always quick. Their har gaw isn't whole pieces of shrimp like usual, but the egg custard is fire!

wLLYFHUX_v7ieeGSrVbzxw.text: KJ's was the surprise of our trip to Vegas.  We were feeling unmotivated to leave our hotel (as unremarkable as all the other food we've had there was) so we headed down to what we thought would be a safe choice - the buffet.  You can understand our reluctance to leave the relative comfort of a standard breakfast/lunch buffet to try a Chinese restaurant buzzing across the way from us.  Hubby dug up a nugget from his memory bank and suddenly remembered that a coworker of his had mentioned this place and said it wasn't bad.  I guess "it wasn't bad" was good enough for us to defect from the buffet line.  And honestly...it wasn't bad.  It's exactly the same as all the other dim sum places we've had in Orange County:  - Hit or miss dishes (some dishes were overcooked so the skin on the dumplings were way too soggy) - No service for the meek.  Speak up (raise your hand) or you'll sit there without hot sauce, soy sauce or iced water the entire time - Semi-aggressive sales ladies trying to get rid of their wares  No one dish really stood out except maybe the stir fried rice noodles which didn't come with much except scallions and onions (no meat) and cost $6.95.  We happily packed up the leftovers and had it in front of the TV later.  Just be prepared to see people jump the line.  The hostesses seat their friends first (no number required).

VwfHO0wkz03dCE_OeDeZTg.text: They have excellent dim sum at a reasonable price. You know it's good when we drive from downtown to the Rio because your son loves the fried rice and noodles!

WEi79OMOrezloZC9S_NE7Q.text: This place is overpriced and super crowded. You can get the same food at half the price in the same branded Restaurant on spring Mtn.  ,OK, !

8E20BhmGUL4SZ1iiu46H8g.text: We visited this dim sum restaurant while staying in Vegas.... Order some dumpling, steam bbq buns and chicken fried rice. Surprise SURprize ...please look at the photo of the fried rice, do you see any chicken?  When I asked the server that fried rice does not have chicken and his comment was: The Chef here uses chopped chicken, he did not try to take the dish back to the kitchen to fix the problem. highly poor customer service skills at  this location!!!! I do not recommend eating here while staying in Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Here is our bill of $13.95 for chicken fried rice that I never got the chicken....no happy at all.
Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. No chicken at all.....not happy camper!!!!!
Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. No chicken in my chicken fried rice

Kfom_Dm_z30n6qtn8P13Ig.text: Went here on a Saturday afternoon. Never tried a True dim sum restaurant, so I was unprepared for the carts that come around and serve small, hot dishes with a variety of cuisine. We ordered the siomai, which was good. The folks who pushed the carts around did not speak English very well, so I couldn't ask them what dishes they were pushing along. We asked for the regular menu, and I ordered the sweet and sour shrimp, while my wife ordered the chicken chow main. Both dishes were pretty large and absolutely delicious! Our server was super friendly and very attentive. They have TVs showing Asian programming and some sports. We spent 90 bucks there after the tip. It was a different dining experience, and I would definitely go back next time I'm at the Rio. I give it an A for service, an A for the food, a B for the atmosphere since it feels like a  food hall, and a B for the price. It's not priced like your local neighborhood Chinese restaurant, but that ended up being a good thing.

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ez-veb466yTAHNq0m0Nqug.text: We were walking by to check in and the smell was amazing.  Decided to give it a try.  This was the best Chinese food I have had in a long time.  The service was spectacular and our meals were the most flavorful tastes.  We will be back!

VctmAJ1ahHZgyLC9Y-SxXA.text: I really like the place and the decor it's inside the Rio casino across from the Buffet. The Dim Sum is really good but expensive the nice thing is China Town is only a mile away so if I don't have a comp I just drive over to China town

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sign

UBZObFMPL22zwEMNCT9Y3A.text: I was seeing a show at the Rio so wanted to eat somewhere in this hotel, and comparatively, it seems like a decent bet. I looked over all the options, and this looked like a big menu and a classy atmosphere.  It's unfortunate their menu isn't online, but luckily other Yelpers took pics of the menu. It was a little confusing, like under "scallops" they have sauteed scallops and under "sizzling" they had sizzling scallops, so it's hard to tell with no descriptions what the differences are.  I had the shrimp and vegetables and my boyfriend at the scallops and vegetables, which were both fresh and filling even though it doesn't look like a ton of food. The dishes ranged from $17-$20. It cost a couple dollars extra to get rice. The service was okay. At the end we waited a while then flagged down another waiter to ask them to let our waitress know we needed the check (we had a show to get to).  I was on fence between 3 and 4. It seems like a decent option for restaurants in this hotel, but if I compared it to non-Vegas restaurants, the food didn't blow me away. It was serviceable.

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallops with veggies and shrimp with veggies

MjnSP0W6fCT2-4MIxKhTIQ.text: Food was okay.  Literally waited 15 min for our check. No one comes by to check up on you. You have to flag them down.

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cw8cATfgX8X0yzZTmQNdEA.text: So when we've come here in the past it's usually packed, however this trip we arrived at 10:15AM on a Thursday. We were the first people to be seated and three hot full carts were ready and waiting! We felt like VIPs since we had the whole dining hall to ourselves.   The staff was loud and busy, but the service was fast. Don't know if I've eaten so many of my favorite things to fast before! Happy belly!   The hot lava buns are an absolute must!

7RWBPmAZdUVK8yl-anvTFQ.text: The Kung pao chicken was not very spicy. The vegetables were slightly over cooked. The fried rice lacked flavor, even additional soy sauce couldn't save it. The moo shoo chicken had way too much plum sauce. I had to scrape a lot of of it off. I was impressed that I received real Chinese pancakes. They don't offer regular egg rolls, just lobster egg rolls that I didn't care for last time.

R8edtEwT6dK2Z70WY-Pwtg.text: Delicious dim sum selection. My favorites were the egg tarts, shrimp har gow, pork siu mai, beef rice rolls, and the pork sticky rice in banana leaves. The chicken feet were probably my least favorite, although I do love it at other restaurants. They lacked flavor and tastes rubbery and old instead of tender and gelatinous. Other than that, great overall experience.

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HDE6cHECJFw67eVt-6e6Gg.text: The food here is not bad, nothing spectacular, but not bad. I would not consider it traditional Chinese food. Also the portions are not what I would expect of Chinese restaurant, where you typically eat family style and share plates. My family ordered the walnut shrimp and sizzling beef in pepper sauce. Definitely have had better Chinese food, else where.  The service was pretty terrible. The waiter did not really look at us while talking. The waiter who dropped our food off, literally deposited the food on the table and walked off without a word. It was not like the restaurant was busy, so there was no reason for the abruptness. The vibe was that the waiters had something better to be doing. I wouldn't really recommend this place.

ErdvEOO640YuggbsmCFHzQ.text: Everything we ordered was delicious! Orange chicken, beef lo mein, honey (creamy) walnut shrimp, and sweet and sour pork. Service was very good and attentive. We didn't need reservations (hidden gem i guess?). Looking forward to trying the dim sum!

M3PPYOtax_27bNY_TMFzhw.text: I am very surprised to find a delicious restaurant in lasvegas. All the dishes are delicious, affordable, very good service, and often come back to recommend to friends.

3z4VBY0lGRgygQnK8RHa3w.text: Used to come here every time I visited Vegas but somehow never left a review.  Back in the day I'd have a comp and always thought the food tasted much better when it was free or at least prepaid if you know what I'm saying... it is in the city of lost wages!   Back in the day this place would be alway packed especially on a going home Sunday.  This time around my group of 10 were seated and served quickly.  The dim sum carts came by and we were eating almost immediately.  We were seated in a section with a TV which was great since we all had placed our sports bets and were anxious to see if we were going to enjoy a free or expensive meal. Lol   The selection was endless and the freshness was obvious. From the xlbs to the Chinese Broccoli and even the chicken feet, everything was on point.  I noticed the steam coming off of each entree as the staff pushed along all the tasty options.  Eventually we had about 20 different items and the table started to look like an advertisement for the place with so much color.  With help of the lazy Susan my group came hungry and left happy without breaking the bank.  Let's just say my executive decision to have brunch here instead of at the buffet or even at hash house was the best decision of the weekend.  We were ready to head home after an epic bachelor party weekend.  I know I'll be back for sure when I visit again.  Thanks KJ see you soon.

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dim sum goodness

XZz5lcCtC2wOlBV7FDVwvg.text: Always a great Dim Sum experience here. A wonderful variety and consistently very very good. I love when the carts come around it adds to the fun. Jessica is typically one of the servers that ensures you get anything you don't see, she's the best! If you haven't gone, go. Be open and try the different small plates

KLJQL7DDFRXSlQ_Itxd9-A.text: The food is decent here but the service is always a disappointment.   They botch my carry out and told me 20 minutes.  Then when I showed up they didnt have any record of my order.  Then told me my order didn't exist.  I asked for a coke for the wait, and she brings me out a half full glass of diet coke and tells me I have to drink it there.  I just walked out with my mediocre food.

eNPKEaeE4VcUbo7FrUOQhg.text: Or original order was good and came out quickly.  We enjoyed the pot stickers so much we ordered a second one.  Long wait, and when it came it was chicken and not pork.  When we complained to 3 different waiters, they said it was the same as before.  They only told us we were wrong and did not remove the charge.

CkHrbdCL1XvtAjsbNAg2fQ.text: The food is good and the price is okay, sometimes you get to wait a bit to get a table but nothing to crazy. The only thing I dont like is the service, the  servers are rude and takes forever for them to get your order, and every single time you ask for something is like is the hardest job ever... we asked for some hot sauce and the guy brought it to us, we asked for another one so we would have one on ea side of the table, well the guy brought us two more instead and with an attitude. Not coming back because of the service that's for sure but I'll be coming back for the food!

THp4aoUZG8R2jXxgS7R2qg.text: This is not my favorite dim sum place in vegas.. I prefer ping pang pong but it's consistent and there's never really a wait. If I want something that's fast with no fuss this is the place to go for me.   Kj's space is huge with lots of tables. They serve dim sum in carts. I really like their rice noodle rolls, the spare ribs and the congee. Their dumplings are flavorful and fresh as well too.   If you order seafood here, like items with shrimp, it doesn't taste the freshest  the meat is a little rubbery because it's most likely frozen before.  It's not bad at all but it's also not the best.   Prices here are reasonable and service is really fast. I will say that they don't have that much variety.  There were about 4 to 5 carts in the restaurant but items are a little redundant.

Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rice noodles with shrimp, spareribs and bean curd rolls with pork
