JyTkd38BCCkcnzlyuSaKEw.text: If I remember correctly this place is located inside a casino. I had the beef varieties and it was mushy which means it's not fresh. I eat dim sum all the time and being a chinese I'm really no stranger to dim sum. I would come here only if there's no better option.

XiYZDbo5RCBQ7NeiD_CIXg.text: So this place is connected with the Rio hotel. Parking is free right outside the building. Inside is large, very open and clean. We got there around 1 pm which is still busy hour but today we were seated while we walk in. We were greeted promptly for drinks. Cart ladies were quick and not too pushy. We ordered the usual and all were delicious. Staffs were great, friendly and quick to help.   4 stars because they ran out of egg tarts and I had to wait for a new batch, which took about 30 minutes. But one server was very mindful and kept checking up on us for anything else.

xnvIqrQdzztYxHKxbb9JWw.text: I've been here twice and the food is great. We loved the siomai, xiao long bao and the green vegetables with sauce (bokchoy) are our favorites. The ladies strolling the carts were so patient and nice. Shoutout to SAMMIE for being an excellent server, she was on point with our orders and water refills. We'll definitely come back again for future Chinese cravings when in Las Vegas.

Akm4-uDoM_xJm3kDcSsZ8Q.text: I have had Chinese food all over the country and my mom's, this place is average.  Went there for dinner, food was okay but service was rude.  They ran out of chicken dumplings and the waiter was rude to us when we were trying to decide on something else to order.   He didn' t even give us a menu to look it over at least.  Rice is an extra charge. We ordered black bean scallops, pan fried noodles with chicken, deep fried shrimp balls, and the chicken/pork dumplings.  Scallop portion was very small, the noodles and dumplings were average.

3EmgOXnX1asGGBxhdS6xAg.text: Worst service ever. Went there on a Saturday night for dinner at about 6 pm. We got seated and waited about 15 minutes for someone to come ask us what we wanted for drinks so we tried to order food at the same time and the server just walks away. We ordered 4 dim sum plates, roasted duck, and beef chow fun.   The dim sum plates came out first. The ribs undercooked with the meat pink, shrimp was also undercooked. As for the beef chow fun, they half assed cooked it, from what it looked like they cooked the noodles separately and the beef, vegetable and sauce just getting dumped over. Sorry I'm not stupid, I eat it enough at other places to know that the noodles aren't white if it has been mixed with the sauce. Roast duck was super dry. HORRIBLE SERVICE and FOOD preparation. I couldn't even get a refill on water either. No racial but my gf and I were maybe a few of the couple asians(like 7) in there with the majority being white. When it came time to asking for the check it was like waiting in line at the dmv. C'mon now half the restaurant was empty and these fools can't even get me a bill? We really thought about just getting up and leaving. This place must treat people like this all the time cause they probably know tourist will stop by once but sorry I'm a LOCAL and not going back. NEVER AGAIN.

t9EFLbZjnVd8biIMGw2WzQ.text: Excellent Cantonese dim sum! Fast and very inexpensive. Why no bottled water?

_UoMBXYQDlmN9kLpCDl2cQ.text: I liked this place a lot. Besides the fact that its SUPER cheap, the food is pretty decent. After reading some of the other reviews I would suggest you take someone that is really familiar with dim sum or is Chinese. Otherwise who knows what you will get because most of the staff does not speak English...

IMcs87r3un0ChpPfujZZUQ.text: We were here for the carnival world buffet, but line was terribly long. This restaurant located right across from the buffet, so we made the wrong wrong decision to fill our stomach.  Service: We waited for some time until someone came up from the restaurant to assign us a table. The dinning area wasn't full at that time, so obviously they were  understaffed. It was also very hard to get waiters' attention *any time*. I asked for something not on the menu to get a vegetable dish and also asked how much it would that be. The waiter told me it would be $10ish. Then he suggested Treasure Island Pea Sprout. I assumed it would have a similar price and didn't ask further. However, we found that this dish costed $10 more expensive. They also forgot our dimsum order, which was also printed on the bill. Given that this restaurant didn't even have a line waiting at the door, this mistake is not acceptable.   Food: Their food was on the salty side, such as seafood eggplant in a claypot, Cantonese style beef. They taste good with rice, though. The green bean dish we got was half raw. Chow fun and Yang-chow fried rice was good. However, they are not even par to average in the line of Chinese food IMO. It could be that I am spoiled by SF  Chinese food. There's no free dessert, but there are fortune cookies when checkout.   Price: This place is overpriced given the food quality and service.   If you are craving for Asian food, I would recommend dropping by the Asian food court around Chinatown mall on Spring Mountain Rd. Food/price is much better/more reasonable there.

mbEDaIIs85xNXboNFb7uKA.text: Not bad for dim sum.  Very clean and new. Food is pretty decent. I would give it 3.5 stars. Big open space with many large tables for your large dim sum groups.  Doesn't seem too busy until the weekends.  Parking right in front of it sucks.

9FEMDDf2eA5sdm4qGt1ZKA.text: We needed to get some lunch so we sought out a place close to where we were staying. The Rio was just up the road from us so we decided to investigate the restaurants in that casino.  The first place we ran into was the buffet, but directly across from it was KJ Dim Sum & Seafood.  We arrive around noon so dim sum was in full force. Many carts going around the tables. We were so excited to see so many Asian faces, we knew we hit the jackpot. Every dish we got was so good. We just wished we had bigger stomachs.  If ever in the area again we will certainly hit this spot again.

yvM390dARRE_SCD9f1nmqA.text: Family style food. The meal it self was great but they had no dim sum and the ordering process was a bit confusing.

RQeBYAPPQgUpdODfvpbXUA.text: After reading several positive feedback about this place, I decided to drag my husband and kids to KJ Dim Sum & Seafood.   Service: service was excellent. several times the waitress/waiter came to our table to make sure that we were doing fine. they even poured my husband's hot green tea for him.  Food: I fell in love with this place the second after tasting their mongolian beef. We also  ordered half a crispy duck, walnut shrimp (a must try...and my new fav dish!), shrimp balls and shu mai dim sum. They were so good!  Price: We ordered 3 main course and a few dim sum and our total came out to $64.  Overall--excellent service and delish food! The ambiance was very homey and relaxing--even with 3 small children! Will definitely come back again!

y3n8M5xw1zpnP6BB6HusIg.text: Found this restaurant on yelp and decided to give it a try since it's at Rio.  It's a nice large authentic Chinese restaurant.  Good service.  It's not just a tourist restaurant targeting the casino visitors. Locals go there, too.  It was packed during lunch hours for Dim Sum.  We waited for almost an hour for a table.  Dim Sum was authentic and good.  Price was reasonable.  The egg tarts were the best, very flaky shells with many layers.  They don't make them often so they are not in the carts that going around. We had to order them.  Dim Sum was 5 star.  We also had dinner here.  It was less busy at dinner time.  There is no wait for a table.  The waiter took our orders of 2 dishes quickly.  He was like rushing us to order.  Then we waited for a long time, more than half an hour for our food to come.  This is very slow for Chinese restaurant.  The food good, not great, and not special either.  Dinner was 3 star.

2mw6xjAicds61jmKknlOog.text: Ate there Saturday, March 16th - 13. Checked yelp for reviews - all good. I did not have that experience. I found the offerings bland and uninspired as well as very expensive for dim sum. When I asked for Saracha sauce - a staple item in dim sum restaurants, they told me they didn't have any. I asked for whatever hot sauce they had - they had none. The food - stir fried rice noodle and cabbage - flavorless. Pressed and fried shrimp and pork dumplings - flavorless. Chinese Broccoli - cooked perfectly. Bill for these three items - $23 - all cart items. I'm not new to dim sum - have it once a month for years. This was the worst excuse I've experienced. I should note that the service was excellent and friendly. This is a management issue.

7H8cVqePlSlJySGSYMp8hQ.text: Food was nothing spectacular, fairly bland for chinese food....   most of the food was cold... service was actually not that good....   they didn't expect us to understand Chinese....    SMH...   waiter was surprised when I spoke Chinese to him... they asked each other why they didn't get us high chairs...   but it might be the best place to get some decent Chinese food

ZSqFE4kCjnXzwsEQXEswuQ.text: The service is by far the rudest and slowest I have ever experienced, and they were not at all busy. The waiters, yes several of them, were extremely unfriendly. They acted as though we were uninvited guests. I'm not sure what was mushier, the noodles or the beef; easily the worst Chinese food I've eaten.

YbCzjeGKxScoYpVUAmPfUA.text: This place is terrible. We went there for din sum, but it turned out ther was no more din sum then. We stayed anyway and ordered five dishes for 4 persons. One of the dish, steamed fish, was recommended by the waiter. We asked about the price and the waiter told us it would be $38, about 2 lbs. So, we said ok. The fish dish took a long time and we were joking that they must have gone fishing. When it finally came, we were mostly full. Then came the bill, and there was a $104 dish! We were really surprised and asked what it was. It was the fish! It was supposed to be $38/lb, and the fish weighed 2.7 lb! The fact was none of us heard that it was $38 per pound. The bill was presented to us by someone we had not seen, and the waiter was nowhere to be seen. When we questioned the bill, another person came up and said something like "of course it was $38 per pound..." No apology even for confusion or anything like that sort. We paid the bill, feeling cheated. Now coming to think of it, the fish could not have weighted 2.7 lbs. I often steam fish myself and a 2 lb fish is already pretty big, and our fish that day was at most 2lbs. I would give it no star if possible.

ZiutDuOTWXPtliMBTefLtg.text: been here with friends ,, service was ok, i have to remind the server two times for the drinks, but food was good.. still an okay dimsum place to eat..

IhjnQN8zEv03dwC51V1rCg.text: This place measures miles above the rest of the dim sum places in the Las Vegas area, and beats most I've tried in the San Gabriel valley in the LA area.  Higher prices but well worth it considering the consistently awesome food, clean and well-appointed decor/ambience, and superb service.  My 'Go-To' for Dim Sum as a Las Vegas local.

DVr7XXhWvtmgSMZbNLih0w.text: Wonderful service, not only were they quick, but also very polite and efficient. Plenty of carts and every item seem to be made fresh and hot.

s5Y3Y1VbyJEM4tC-y68faQ.text: Kj Dim Sum was great. The service was very good too. I'd recommend the restaurant to tourist(s) who would like to stay close to the strip.

x3dTnQ2rOA48mohIfoKnVg.text: Had dinner at KJ dimsum & Seafood before going to Penn & Teller when our scheduled dinner choice was unexpectedly closed.  Pleasantly surprised, nice setting, despite being across from the Carnival World Buffet.  Menu had good breadth of selections, quick and good attentive service, excellent value (cheapest meal we had while in Las Vegas!)  Food was excellent.  I'll have to come back and try the dimsum too.

V2MCL_oMmAGm6svLZO6YgQ.text: The Dim Sum here is comparable with Cathay House and Chang's. It's average.  The plus at KJ's is that everything wasn't cold when served.  Another plus it that it's new and clean. It was extremly busy on a Tuesday afternoon and we waited about 20 minutes for a table.  The prices here are a bit higher than Cathay or Chang's.

jzGZ8LfJ-XA-IYgKps_cTg.text: If there was a way I could give less than a star I would. This restaurant was awful. Words can describe he experience I had that establishment.   First the service was awful. Waiter couldn't even speak English. Second food was mediocre. And third and most important, not only did I get sick from the food, but I was so sick I missed my flight back to my home town.    I will NEVER eat here again, and after is said and done never eat Chinese food ever again.

LQu2k7kSjBK1PUwWIkUSrw.text: Arrived at Rio hotel past 12pm, almost all restaurants were closed so for convenience and the only opinion was here. Neutral feeling at first, but the staffs, I don't know if they were tired or just was having a bad day they were really slow with everything bringing in the food or just a glass of water and there was only us and this one other group. Once my uncle asked about a dish he didn't know the waiter just simply said it was good.   The worst part was that I didn't get to eat some dim sum because they said they didn't serve them past midnight which is absurd since this restaurant has the word Dim Sum in their name.  Well other than the service, the place was actually big, clean and the foods were actually good.

0oIqihY7zRjUlbvOpCznyA.text: This dim sum place is sooo good. It may seem confusing at first but everyone was helpful in getting you all the plates you want. Don't come on a Sunday, it's so busy and can be a hectic brunch. Overall the steam pork bun and the shumai are a must and don't forget the Egg custard buns for dessert.

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steam Pork Bun is great with tea.

Dx6gdkm-1PBziiaJUaASaw.text: I stayed here at Rio Casino. So decided to having dim sum here as my second time at KJ dim sum place which located inside the casino right next to Rio seafood buffet. just for so convenience. The dim sum items are small portion. especially the most important ones like Ha Gor and Shu Mai. food wasn't that good and quality wasn't as good either. very nice and clean restaurant. nothing much special. kind of pricey. good service.

WUZz2o3W03NYjkbHjKlMyQ.text: One of my favorite spots in vegas.  It is inside the RIO, so plenty of parking.    The carts are continuously moving thru the dinning room.  Wonderful selection, wonderful textures and flavors.  My only issue is that most of the women with the carts speak only halting english.  As an adventurous dinner, this is heaven since I often won't have a clue what is being placed on my plate.  what will be inside my dumpling?  Pork?  Shrimp?  Something else?  doesn't matter, They all taste GREAT!

0pUF4xzfkGVwZUybVNdzWg.text: This is the only place I would eat dim sum in Vegas because how fresh and yummy the food is, cleanliness, parking and service. I have been coming here shortly after they opened, so it has been a couple years now. Time to write them a review.   Food- everything I have tried was fresh and yummy. I personally love leek and taro, so I really enjoy their leek items here. I have the following list that I order every time I go.  1.Teochew Dumplings ()-- I enjoy their Teochew dumplings every time I go. This is a dumplings with clear noodle wrap and filled with leek, water chestnut and pork.   2.Pan fried Leek Dumplings()--love their pan fried leek dumplings as well. It's perfectly made with enough leek and meat to make it juicy not dry. 3. Shrimp in rice noodle wrap ()-- this dish tastes the same at most dim sum places you go but their shrimp is a decent size. This item is on a must list whenever I go to dim sum as well. 4. Fried Taro pastries -- the crunchiness of the outside and the moist/ soft taro inside, yummy!!!! This dish is not a dessert, the taro inside is seasoned with salt and other stuff.  5.Shumei -- their shumei is decent. I would say it's better than most places in Vegas but somehow I still love shumei from Jasmine inside of Bellagio the best.  6.Shrimp dumplings/ Haogow-- it's also a must ordered dish when I go to dim sum. It's not too bad here also.  7. Sticky rice wrapped in leaf -- I love sticky rice and this dish here is decent as well. Definitely give it a try. 8.Pineapple Buns -- I order this item from time to time. They have green tea flavor now which is different and interesting. 9. Tofu Dessert soup -- I love tofu and they are very generous with the portion. Silky tofu in ginger and sugar soup. Yummy. 10. Last not least. The famous Egg Tarts -- I love love love their egg tarts here. Majority of time when I ordered, it's hot and fresh like they just came out of oven. I have not tried egg tarts from golden gate bakery but this is one of the best that I tried before. Although I do wish they have Portuguese egg tarts here!   Services-- they are usually busy so they are not as attentive as I would like them to be but they are usually very friendly even though you don't speak Cantonese. Unlike some other places in town, if you don't speak Cantonese In a Cantonese restaurants, you get some kind of attitude :/.   Environment -- the place is big and clean. Also its got many TVs in here.   All in all, I love this place. When I visited Koi Palace in SF (the famous dim sum place), I was not happy with an hour wait, the attitude was bad and the food was just okay. KJ dim sum you rock!

g1SrJOwxjoppEgD-16Tg7w.text: I went because of the shrimp in the picture and I've never done dim sum service. They don't have the shrimp from the photo! And they don't do dim sum after 3pm service was between average and below average and price was kinda high for no sides or rice with items!

fzuFVhhQ61sUzdmhVjaCnQ.text: Second time being here earlier today, I usually go the other dim sum place that's 24 hours off Sahara. It's been years I went here and forgot how it tasted, then again if it sucked I wouldn't have returned. When our food arrived to the table, everything was great! This has got to be the best tasting dim sum I've had in LV & back home in CA. Service is great, always had waiters/waitresses checking on us & refilling our drinks before the glass was almost fall empty. This is my go to dim sum place from now on every Vegas trip.

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lm_GHzq8ZmDqcYUPHHkI5g.text: Better than Chang's...except for the price.  We were really craving dim sum and the dim sum at Caesar's palace buffet just didn't cut it. If you're used to really good dim sum from Norcal, this place just won't do...however if you're used to dim sum anywhere else, this might be okay.  Like every dim sum place, there's hits and misses. Their baked bbq pork buns? Good. Chicken feet? Not bad, but i've had better. Sticky rice in lotus leaf? flavorless. Shrimp dumplings (har gow)? Tasty but incredibly small. Chinese Broccoli with oyster sauce? Surprisingly good! Tofu pudding? Texturally disappointing...not smooth at all!   for 5 people we spent about $100. Yeah, we ordered beef chow fun and chicken wings but wow...$100 for dim sum?!?! I guess I should have expected as much seeing that this is a casino.  The service as others have mentioned is pretty crappy but if you're used to authentic Chinese restaurants you know that long as you're teapot is filled, that's all you can really ask for.

Ukm08JMZn85lBZUQGopEsA.text: If you're looking for Dim sum come here,everything was delicious , this place has good service and is very clean.

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eZzbrUF_NpZSR9V0JWrvMw.text: Authentic and nice for a city with no dim sum but the har gau is a bit small and had a taste like lotus leaf as though instead of being steamed on parchment paper they were steamed on cabbage or lotus leaf- these were disappointing but the shrimp dishes and tofu claypot were really good. This would get 4 stars but the service was really slow and not that friendly. I had to ask three times for hoi sin and the tea came out warm instead of hot they need to tweet some dishes to get a 4 and I hope they do!!

XNXLmfpKxHvqgWt5ickZvQ.text: I was thinking of giving KJ 3.5 stars, but I rounded it to 4 because of the great company with whom I had brunch here on Saturday.  The carts came around often with good selections.  I am happy I got to go again for dim sum with a Chinese speaking friend.  There's no language barrier and they often know what to order or what to avoid.  Such was the case Saturday with Li Ly, our friend who is moving back to San Francisco and the reason 7 of us got together for brunch.  We had shrimp dumplings, pork dumplings, sesame balls, sweet buns, and some good shrimp balls.  I don't know the Chinese names for any of these, but they were generally good.    We had fairly good service although Li Ly had to dig her heels in and get the service we needed.  I like the room.  It's well appointed and the decor is bright and roomy.

Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Some new dishes added.
Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Part of the dim sum in the first go round.

N9xzvh5pD7gWG7k9CxSWOw.text: Best dim sum food thus far. Service is great. The rice soup is very good and the ha cao is also tasty. The shrimps used here is pretty big compared to other places.

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lMSwI_a8Fxy5NbfVIJtlGA.text: Dim sum palace close to the strip in a casino!  Very authentic, I heard that the casino hospitality president wanted to do a Chinese restaurant right so he got HK restauranteur Danny Leung Nhan and gave him considerable liberty and funding to repeat his successful formula.  That entailed stealing some talented Chinatown chefs to bring that authenticity which they aren't able to have otherwise.  So did it payoff?   The Good: Shrimp hargow: Check pork ribs: Check (Yum!) Sticky rice in lotus leaves: Check  Rice noodle in shrimp: Check Fried tarot root cake: Check (Yum!) Egg custard tarts: Check (Yum!) Mistranslated menu: Check  The Bad: The price (?): a little more than SGV or chinatown (though not much) but you should expect that Service: Really nice for the most part, except the hostess asked if I wanted a lunch menu and never came back with one though she did apologize after remembering 20 min later.  Also, they added jasmine tea to my bill then removed it after I told them I didn't order or receive any tea  Overall a really impressive experience for a large Casino Chinese place, though I don't really mind driving to Chinatown and I hardly go or stay at the Rio so it's not that more convenient.  It was nice to see a place "get it" though to cater to their Chinese gambling clientele, and looking at the menu I'd come back again to try their seafood dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. What&#39;s Spanril you say (#80)? It&#39;s supposed to be Sparerib duh! At least you know it&#39;s an authentic Chinese restaurant

WnxChVvu-xQEfkRtC4PeMg.text: Food was decent and satified my dimsum craving taste buds. Service was a little on the slower side. Usually when I have dimsum I've usually had the food carts coming to me before I sit down. Prices were reasonable and food tasted fresh.

j9FoVsON-y6xmS0de5tCPg.text: Pretty good dim sum.  I come here whenever I come to Vegas.  At times it does get crowded and the food does disappoint but majority of the time it's on point.  I would recommend eating here over any other dim sum restaurant as I literally have already tried them all.

nT6V3MtfQKDgzYt1EFCryA.text: Came here for the weekend because everyone said that it was really good. And they have really good dim sum........  So for everyone to know, they serve Dim Sum from 10:00 AM to 3:00 PM. When you walk in its totally like an asian feel. There are many tables and the space is huge!! Great for large parties! They do have a better variety of dim sum and siomai than Orchid Gardens. But I honestly like Orchid Garden better, and the food really tasted the same. We ordered the pork and shrimp siomai, shrimp chow mein, egg flour soup, chinese broccoli, shrimp dumpling. Everything was fresh don't get me wrong and it was really good, but i just rather prefer Orchid Garden. In my opinion.  Menu was really pricey, if you were to order soup it was like $20. but i guess that's what you pay for when you're on the strip. If you're visiting and you're near the Rio then yes try out this place. But if you're a local don't waste your money and time driving here.
