KviYS_3sCORdM9o66zv8Yg.text: Horrible horrible service !!!  Skip this place. I have never been in a place where I was not checked on .. we like the other kj better. Horrible !   Might as well serve ourselves

qZfVYUyS_9NbTCTMnep_bQ.text: I haven't tried many other dim sum restaurants in Las Vegas, but from what I've tried here, it's not bad.  It's acceptable dim sum considering that it's Las Vegas.  Everything was pretty average in terms of taste; nothing really stood out.  The service was good though and the decor was great.  If you need to satisfy your dim sum cravings, it's acceptable to come here.

6vJ6fzDn4dCzCKwQdVmS2w.text: This place was very good.  We came for lunch for the dim sum. There were three of us, so we ended up with a $60 bill, which averaged $20 a person. Not bad for tons of food.   When it comes to Dim Sum, I like the fried taro the most, and theirs did not disappoint. Other items worth mentioning were the duck, fried rice, shrimp wontons, pork BBQ bun, and the taro donut and egg custard desserts. I don't know all the authentic names, so forgive my ignorance. I just know they were good!

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Variety of items from Dim Sum. Yum!

52H5W1BjRcDnGtKc1--rfw.text: Pretty busy for a Monday morning. Got seated right away. I am not only amazed with the service. Constant follow up with table clearing, refilling hot water for my tea and changing plates.  The dim sum was pretty good as well. Chicken feet, steamed shrimp noodles was nice and thin. All items brought out from the cart was steaming hot.   Best staff service I have encountered.

KkHDu6Wo38Awt3dEjGfVTg.text: Truly bad, bad Chinese food. Not sure why anyone would give this place a good review. But maybe if you're staying in the Rio, you're not all that picky.   First off the Dim Sum is only served until 2pm. They think this is "authentic", but that desire for authenticity doesn't carry over to the food. The rest of the dishes are just bad. I defy you to find any lobster in their "lobster egg rolls". They're basically big spring rolls.   Trust me, go elsewhere for Chinese. The prices here aren't even good, so you can get far better other places nearby. I'd suggest Red 8 at the Wynn. Much, much nicer and way better food, at the same prices. Trust me, you deserve better than this place.

lkmWhD4RQm66lvjXNJxMog.text: The wife and I love dim sum.  We decided to try KJ Dim Sum & Seafood for lunch given its location at the Rio, where we were staying because the wife was there for a conference, and the fact that we'd both never been there before.  We arrived around 11AM on a Sunday.  The spacious dining wasn't close to capacity, but filled up steadily while we were there, seemingly with multi-generational, local families far more than out of town guests staying at the Rio.  KJ Dim Sum operated like most every other dim sum restaurant with multiple carts loaded with various dumplings and other small plate specialties making the circuit around the dining room.  The food was hot and delicious.  In truth, I thought all of their offerings tasted equal to or better than our usual go-to dim sum place, Ping Pang Pong's.  What truly set KJ Dim Sum apart from every dim sum restaurant than I've ever been to in the country was the service.  Our server always kept our water glasses and pot of hot tea filled without us ever having to ask.  Sure, it may be a little thing, but having been to more than few dim sum restaurants, the service was noticed and very much welcomed by me.   KJ Dim Dum & Seafood impressed us so much, we returned for a mid-week lunch with one of her fellow conference attendees.  Our experience was probably even better the second time around since parties of three seem to be the most optimal size for dim sum allowing us to sample more while likely consuming and paying less than we did when we were only a party of two.  Service was also like our previous visit...on point.  In the end, I was really glad that we gave KJ Dim Sum a try.  It has moved to the top of my list of favorite dim sum restaurants in town.

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ENp3lZ4Gqz7kuqg67qXx_Q.text: Dim sum in Las Vegas...third time's a charm!  Located at the Rio Casino on Flamingo, I tried twice (before this visit) to dine here. Once, there was a private event and another time, they were closed.   This time, we planned to go at Opening time (10am) on a Monday. The spacious, clean restaurant was about half empty at 10:30am.  The carts came quickly, our tummies were happily satisfied, and the service was efficient and relatively pleasant!  Our teapot and water glasses were filled without our asking.  Parking was a bit tricky, but free. Go to the side of the casino across from Gold Coast Casino on Valley View Drive.  We parked in the lot closest to the door...we could see the sign for the restaurant!  My mom, sister, cousin, and roommate all enjoyed the food...especially the custard tarts (don tot)...freshly out of the oven, they were warm and delicious! I didn't care for the XLB - they were almost room temperature and on the bland side. However, my cousin really liked the chicken feet - they were on the spicy side to me. He also liked the cha siu bao because the bread was fluffy. I didn't have any - I was full at that point!  I wouldn't mind returning!  It was a great experience!

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Clean and spacious
Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Custard tarts... warm and yummy!
Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our feast!

6ijl6EwAO0XQHt5iwukp_w.text: It's not my first time here, but it was been long time ago since the last time i was here, and now it showed me a big difference in their service and food. I almost put 1 star , because the server was like he is on a rush and it is not even busy, 4 tables including our table, took our menu without asking if we are done or we might be interested to order more. I gave four stars because of the other server and the cashier, they are so nice and friendly. This two save his rudeness.

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Their alcohol beverage menu upside down!

iJecAluyvKVH2Rv-XtGhPQ.text: Based off of all the reviews on here it looks like this place is a hit or miss. I guess I was just lucky enough that all 4 times that I've eaten here they were all a hit. Yay :) Ive only had dim sum here once and dinner the remaining 3 other visits. All times the manager was there to greet and seat us immediately. Truth be told, I don't really expect alot when it comes to customer service specifically in Chinese restaurants based off of past experiences. But I must say that the service I get here is always excellent. The waiters would take our orders within a few minutes after being seated and the food would always come out hot and fresh. Not once have I experienced eating reheated stale tasting food here. Our glasses were constantly being checked to make sure they were filled and if we wanted any more hot water refills for our teapots. Waitresses here are very patient and if there is something you are unsure of on the menu they will gladly answer your questions. Their english may not be as perfect as some would expect but they do understand & can speak it. Thank you KJ. We will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet &amp; Sour Chicken
Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail
Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bokchoy

mfRA60fswG2e9qqN5QGk3w.text: Yumm, great food and little to no wait. I was curious how authentic-tasting a dim sum place could be in a hotel... it tasted pretty darn good to me!  I minus one star because my favorite dish is normally the egg tart (i don't know the chinese name for it), but it wasn't that hot/fresh tasting. But every other dish I ate was delicious, and the price is right!  I would definitely recommend this place to family and friends... also to first timers because the table next to me was new to Dim Sum and the waitress kindly explained how it all works and some popular dishes.  Very friendly service

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QozvR6ibUb3LEHaaNcBr6w.text: KJ Dim Sum & Seafood is located in the Rio All Suites Hotel & Casino. On my latest visit to Vegas, I stayed at the Rio so it was convenient for me to run down for breakfast. It is definitely pricier than driving down to a dim sum spot in Chinatown, but that's the price to pay for convenience.   At first I came down around 9:30am because Dim Sum is traditionally a breakfast meal, but they were not open until 10am. The security was trying to tell me that Dim Sum is LUNCH... No sir!! It is breakfast!!   Anyways, I come back around 10:15am and there were only a few other patrons so the dim sum carts came by so quickly. I got a pot of Jasmine Tea ($1) to start. The chili and hot mustard is available upon request. The dim sum items on my receipt range between $3.68-$4.68/each) which is definitely on the pricey side.   Hargow - The skin on their hargow was really tough and a bit on the dry side. Considering these are steamed, they should be soft and moist. The shrimp on the inside was super tiny.   Shui Mai - KJ dim sum has a special version of Shui Mai where they throw a piece of scallop on top and probably upcharge me on it. I actually didn't like it any better and if anything, it was really fishy. This serving also only had 3 pieces when it is usually served with 4 pieces.   Fung Chow - I feel like the chicken feet was not flavored enough. It was decent though.  Rice Porridge - I love rice porridge with thousand year egg. This one was on the bland side with not that much thousand year egg. The lady was really nice to mix it up and scoop it from the bottom, but it looks like they just made it with minimum thousand year egg.   Soft Tofu - I wanted to be healthy so I ordered the soft tofu. It comes with a ginger syrup that they lady put on the side. That's actually nice so people can control how much they want to put it, if any. I really like ginger so I like it with a lot of ginger syrup.   Don tat - Egg Tarts!! These were still baking when I first came in so I waited for them before I cashed out. They were available around 10:45am, 45 minutes after opening. That is pretty common for these to be ready later. It was so delicious and flakey fresh out of the oven. I enjoyed one, and then togo-ed the rest to enjoy later since I was so full.   Not the best, but it was convenient. I was surprise how little English the ladies here knew since it was in the Rio. I was able to communicate to them since I knew what the dishes I liked were called, but other patrons seemed to struggle to communicate with them for their orders. I can't say I recommend this spot for pricing or quality.

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. egg tarts ;)
Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. soft tofu with ginger syrup on the side
Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. my go-to dim sum items

kLjxRd8J2OCRz2KJx1bE6A.text: Yeah for Dim Sum!  I ate here twice on this trip to Vegas.  The food, especially the dim sum, is good.  I only wish I knew how much I was paying before I go to the cashier as the bill is just stamped as I get food.  My favorite dishes are the mochi rice with pork, the noodle with shrimp, the shrimp shumai, black bean ribs, char sui bao, and others I can't remember the names to.  You have to be stern in turning away the food you don't want as the cart staff is pretty pushy with the food.  The hostesses are very friendly and the waitress/waiters are very quick with your requests.  The tea and water is refilled quickly and even if they are busy, the food is quick.  The prices are pretty high for Chinese food in Vegas but you can use your Caesars rewards credits to pay or get food comps for your gambling play.  So when I'm staying at the Rio again, I am  sure to visit here again as well.

_Wkr6bsjG2kr40PDNRS42A.text: I came here today for lunch with my parents and my boyfriend. I wanted to venture out and try a different establishment from the ones we always go to. I called and made reservations and sure enough the place was packed and people waiting.   Some of the dimsum we had were ~  SHRIMP SHIU MAI Not my favorite shiu mai, but not absolutely terrible.  STEAM BBQ PORK BUN I really like the steam buns because the buns themselves are sweet, but the bun to meat ratio is ok because sometimes in other places, only a few pieces of the pork; so you're left with a lot more of the bun.  CHINESE BROCCOLI WITH OYSTER SAUCE I always have to have a veggie dish with my meal and this was my fave I get everytime I go to a dimsum place. I like the broccoli on its own and also I add sweetness from the sauce.  CHICKEN FEET Small but soft. Texture wise, it's average.   DEEP FRIED SESAME BALL This is one of my mom's favorite dessert. I really love the crispiness and sweetness of the ball.  SPARE RIBS This is a tricky dish because the flavor was there, but it was chewy.  STEAM CHICKEN This dish was pretty simple. It was completely steamed, but it was cold.   They didn't have Jellyfish, duck, sweet tofu, noodle dish, etc.   The hostess had a microphone announcing the next table and it was loud and annoying. The service was not good as we had to keep getting their attention for more water, napkins etc. They needed more staff.  Overall, I give it 3.5 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sN4yXuPI9aZejtVP12Uhsw.text: This will probably the only time I will rant and rave about how amazing the service is at a dim sum.  And sadly, I had to fly over 200 miles from home to experience this.    We arrived just a little after 2pm and we were seated right away.  Granted we beat the crowd.  Nonetheless, we were welcomed with a smile, offered tea and water almost instantly.  Within a few minutes, a herd of hot steaming dim sum carts circle around us, offering us all the basic dim sum I usually get.  Our glasses of water were never half empty and our server was very attentive.  All the dim sum items were fresh and delicious.  I would not hesitate to return here again.  Thanks Auntie Nadine S. for yet another recommendation!

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BI4Jpr6Kiz4H1SNqToUuRA.text: I ended up going to KJ Dim Sum & Seafood last weekend, on a Sunday mid-morning. It's located inside the Rio, west entrance. Parking is free, unlike most casinos on the strip. The restaurant is right across from the buffet inside the Rio.  When inside the restaurant, seating was quick. I came here with my boyfriends parents whom already had a table.   You are provided a punch card, like typical Dim Sum restaurants. Unfortunately our table only had three carts pass by. The food was pretty good. We had a variety of dishes such as their chow mein, another noodle dish, sweet rice, sticky rice, chasu bao, siu mai, and a few other dishes like their tofu.  Tea was cold. I don't particular care for cold tea. I'd come to this Dim Sum location again if I had a reason to be near the strip. I'm sort of located out in the NW of Vegas and it's quite a drive to get here. There are plenty of other Dim Sum locations off strip, near Spring Mountain that is comparable and less pricey than KJ Dim Sum & Seafood.   If you're located in the Rio, and don't feel like traveling out for Dim Sum, you should check this place out.

NAb4Yh5Brq2LeAwMiDwzEg.text: There are two things you can't beat here: the price and how quickly you get food. The downside? The staff is incredibly pushy with the dim sum carts.   We were seated immediately and before I had sat in my chair they were pushing dim sum in our face. We said yes to a few things we weren't sure about and quickly realIzed we had to say no a lot to get what we really wanted. We asked for pork shu mai and soup dumplings and were quickly given them. They were delicious! We ordered pot stickers as those are our favorite of ours. They do offer a full menu, but the dim sum carts are what people come for.   We had six or seven different items and the total bill? $30. We thought it was wrong. The only thing that made the price increase was the dumplings which were $7.99. Truly can't beat that! It was good but I've definitely had better. MGM has an amazing place but the price is pretty steep. Good option inside the Rio for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States

P7b3ZzZ-EHb_2vv0SY9LpA.text: Beware: the cart ladies are tricky. Somehow they got a plate of egg rolls on our table and we didn't even order it. We just assumed another person ordered it from our table but alas... no one did. By the time we realized, it was too late lol. Savage.  Everything was a bit greasy and the kitchen doesn't open to "cook" until an hour after the restaurant opens...??? So strange. We had to wait to get our Chinese broccoli... which came out super greasy! It was slipping and sliding everywhere on the plate... no chopsticks could catch them lol.  The only redeeming factor would be the dessert buns. I got egg custard and tarp and I'd definitely come back for those... only those! I'd get Togo for the ride home too... just in case lol.   Everything else was standard grade Chinese dim sum. Nothing outside of the dessert was memorable

Jtx6a5iUNcfEHzu6T2Vjiw.text: Beware:  They only have dim sum at lunch.  If you specifically want that don't try to go after lunchtime.  Then there are only a couple appetizers that are dim sum like.    The servers here were pretty clueless and forgetful but the potstickers were excellent and the honey walnut shrimp very good.  Orange chicken was just ok.  Prices at dinner are a little high but typical Vegas markup.  Based on the potstickers i would like to try them for dim sum and would make a special trip to do it,but would probably not come for dinner if I weren't already coming to the Rio for another reason.

ETWretRQiDBYMloC_rkuvQ.text: Pretty good dim sum restaurant at the Rio! Who knew?  Came to Vegas for a friend's bday and we were meeting some friends  who were staying at the Rio.  I had checked Yelp and saw that there was Dim Sum, which he loves, so I suggested we go there for dinner.  We ended up getting there a bit late so we decided to go the next morning.  Parking at the Rio is FREE which is Awesome!  Like most Dim Sum places, there was a crowd waiting. His friends put our name down around 10:30, so when we got there at 11, our table was ready.   Dim Sum is pretty good here - we got the shrimp and beef rice noodles, Chinese broccoli, haw gao, siu mai, chasu bao, chicken feet, etc.  Some of the same carts kept coming by and we had to track down some other items, but that's pretty typical.  Dishes were yummy and the staff kept the tea filled.

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LblhUKZeydv_anYOKGtc_A.text: Lots of good choices. The food is really good. Recommend this place i will definitely visit each time im in vegas

VhDH70U59H459n_RZ0Wxhw.text: My boyfriend and I went here for the first time and the food is AMAZING! We love the chicken feet and the dim sum! The service was good and we will definitely be back

l6WZTs_AQXM6oQg1n3PClw.text: The sizzling tender beef in black pepper sauce is a must! We also had the scallops in black bean sauce which was also very tasty.  The staff were very attentive and polite.

3zoFcHGnZP6YSRJuVfN_pQ.text: My family and I enjoy coming here for dim sum and dinner. They open late until 2am. Dim sum is served only during breakfast and lunch hours.   Restaurant is clean and service is great.   Tip: locals get discount 20% off for dinner! Just show your ID :)

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic String beans and Honey Walnut Shrimp

3iaNUjE8OxOTTE8-hV53Gg.text: Went there with a couple of my buddies today for lunch. Everything that we sampled from the cart was delicious, and the three of us waddled away from the table, stuffed to the point of pain, for only $36. I will DEFINITELY return.

4Nzo9v1Cn-l_ea5RiG-chQ.text: I like their Dim Sum, but only serve till 3pm or 4pm. Treat here as a Chinese brunch place, you won't disappointed.

kgmbwYFUGr-hnKKW-NXQgg.text: Came here for the porridge. I ordered the minced beef and preserved egg. The beef came out as full pieces like the ones in chow fun and it has a slimy funk to it. The preserved egg was very hard like hardened rubber. Somehow the yolk is also hard and hard jello like. Do not get the porridge. Trust me. You're welcome.

x203GxwR1TcP3h4FUpOMog.text: I used to be a regular here, but after today's experience I will not go back there for good.  We have group of 4 people, so the restaurant looked pretty busy, and the woman who work at the front said it'll be about 20 minutes wait, but we counted 7 empty big tables are open, we asked if we can go ahead and sit because we need to be back by 1pm anyway and won't stay long, she just would not let us sit, and another manager came and told  us big table only for 8 people, but there is NO reservation on those big table, so they would rather leave 7 big tables open while making all the other small party wait(there are only 2 party wait at that time), and the way they spoke to us were very very rude as well, it's sad to see a restaurant doing so successful and don't even know how to sit  people properly, it really amazed me, do people even THINK now a day?  We immediately left and went to another dim sum place Ping pang pong, and they are super busy as well, but guess what, the woman immediately guide us sitting down into a 7 person table right away since they have it open, we all left happy and will go back there again.

zp8GSxLoyQHSeS9_DSoMkA.text: Ordered 2 items and bowl of rice for dinner one night while in Vegas.  The sweet & sour pork came right out and was Ok.  Had to flag someone down each and everytime we needed something (dirty plate, soy sauce, etc) The water guy refilled my glass once.The waiter was very bored with taking out order, he couldnt look at us at all.  After finishing our small bowl of rice (extra cost) and pork we decided to cancel the rest of out order (kung pow shrimp).  Very low class place and poor service.  Wont make that mistake again! Vegas has so many wonderful places to eat - dont bother with this one.

WqMRYJfJ4_DX7JkXVe-32Q.text: The ambiance is nice and welcoming. The  food was good but the service was really slow and the waiters never really checked up on you to see if you needed a refill for your beverage . It took forever to get a hold of someone for that. It also seems that they need more food carts because all of the tables around me was waiting for their food also.

biU9aTqvlqZR7TwckfAk4g.text: I have never had Cantonese before and was taken here by a friend who was born and raised in China. This helped a lot, as he could speak the language (only with a differen dialect). I loved that they walked past with carts, so you could actually see the food. They would explain what each plate had and what was in each dish.   I liked the shrimp (don't know how else to say this, so excuse me) balls. They were cooked well and very tasty. There were things that looked like wontons with chicken and spinach in them, that were very good. The tea was okay, but the servers were definitely on their job; constantly checking on my drinks, but not in an annoying way. Tried this rice that was in a giant leaf thing, didn't care for the flavor. Had this dessert that was made with sweetened egg, and it was delicious! I also liked that the portions were small, so you could try multiple things.   My friend said that there was some pressure from the women with the carts, so I'm not sure if they work on commission, or maybe they need to empty their carts in a certain amount of time, or what. If he were not a confident man, I'm sure this would have made for an uncomfortable vibe, but him and I laughed it off. Will definitely be coming here again.

UVMFmCrc8HzKS7T_hghEnQ.text: Never Again!!!! Not one of the worst Dim Sum I've had but pretty close. If you like cold rubbery flavorless shui mai then by all means come here and knock yourself out. The baked BBQ pork buns were tiny and bland compared to the sweet oooey salty & sweet giant ones at Orchid Gardens. This is dim sum for people with no taste buds. Yuck!!! Go to Orchid Gardens for superb flavorful morsels of heaven cause that is our next stop asap!!!!

mzDIQFmzQIb5ge3kAnfakw.text: Came in here on Chinese New Year, they were pretty busy and we sat near the front.  The food was pretty good, I've had better dim sum the food wasnt as hot as I would like, maybe it is due to the fact by the time it got around to us it was cold already.  The decor was nice and the servers we did encounter were very nice.  Main complaint they never brought us anything to drink.  We had to search out our waiter, we would ask the servers with the carts for water and they said our waiter would be around but that didn't happen.  We saw the waiters were cleaning off another table and we got their attention and asked again for water.  Needless to say those waters were not refilled either until we tracked someone down again.  We were never offered tea until we were already halfway though our meal.  The highlight was the coconut buns for me but they were not hot and I think we would have been better off going across the walkway to the buffet which when we were there had no line.

-6fdnSKmjhNcAaFRS2G9qg.text: Becoming ever more popular as diners are discovering the huge selection of fresh Dim Sum at reasonable prices in a very pleasant, modern decor. I am now a frequent diner at lunch time. May have to check out dinner sea food menu.

f_lZheXX9ftVni25aONNNg.text: Two stars means "Meh. I've experienced better."  Review for dim sum only.  It's between a 2 and 3 star.  Would I return? Yes. Why? It's convenient and really not bad.  heck, I eat at Yoshinoya so who am I to judge? :)  This is the only dim sum place I've gone to in Vegas thus far (maybe I'll try another spot)? Also, keep in mind, my reference point is against SGV dim sum (obvs it wouldn't compare)  Har gow, shu mai, the usual wasn't bad. Vegetables were good and plenty. Tea was always refilled, service wasn't so bad. Egg tarts were extremely runny and strange in texture (but what can I say, I still ate three =). The taro root cake - muy malo. They wouldn't give us water cause there were no clean glasses? (?!?!) At least they were honest.  Quick, dirty, easy. Not bad. :)

YSvsV9SxpCJ7mGgYoB2Djg.text: We dined at this restaurant which is located in the Rio.  Poor experience!  The service was very poor and not much better than the food.  Few, if any, of the wait staff could speak English and they appear to cater to mostly Chinese tourists.  Had difficulty getting our water glasses refilled.  My wife requested another bowl of rice, but it took them 10 minutes to deliver it.  We requested a second dish of an item and after 10 minutes, they finally told us they ran out and had to cook some more -- we cancelled and left.  Servers came by with carts twice, then we could never get them to come by again--worst Dim Sum ever!

SvBkIjVH9a_eqXcb9gm4Zg.text: Overall very good quality Chinese food. The service was very good (tell me another Chinese place that actually has people pouring your tea for you!!!). It took a while for our food to come out but it was worth the wait. We ate the corn soup (very delicious!) and we also got the seafood chow mein (so-so), the Kung pow chicken (the best dish of the night!), Mongolian beef (very good as well!), and the Chinese broccoli (lacking in oyster sauce but still good). The prices were what you would expect from a Chinese restaurant (overall we paid about $90 for five family style dishes). And the decor was nice! :) I would definitely come back~

dlClzWByZ21EJXOdS-forA.text: I have been going to KJ's on Spring Mtn for years and even was a fan of them when they were all at Food Express on Decatur.  I went here just to check it out and get some different scenery.  If you like the one on spring mtn this will not disappoint.  It is not as crowded as the other one and has the same great food.  The only downfall is that it is priced slightly higher since it is in a casino, but locals get 20% off the bill, so I guess you almost break even (what more can you ask for, but to break even in a casino).  This KJ's does however have dim sum...please try the taro bun pastry...soooo good!  Same great food & alot of the staff from the one off the strip.  Enjoy!

LvzD0XTTEYruYpN2UOyUOw.text: My husband and I went here on Sunday morning for dim sum and was extremely disappointed. Here's why: (1) Their system for seating customers. When we got there at 11 am, it wasn't too busy. There were three parties ahead of us to be seated. They gave us a number. One of the members in the party after us must speak the language because he was right next to the hostess and kept asking her about when they would be seated. The next thing I know, our number was skipped and they got seated. We thought maybe it's because they have a bigger group and it was a bigger that table came available. Then she started seating other people that came after us. My husband told her that she skipped our number and then she seated us. (2) Little variety. We were seated in the middle of the restaurant with a large aisle. The whole time we were there, the same two carts came through. I asked one of the ladies if they had chicken feet. Instead of saying that she can have the person come over, she said "later". Later never came. (3) Service is poor. It was hard to flag down a waiter for refills or for questions. Once they seat you, the waiter does not come back to check on you. When we were done with being disappointed in the food and service and ready to leave, we could not get the attention of a waiter to check us out. My husband gave up and took our check to the register himself to pay it. This is one of the rare time that we did not leave a tip.  On the way out, the line was out the door. In my mind, after what I just experienced, it is NOT worth the wait.

YmwkbrX5fGynf8pF_uzTKQ.text: I was really excited to hear that the Rio was opening a dim sum place as I have tons of comp points built up and love the traditional dim sum experience.  I've been there 3 times now and it's been about a 2-2.5 star experience.  The food was good the first two times that I was there.  Very traditional dim sum fare.  The most recent time that I was there, the Har Gow was terrible.  No shrimp.  Just this ground up white looking "meat" that kinda tasted like chicken.  Service was terrible each and every time.  It was chaotic and the management doesn't seem to care.  Also if you you sit on the far "stage right" side of the room, you will not get any food except for the crappy items that no one wants as the carts start on the other side of the room and always run out of the good stuff before it gets to you.  They go back and get more food but then start on that side of the room again.  I'm giving up on this place.  Going back to Beijing Noodle No. 9.

2LlKGcjFw8ixpzh89_qtsw.text: Countless times I have waited in the Carnival buffet line wondering why I am waiting when I could walk in to that great smelling dim sum place across the way. First of all, just because you sell appetizer sized portions of certain foods does not make you a dim sum restaurant.  Having eaten in San Francisco at some of the best Dim Sum locations where the food arrives on carts and you choose what you want for small prices, I was a bit surprised to find that this is nothing more than a chinese restaurant with some unusual items on the menu like clay pots.  The prices, while good for chinese food are not great for dim sum and you won't be able to try 20 different selections unless you want to spend a ton.    The food we ordered was mixed.  The lobster spring rolls had decent chunks of what appeared to be lobster but had no lobster taste to it.  In fact, they were ultra bland.  The walnut shrimp was tasty as was the sizziling seafood which included scallops, calamari, an unidentifyable fish, shrimp and more.  The sweet and sour pork was also lacking in flavor but was not overly soggy.  They are less than generous on the rice portions.  I agree with other reviewers that services is lacking and there is absolutely no atmosphere in this place so don't expect a romantic meal.  I am sure there are better Dim Sum locations within 20 miles of this place.

DstVLSby9h7ebJeEeT86MA.text: Dim sum service had nice variety. Service was great. Usually go to Ping Pang Pong. This was a nice option also. Like them both but ambiance here is nicer and so are the people.

3EHpc05NQGZe1KdP5CSMGQ.text: KJ was decent. We had Dim Sum here on a Saturday morning and it wasn't crowded at all. Typical Chinese Dim Sum dishes were ordered (Ha Gow, Siu Mai, chicken cfeet, Gin Duey....) The staff was nice and actually kind except  for this one incident. We asked what she had in her cart but she was too busy talking to another employee. I believe the other gal was the hostess. All 3 of us one by one asked her and she just ignored us. Too bad that happened because she was actually nice but was distracted. Not cool to ignore your patrons. Just saying.

6y3CQJmrCXs5MsyL2bH3RA.text: One of the best dim sum restaurants I have experienced.  Dim sum was fresh and great tasting.  I would definitely return here the next time I go to Las Vegas!

VUIit_RQB2wQkaHy5VgjAg.text: We've tried some dim sum spots in Las Vegas and KJ at the Rio is our favorite. It still doesn't top what we're used to 2,500 miles away in NYC's Chinatown, but it's close enough and satisfies our appetite. They have a good variety of dim sum and it's served hot like it should be. The soup dumplings are one of the best items, though this past Saturday they weren't very tasty. Maybe just a bad batch? Other favorites are the sesame balls, egg custard tarts, taro buns, pan-fried chive dumplings, and dumplings with peanuts inside. I wish they had sticky rice, the kind *not* wrapped in a leaf. We tend to go early to beat the crowds, so I'm sure we might be missing out on some variety that tends to come out later as mentioned by other Yelpers. What makes it stand out for us is the restaurant is clean, stroller friendly, and the cart ladies are nice, unlike NYC! I guess some might consider that part of the experience but I'm over it. There's always a lot of Chinese patrons, always a good sign. We haven't tried enough of the regular menu to comment on it yet, but I've had the beef pan-fried noodles and they were excellent! Some things I don't like are how they charge for tea. Getting your check added up can take a while. We just walk it up to the back desk ourselves and pay there. Chinese food is generally supposed to be cheap, so when I see outrageous prices at Chinese restaurants in Las Vegas (for example: bowl of won ton noodle soup in NYC - $5, Vegas Strip - $15!) it makes me nuts. KJ is a little pricey but worth it since it's currently the best place in town for dim sum.

jAO8qYbiYZNbmhK8Knr9Mg.text: AWESOME DIM SUM!!!! Good price and amazing selection. My only complaint is that it's a mystery at times what you are getting as some of the server's are not good with speaking english. Maybe some pics with explanations would help. I highly recommend eating here.

7ZpdGf5MhiGTk3RnePiRTg.text: I'm writing this review based on my experience over this past Sunday. The restaurant is located inside of a off-strip hotel (RIO) so it's reasonable to expect that a lot of patrons who dine here are guests of the hotel and a mix of locals. I am the latter and neither myself or my dining guest were of Chinese nationality.  We were sat in the middle of the restaurant during a moderately busy Sunday early afternoon and were quickly approached by the food carts (we had no qualms with the delivery of food, with the exception that some dishes were served cold when they should have been hot).   A waiter then approached us once and asked for a drink order. Other than that, there were no efforts made to check on the table. We tried several times to flag down a waiter to get some basics (chili sauce, soy sauce, napkins, etc.) and were met with quick turns of the head as if they "didn't see us." After several minutes of being what we felt were purposely ignored, we noticed these same waiters were very attentive and visited several times the tables seated with all Chinese or mostly Chinese guests. Finally I was able to get the attention of a gentleman I assumed to be the restaurant manager who asked if we needed something. After requesting my simple condiments I received an eye roll from the gentleman and then an "ok." After observing him going back and fourth to other tables after waiting 10 minutes for the delivery of two simple items, we noticed he went back to the main reception desk and stood there, not making an attempt to deliver the items to us. We then had to literally almost grab a hold of another waiter before they acknowledge our presence and again requested our simple condiments, that were then promptly delivered. The (assumed) manager then walked to a table of women sitting next to ours and proceeded to have a full on conversation, even going so far as to sit down at their table and socialize. I did notice on two occasions that he did glance our way and give a rude, irritated look our way as they proceeded to talk. At this point both my partner and myself were fed up with the incredibly rude, purposeful lack of service at our table and asked for the check, which they were quick to get us and wisk away as soon as we put out cash in. When the server looked in the pocket and noticed that I had given 3 $20 bills on a $58.35 check, she asked if we were ready to pay and I nodded yes, she then stood there for a few seconds with a look that almost said, are you kidding with this? no tip? which was purposeful on our account.   This may sound like a rant, and it is, but I want to make it perfectly clear that we were treated with indifference and rudely the entire experience, for what seemed no other reason than that we were not Chinese.   For a restaurant located inside of a hotel to provide this sort of service to it's guests and guests of the hotel is unheard of. This experience reflects poorly not only on the restaurant but the hotel itself.   So my suggestion, if you are not Chinese, then don't dine here because they obviously and clearly do not want your business. Next time, I'll go to a establishment on Spring Mountain.

0JtoqJZIRcm3svs6WnCqfQ.text: This is my favorite place to get dim sum in town.  I've only had their dim sum, so I can't comment on their regular menu.  The restaurant is very large, airy, and clean.  The dim sum menu is pretty extensive - I can't think of anything that I missed that they don't carry.  Sometimes you just have to wait for the cart to come around.  Every time we've gone, the food has been piping hot.  Service is excellent and much better than some other dim sum restaurants that I've been to.

CwmH749y3eLmtelr3i6N4g.text: Come here if you want terrible service. Food is decent but the service and quality of people working here is ridiculous.

r3dn_DxGHXK6mIfDK3TAcA.text: Wanted to check this place out for dinner because I heard their food was really good. Our party of 7 walked out of the place after waiting 30mins for service. No one came over to check on us! No tea!!! No water!!! No drinks!!! It was about 5pm and the place wasn't busy at all. There were 5 other tables with people in them besides ours. The staff paid more attention to cleaning and setting up tables than waiting on the guests. My husband kept trying to wave at them to get their attention. I'm pretty sure 2 servers saw him, and we still didn't get service! Then an older couple came to the restaurant and got seated and 2mins later a server was getting their order. We still don't know why they didn't come to our table. -.-

HhkPN7yZhpmOrV7UG2beCQ.text: I don't know what people are saying...I'm from LA & their service is no different from Chinatown. The cart foods are superb and is a must try! Prices for the carts are pretty cheap and is the same price as I would get at any other dim sum restaurant ($3-$10). Overall great food, service & would definitely go again!

waZrnb6d87tNh6y2ETlLWA.text: I went here with a family member. We were at the Rio to see the MJ Live show and asked the box office person to recommend a good place to eat. He said he had just discovered this restaurant was at the hotel and said they had amazing Dim Sum. It is rather hard to see although it is right across from the entrance to the World Buffet. It seems to get dwarfed by it's surroundings. If there is one issue with this place I would have to say it's in the communications area. We asked how the Dim Sum came since the menu did not say if it was priced per piece, two pieces,etc. The current waiter ( we saw three total in a little under an hour) then told us Dim Sum is only served until 3 PM ( maybe they should change the name of the restaurant !) We decided we would just order something else. The menu is quite extensive. We landed on Mushu Chicken appetizer and Shrimp Pan Fried noodles. Waiter #3 came back and asked if we wanted the Pan Fried Noodles Cantonese style...crispy dry noodles on bottom and sauce on top? I said yes, that's the way I like it. The Mushu came out very quickly. It was love at first bite. I can honestly say it was the best tasting Mushu I have ever had. Flavors were perfectly balanced, sauce was light and both the meat and veggies tasted fresh. A delight!  Waiter #3 returned to ask if I was sure that's how we wanted the Pan Fried Noodles reminding me it was dry at the bottom and sauce on top...I said I was sure. Then he came back one more time to ask if we needed silverware...we said no, we are fine with chopsticks. The Pan Fried Noodles came out rather readily thereafter. They were wonderful as well. The noodles were tasty,slightly browned on the bottom and crispy throughout until the top sauce softened them. The sauce was again perfectly balanced in flavors and very light. We told the waiter that everything was really good and he nodded politely. They are not big conversationalists here but are quiet and polite. Either way, the food was superb.  I heard quite a bit of yelling in the kitchen and they seemed to be well staffed with servers and runners and it did look like maybe they were putting forth managerial effort to keep the kitchen from getting backed up. There were a lot of Asian diners and I believe the wait staff is trying to make sure that non-Asians know what they are getting. Some people are upset if it not like American take out Chinese food...and it's not...much more authentic...and it is really good...and I will definitely return.

N7-PFR5WwiFmbVxVQcfmTg.text: Fantastic value and even better food.  The house soup is to die for and desserts (during dimsum) are phenomenal.  Go there.  Now.

4ZNfMqglbDSZboDfi2Pxbw.text: We thought we were disappointed because we missed the Dim Sum serving hours but we decided to order Chinese off the menu and were really surprised at how excellent the food was.  This was the best meal we had in Vegas.  Highly recommended.  Try the Chicken and Ginger.  You won't be disappointed!

hs0I_ZxqqVjRbvq0RkSCfA.text: whoever does not like this place is crazy. The best dim sum in town.

Ng9ElY61O1YO5TLH494Yxg.text: The restaurant is large, which is nice. It is located right across from the Rio's Carnival Buffet. The Dim Sum was quite good, the best I've had so far in Vegas. Not too expensive.

MGy6pDTOm2kqPHcaQKA8Kw.text: i'm not a fan of dim sum in las vegas. i don't know why but it seems to be so very difficult to do good dim sum here. i've tried the dim sum at every single outlet here in vegas, even the ones on the strip. i'm on a mission...  kj doesn't disappoint the way most of the others do. their selection is wide and they actually have more seafood and vegetarian options than most places in town. my only complaint would be that the dumpling skins are a bit overcooked and mushy.  the service here is excellent and extremely accommodating. if you don't see a specific dish, you can ask the server and they will make it fresh for you. i'm accustomed to abrasive service when dining at a chinese restaurant but i was pleasantly surprised to see that this location has amazingly good service. we've even had servers make jokes and converse with us while dining here. this is rare in a chinese restaurant unless you know them personally.  aside from their dim sum options, dinner here is quite good as well. they offer just about the same things as their other location but might be slightly pricier.  the restaurant itself is very clean and it's far enough away from the casino floor that the cigarette smoke doesn't come wafting through. definitely my new go to place for dim sum.

dIAZNv49ZZeSRmKm2VHHHQ.text: WORST RESTAURANT EVER!!  Hands down this is the worst place I've eaten at. My friends and I had dinner here last night and I couldn't have been more disappointed with the service.  Here is why: 1. Our waiter was a tall, older looking Asian gentlemen and couldn't be bothered with actually taking care of us like waiters are supposed to! Thankfully there were 2 other men that saw his crappy attitude and took action.  2. At the end of our meal, one of my friends politely asked for a box so she could take the remainder of her food home. Our jackass waiter proceeded to put my friend's plate in the bin with other dirty dishes, then put her left-over food in the box and handed it back to her. THIS ACTUALLY HAPPENED. I SAW THIS WITH MY OWN EYES AND WHEN I CONFRONTED HIM ABOUT IT, HE DENIED IT. I asked to speak to a manager because I was so appalled, but all they did was say "sorry." I was FURIOUS about how they treated us like dirty street rats instead of human beings. 3. If reasons 1 and 2 didn't already convince you not to go here, here is another: 2 of my friends had explosive diarrhea this morning after eating food from this place.  IF YOU WANT SHITTY SERVICE AND EVEN WORSE FOOD, COME HERE. If you're smart, you will stay away and find another restaurant that is cleaner, less expensive and that has a welcoming atmosphere.

5-D9ZFHnKMb9rCfhImyBMQ.text: Yes, I am a fan and I would return, but probably for lunch, not dinner.  Good & Bad......  Good:   - Food was absolutely amazing and quite authentic based on the vast experience of my companion.  Recommend the salty fish fried rice with scallops and made with egg whites....fresh and light tasting, super delicious....added the Salt & Pepper Squid, also amazing taste and perfect texture....Also the Chicken with Scallions and Ginger....supper yummy.  More than enough food for two.  Needs Improvement:  - Service, probably what you should expect from an authentic Chinese restaurant, abrupt and efficient with little personality. - Pricing, a bit steep even for Vegas, and while the service does not live up to the cost, the food does.  Overall, the experience was very hit and miss.  The food is so good that you reluctantly overlook all the rest of the deficiencies.   Looking around while we were there the large number of groups of Chinese patrons, literally 90+% of the fair number of people there for dinner, made it obvious this is authentic Chinese food.  I could go on with examples, but overall, just remember you are there for the food and nothing else....it is worth dealing with a less than traditional American dining experience to partake in the delicious creations coming from the kitchen.  Yes you will curse me and or yourself for the unorthodox service experience you just got.....but at the end of the meal you will be so happy you ate there and the next day you will want to return to suffer through it all over again for the food.

15zcURZguRjW4OX_KPtY6Q.text: Didn't order dimsum since it was dinner. Ordered a couple of items from the menu, food was fantastic and delicious. Portion was great too! I highly recommend this restaurant if you're looking for Chinese food.

xEKDUb4w0ebre3FtdXH4nw.text: So we originally came for the World Carnival Buffet but our mom was complaining about the wait so we decided to go across the way to here since there was no wait... That was a sign! I'm only giving this place two stars for the outstanding attentive service from the wait staff. This was at 8pm. Constantly getting refills and making sure we were good. Now that's great service! The food on the other hand... Panda Express has better quality! It's kind of family style eating. We got the Mongolian beef, shrimp pan fried noodles, and sweet n sour pork. The Mongolian beef was kind of slimey almost as if it came out of a can. The sweet n sour pork was decent but the noodles were greasy. Even though the service was great... Food was not. Might be good if you're super drunk and want to sober up on Chinese food.  Not even worth what we paid... should have gone to the BK Whopper Bar instead to get Whoppers and beer :/ Wish we knew about the Famous Dave's BBQ on the way home... Would have gone there instead!

14b3QSNtNuBdOHM4T-nYnQ.text: Extremely mediocre food and deathly slow service (although friendly). At least it was cheap. Not recommended unless truly desperate for that dim sum fix.

sAK_0gaDZ6L2ZAFViMuIYg.text: Authentic dim sum, reasonably priced. Food service excellent, getting the check was a bit slower and never received water to drink. Overall great place though.

LRpXJcmBb7emvmOJ2JYGvg.text: Where's the food?. We are sitting here waiting and waiting for food.  We also have to return two basket of sticky rice chicken wrap because they were spoiled. We are still waiting ....,.

wruSNvsWR58XZjasgHuP-Q.text: I wanted dim sum for breakfast and since we were already at the Rio's we went there. You know when dim sum is legit when there's nothing but old Chinese folks packed in the seats. It was good, but a lot of them didn't understand English. So I also understand why a lot of people probably didn't want to try and go there. But being a dim sum fanatic I still go even if I can't speak to them. To try good food you can't let language barriers stop you. So ya it was just the service I believe that's lacking there.

K__thXGMh5vW3bSWqE5KeA.text: After eaten at most Dim Sum joints in Vegas, KJ at Rio was definitely one of the better Dim Sum ventures in town.  For travelers like me, the logistic was convenience from the Strip, and the hotel was less rundown than triple P one block west.  The interior beautifully decorated in a big dining area with different sizes of table in column formation.  They got about four different TV on the wall playing sports and Chinese dramas on mute.  For Dim Sum, they got the flavor right with carts flying all over the place, they do seems a bit lacking on the grill stuff, and they are using metal baskets instead of bamboo, which retains excessive water in the dim sum.  However, quality wise still decent for what they got in this town, definitely cannot compare with California level.  They open until 2am, but they do not seem to have any late night special after 9-10pm like most locations in town.  Regular dinner was ok, nothing exciting about it.  We got some Black Bean Beef Chow Fun and a Seafood Tofu Pot.  Both were very good compare to my home state, but just ok if you use Vegas standard.  The bill came to about $50.  KJ Dim Sum at Rio was a solid Dim Sum place with some flaw for their dinner.  I would still come here again for Dim Sum brunch, and probably not dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood Tofu Pot
Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Black Bean Beef Chow Fun
Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dim Sum

Xsyx7UupUoYZaCBnbrZT0Q.text: KJ Dim Sum & Seafood serves mouthwateringly good dim sum at a very competitive prices (S $2.28, M $3.18, L $3.98, SP $4.98).  The restaurant is large with high ceiling, which is nice and gave it a cavernous airy feeling. It is located right across from the Rio's Carnival Buffet, so if you paid too much attention to the line of people waiting for the buffet, you might have to bust a U-ey like I did earlier today.  The dim sum selection is pretty vast.  They have all the usual popular dim sum items and some rare gems (highly recommend #32 Baked Salty Egg Yolk Cream Bun is a nice dessert to finish off your meal, but we also used it as our intermission break).  The food were hot every time we ordered it off the dim sum cart and the servers were friendly and timely in refilling tea pots, getting us extra hot sauces and napkins, and clearing away empty plates.  Overall, the food was good. Perhaps not as great as the top dim sum destinations up and down California. However, their Baked Salty Egg Yolk Cream Bun (it is so good I am mentioning it twice) with their golden liquidy center is reason enough for me to designate KJ Dim Sum & Seafood as my reigning Las Vegas dim sum spot.    (Review was based on dim sum experience only, but they do have a regular Chinese restaurant menu offering as well).  Ambiance:  4/5  Airy, dining environment with pleasing decor.    Food:  4/5  Overall good.   Value:  4/5  Competitively priced.  Service:  4/5  No complaints.  Parking:  4/5  Parking garage, valet at the Rio.  Might have to stalk some pedestrians back to their car when it is busy.  Cleanliness:  4/5  Pretty clean.  Solid 4 stars in my book.

-tGIedcimKfkSlA5em3gjg.text: I ordered lobster rolls and the majority was celery and carrots. Don't bother, go somewhere else.

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Little to no lobster might as well be a veggie roll

EY4_qnTSJPh-LsQD6AJwPA.text: First off visiting from Hawaii.  I'm making my order and I want gau gee, and the lady who's taking my order gives me an attitude, saying gau gee is the potstickers that they have, and I keep telling her unknown what a potsticker is and  it's not gau gee. Potsticker is pan fried and gau gee is deep fried with meat in the middle and folded in half to resemble a rectangle. I know my food! She then complains about me to her worker, and I'm not dumb I can clearly understand she speaking Chinese because she mentions what we was discussing about.  Bad service!   I hope food is great! Waiting on it right now!

jo25-sRNU4fgo6aqngng6Q.text: One of the worst dining experiences in my life.  Bad food, worse service.  Stopped in for lunch during WSOP and it was a mistake.

klTFboqaGBc9_bRJOjuKMQ.text: Kj is probably the best dim sum spot in Vegas. I can say that for a fact. After dining here, and other dim sum restaurants in town, Kj is the only one I regularly return to. This also ranks up there with some of my favorite restaurants in the city.  After sitting down, I recommend that everyone orders the hot tea. It's not complimentary, I think it's like 3 or 5 dollars, but it's unlimited refills, and nothing goes better with dim sum than hot tea.  So there are carts rolling around the place that are loaded with goodies that you can just pick and choose which dishes you want. Definitely if you are going here, I would recommend ordering the har gow (shrimp dumplings), shumai, pork bao, and coeng fan (rice noodle rolls). And, save some room for dessert, their egg custard tarts are fantastic, as well as their green tea and taro buns. But, always be open to trying new things, that's the key to dim sum.  Not everything I thought was stellar. First, the XLB or "soup dumplings" are not very appetizing. There is hardly any broth inside, and it's basically all wrapper. And, the char siu baau is pretty average, with it tasting more of sauce, rather than pork. And sometimes another issue I have, not all the dim sum are piping hot, which I feel should be.  Overall, this place is really great, with the positives greatly outnumbering the negatives. Some people have told me that this place is comparable to some of the best dim sum spots in cities that have a large dim sum presence. I believe them because I really like this place, and will continue to come back here!

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried shrimp balls
Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chinese broccoli
Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Char siu bauu

DwfpEPTe2o5WsRrR2a0jOg.text: I had the House Special Wonton Soup. It was very delicious! Portions are huge - very suitable for sharing. The staff was very friendly. Service was fast. Would definitely recommend and come back here again.

ztTDSAcLcNPGbXk1u3sFqg.text: I get to know about this restaurant from local Las Vegas Chinese restaurant waiter. She told me when I visited the restaurant that Rio dimsum is the best in Vegas. Ii have not gotten so much luck with dimsum in LV. We used to go to seafood harbour in Speing Mountain but after today visit, I'd start going to KJ dimsum because it is so much better (tastier, fresher and better service).  This restaurant used dimsum cart that made it more traditional feeling. I quickly grab the traditional dimsum like BBQ pork bun, siew may, ha kao, chicken feet and spare ribs. Cooking dimsum spare ribs and chicken feet are few of the more complex task and this restaurant did well. Overall it is delicious ... I added extra portion on chicken feet as a result.  The porridge is good and tasty as well.  Their chilli sauce is rather unique (unusual than the normal Chinese chilli oil), but it tastes good.  The service is VERY good, as our request is executed flawlessly and timely.   The only opportunity of improvement is in the variety of the food, few we need to order separately.

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Good dimsum in LV ...

bZPCHu90UJzTFlslT6rMXA.text: The servers here stand near your table and anything you need they are ON IT!! It's a lot different from their first spot, obviously because this one is inside of a casino.  Both places serve delicious food but I think I would stick with the original place because it's CHEAPER and just as good.

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gYm24pZnUuMcm5vmL50MYg.text: It was BUSY today, probably the long weekend and lots of people here in Vegas. Hostess gave us a number quickly and the wait was about 20 minutes, for table of 4. Despite the flood of people, the server gpt us our tea and first round of carts came by with hot food! After a bit however, the carts that came by were mpstly empty, didn't prep enough food for weelend rush? But, the cart pushers quickly put in an order to the kitchen for what we wanted and a fresh dish was brought to our table in a few minutes. Taste is good, and service is great. People cane around frequently to check for empty dishes, refill our tea and water. Enjoyed our lunch here!

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried pork and Chive pocket.
Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shanghai style pork dumpling. There is soup inside, best way to eat is put a bit of vinegar on it and eat in one bite.

YhEmKAy6rH1Tp1hW3F4VRg.text: After 9 days on a road trip where it was strictly American food, we began missing Asian food.  When we reached Vegas, we were craving some Asian food.  Was the food good?  I'm not sure.  We were so hungry that we wolfed down what came on the carts.  Wasn't anything unusual.  Ordinary dim sum.  We did order one order of chow mein and one order of chow fun.  My sister is a Nevada resident.  As such she's got local discounts to shows and restaurants.  She shows the 25% coupon and the manager says it's for dinner only.  Nowhere on the coupon does it state for dinner only.  Go figure.

LQYVn3d-qe6GGzvMVPNZYQ.text: I gamble alot, possibly more than any other human being that's known to exist in this third dimensional world.  As we all know, gambling drains the hell out of everyone and definite stimulates our appetite.  I am a frequent stayer at the Rio and fortunately for myself, dining at KJ has to be one of the most nostalgic experiences I've had.  Let's get one thing straight:  This is not an average Chinese restaurant.  The place is pretty decent in terms of size and has the patience to deal with people that don't really have that patience.  I seriously admire the service staff for putting up with people don't have patience.  They are quick, friendly, and extremely hospitable and that goes without saying that this is the most important aspect of a restaurant.  Food is awesome.  How awesome you say?  Well besides the traditional types of dimsum, you also have to count this restaurant for dinner.  I've had some pretty interesting experiences as well as some nostalgic ones.  You have classic stir fried dishes like Kung pao, as well as individual dishes like crispy chow mein with gravy.  Though that is more of the American side of Chinese cooking, there are some delight-able treats that they have here for an authentic Chinese palate.  I hate to say if anything is truly better than anything else, but they have the best steamed chinese fish that I've ever had and let me remind you that I am a VERY picky eater.  Be warned though, the price is expensive (40 USD for a pound).  Although I won't eat Chinese food everyday but I can appreciate it as it has always been something I've grown into.  If you're around, you just have to stop by and try it for yourself.  I'll be back when I return to my gambling habits once again!

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. absolutely delicious steamed fish.

JAvrKsK_AI89BQBCmW4jwA.text: We got there when when it just opened, we were seated pretty quick. The ladies pushing carts were really nice and were patient with us since we were a bit indecisive on what we wanted.  The dim sum was ehh, not my cup of tea. Most things tasted alright, and nothing stood out.   We waited for forever for a waitress to take our bill and no one came. They totally ignored us probably because we were younger than the other customers. My friend had to walk up to the counter to get someone's attention to pay for our bill.

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7xcyr_iS3IZO5b2Ocxkw7w.text: One of my favorite Dim Sum places in town.  Location is great and the food, well...EXCELLENT!!!  Typical order: pork shumai, Chinese broccoli,  chow fun noodles, roast duck ... yep, I can go on forever!  The restaurant is clean, located in the Rio.  The staff works efficiently: carts come around frequently.  Fun experience.  I really like how friendly the staff are ... I come here often and it's nice to be remembered.  The go-to guy is Victor.  Always helpful and friendly!!

JYbfc9BTfCHtzToWZngAfw.text: Normally I am not a fan of Chinese food. Like at all. However, we ate here with the family for a late dinner. By far, the best Chinese food I have ever eaten. Very very authentic Chinese food. We ordered the honey walnut shrimp, cashew chicken, and lo mein chicken. WOOOW. Wasn't heavy at all and was very filling.  The restaurant itself was very traditional old school type of Chinese restaurant which was pretty cool. Hosts and servers were all very polite and friendly. Price was very very affordable for really goood quality/authentic food. Overall I can't even think of one bad thing about this place. Great experience, excellent food.

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half eaten but this is the delicious Honey Walnut shrimp
Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken lo mein
Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cashew chicken. Sooooo good and light

nmmhSesnbD6OyN3m9em4ww.text: What's the big deal about this place?  Tried it today and it is the usual dim sum, average tastes, and typical service.....BAD!  We had to keep bothering the waiters who didn't make eye contact when they passed our table.  I would like to think the service would be different than your typical dim sum place, nope.  So expect okay food and typical bad service .

z9uStxxnL6-_YaYxEj2-dw.text: KJ Dim Sum & Seafood: First of all, many of the Dim Sum server's didn't speak English, or the ones we got at least. So it was hard to ask any questions, unless the hostess happen to come by. So with that said, communication can be difficult, if you want something in particular.   The Hum Bow's were not the normal BBQ ones, they had a different taste, my friend and I didn't really like them. I like the bread Hum Bow's, but did not see any when we were there, I asked for them, but never got an answer.   Congee was really good, like most places we get. The shrimp noodle rolls were really soggy, this wasn't that good. The siu mai was good, nothing different that I could tell. The Har Gow, shrimp balls were good as most places. The seafood bundle pack, the soggy wrap items were very good, one of my favorites.  We had a custard or egg dessert where the yoke was suppose to be runny, but it was hard and over cooked. The tripe was very good, there was another tripe we got in brown sauce, it was average.  I really need to do pictures, but I think every gets the drift. The place seems a little pricey, but I wouldn't know, as my friend picked up the bill.  Overall, the place was good, I will definitely go back to try other entree's, but the lack of communication makes it difficult to ask for what you want at times.

eeJswwo4bncIgLiDq5xK5Q.text: The dinner was delicious,  Orange chicken with beef chofu and sea food fried rice was perfect combination . Lavender tea and more important super tasting

7eA85W1fEPm7fgLRvxrBEg.text: Pretty good dim sum for lunch! Comparable to my favorite one in San Jose. My favorite is probably the sand bread, wow does the custard slip out! Gets very messy but it's an enjoyable messy. The cheong fun, you can tell they make it from the chewiness of the rice sheet and the Sui Mai are also well.   Ambience is nice as well and interior decoration is perfect. Service is also impeccable as well making sure you always have enough tea at the table.

ctUYmCHLIjMmsVBVWyEaRg.text: We were party of six. We were kinda worried because the server got an attitude.  We ordered our food. Server asked us if we want tea we said sure why not.... First of all he didn't tell us it cost $5 for the pot second of all after we filled our cups he took the pot without asking us, when it was still has tea.  He brings our food it was good. Than charged us for the tea that we were not able to finish and for the rice which we didn't order he just brought it with our food!!!! Before we left there was another table arguing about the same thing the rice and the tea. They didn't know they were being charged for those items as well.

ArOFDNxTCm0UtgRhSglbOA.text: THIS PLACE SUCKS....i vote with my wallet!ttt   The first time we went was 2 p.m. I guess no one on these reviews told us that they close at 3 we couldn't get any service not even any napkins then I ordered some shrimp that wasn't on the carts cuz were hardly any carts out and it was $17 we walked away very disappointed because all the people there only worried about getting their checks at the end of their shift see the picture so then my wife and I decided to give it a second chance we went there much earlier this time guess what the place is a line out the door with 15 at least people waiting in line I ask how long it'll take she says 10 minutes I said yeah right we'll give it a check will give it a shot then 30 minutes later I said you have two seconds to give us a table and she said it'll be a little longer I said screw you you you can keep your business NEVER again

Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The ticket we got to wait 30 min and no food
Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Had to pay 17 bucks for this crap, never again

y5zMwsQq2z9djUJNUJy3eQ.text: Go to Orchids. This place is not good. The worst: cold eggrolls and greens. Had to ask for them to be reheated???? Had to beg for napkins. We ordered chow mein and they burned it. Then they charge for tea, very unusual for dim sum restaurant, and especially concering when you don't order or drink it and it mysteriously appears on the bill. Plase save you time and money and go to orchids. Farther drive but well worth it.

WCyS5niTsqA1IGTAmaBa7Q.text: This is in Rio. I came here for lunch with my family. We had:  Beef Tripe: This is pretty decent. It wasn't tough or watery so this was pretty good.  Porridge: This is enough for 2 people. It already has white pepper in it so you don't need to ask for it. It also comes with Chinese Donuts on top. Pretty good.  Egg Tart: They didn't have this on the cart but I asked for it and she got it out from the kitchen so it was fresh. It was good but not the best I've had.  Siu Mai: This was alright. Nothing special about it.  Har Gow: This was alright too.  Spare Ribs: They cut the spare ribs really thin and it was really tender. I thought this was one of the best dishes they had.  Chicken Feet: It wasn't as tender as it should be but the flavor was there.  Bean Curd: I liked this dish too. The filling inside it was good and the sauce was thick and not watery.   Service was eh. They took a long time to give us our tea and for the carts to come to our table. The restaurant was large but not a lot of waiters/waitresses and carts so we had to wait often.  I wouldn't mind coming here for dim sum again.

hY8wFkStamfQU_YqaeXhPg.text: The Dimsum was average just like any dimsum I had in the past and I stll think Ping Pang Pong is much better place for dimsum!  The price is ridiculously cheaper but for a quality, I will go back to P3!

2cVs8WMKWoK9535evuyO1g.text: Great service - prompt, friendly, knowledgeable.  Delicious food - authentic.  Dim sum is all very yummy!

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lotus pastry
Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lotus pastry, custard pastry

FGa9JG5btFvQqHi0D5QcXg.text: Good Dim Sum joint in the Rio casino.  Wait time could be an issue since it seems to be popular.  Hospitality is below average here.  Servers are not really friendly and try to push everything.  They don't know how to explain what's in the dishes either.  Depending where you sit, you may never get some of the popular items since they are gone on the first several tables.  However, the Dim Sum is pretty good and the meals I've had were relatively cheap.

D_X6IvWADeEkDgiWFW0DKQ.text: Decent priced food considering it's Vegas and it's open pretty late. The food is average, but you  can't really complain considering the price and the fact that it's Chinese food in the center of Vegas

H_R-TKxZ7_B6jLrCmuwogQ.text: Both the Shu Mai and Ha Gow had a very strange taste, not bad, just different from the norm. Nice place to eat, give it a shot.

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States

A8BDR2vV3cnA7fJ9Gjmk4w.text: A little bit of China inside Vegas, at the Rio. Peking Duck, don't ever forget the bun and hoisin sauce. Watch out for the market price on seafood. Our party of nine split a crab for $202.50 although it was a mighty full size crab and quite beautiful in presentation. High rollers and authentic Chinese tourists will dig the regular and special menu. It still doesn't beat the wonders of Monterrey Park, however. #crabbywhiteguy

o6CTB0ApGBOv5fn56hN_yQ.text: It is the best dim sum you probably can get in Vegas but wouldn't say the best dim sum I had eaten.  Also they are very busy, I literrally have to wait 10 minutes to get some dipping sauce and 15 minutes to get the check.

2tAfnkRd7UBoLjphmDY0lg.text: This is my favorite dim sum place in town. Every time I have gone, the service & the food have been great. It's reasonably priced and a wide variety of generous portions. Highly recommend.

pYcBzEpl3SlgCZukC4qSPQ.text: Great food.  Excellent service.  VERY recommended.  Right inside The Rio west entrance.

DzH9NhMc9jffaVRCnLe2Uw.text: Excellent food. Salt & Pepper shrimp is very good here. Also enjoyed  fried rice and kp chicken!!!!

r4Es9IeVL38aK3T6O4cJew.text: The decor was nice although a little too open for me. The restaurant smelled spicy and interesting. We asked our waiter, once he finally arrived, to recommend something and went with his suggestiins. The lobster egg rolls were pretty good. Watch out because the center stays hot for a long time. The rest of our meal was quite ordinary,  not bad, just nothing special. I will pay good money for a good meal and this was either over priced or under flavored. All in all, it was ok.

vtTCXN2XO8_E3VvMshnDyg.text: Just had an excellent meal!  I was skeptical because the reviews weren't all good, but decided to ignore them and try it anyways. We were seated immediately, and as soon as we told them we were having dim sun, had two different trays at our side to select from.  We chose eight different selections and each one was perfect.  Our service couldn't have been better and we will definitely be back.

7IRpyLTnJi_EsXWr_BEaag.text: Always hit the spot when we come here for dim sum. Their service is quick and attentive. I finally got to try the X.O. Rice Noodles which I ordered off the special menu and it was delish!

7TF1M54Ep0shTD-G7uA8_w.text: My favorite Vegas spot.  I have to eat here no matter where in Vegas I stay.  It is always on the list.  Fry cart is the best!  Steamed broccoli and green tea cakes are a must.  3 people a full table and hot tea for $50???  Can't beat that in Vegas!

1Lb8mS-Cy3Tw1Qi1WgHsWw.text: Most worst service I have seen in a Chinese Restaurant.  I will never go there again. No suggest anyone to try.

0WI8hgb4ToA5iD6JUazdEw.text: Very affordable and delicious food. We had the shredded pork pan fried noodles, sweet corn chicken soup, pork buns and pork siu mai for less than $40 and everything was fantastic. The service was a bit overwhelming, too many people were working and desperate for something to do so they kept coming to the table every two seconds. The next night we even went back and got the sweet and sour pork which was also superb. Will definitely come again on our next visit to Vegas!

NNa-bviTMfnU6V3R0UoFdA.text: Our experience for the dim sun is subpar at best. We have been to this location before in the past with far better results. The quality of the food today wasn't as fresh as before and I found myself choking down most of it with our tea. Our usual favorite, the barbecue pork bun was flaky and stale. The waiter is blunt and borderline rude and the wait staff were not as attentive the longer we stayed. We spent a good fifteen minutes asking for dessert but was largely ignored.

oZgj4XY9upgjcN3mmh1BGQ.text: just past opening hours...large dim sum cart pushing restaurant...rio casino floor closer to self-park structure entrance...standard small plate bites...expecting fresh food near opening...but, very questionable...dumpling skin thick, dry and chewy...meat bits just fatty oily boney...worst bland watery porridge...donut sticks cold oil chew...stopping after $eighty worth and leaving to eat elsewhere...

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. pretty bad dim sum...

1qRtfF5d2t2oAbBvf7sKyQ.text: We decided to come here for Dim Sum because my friend was informed by Rio that there would be a 25% total rewards discount for all restaurants in their hotel. After we received the bill she was told that the 25% does not apply, although the hotel still continues to tell people that it does. Instead of making the effort to check with the hotel about correcting the information that they are giving guests they continued to argue with my friend and refused to give her any kind of discount. Although the food was pretty good and the carts came around continuously, the meal ended on a sour note because of the argument..

VZI9ZAFCCx_UqlZEEBzOQg.text: Nom! Stopped by here on my way back to the strip because I'd heard good things, and I was not disappointed!  I'd always thought pho was the best hangover cure, but dim sum might be another contender. I only tried a few things but my faves were the har gow and the EGG TARTS! Good times, I'll have to make this a regular stop on all my Vegas trips.

p5D_b_daXpxDF0dLqpZkuA.text: Dim sum here is amazing! I come here every morning that I'm in vegas pretty much for dim sum. The chicken feet and shu mai are very flavorful. The service is pretty good for it being so busy. Highly recommended

AqpsIc0PV6kal4RF5RRDAg.text: I really utterly do not understand how this restaurant has such high reviews......we came here on a whim because we had a show to catch (the chippendales heheheh) and we didnt' want buffet. The place was empty when we came in, but there were plenty of servers. My gf and I split the shumai appetizer and a garlic scallion chicken. the other two girls in our group ordered a beef pan fried noodle and the other ordered a seafood pan fried noodle. This is how the convo went down:  Girl #1: "Hi, I'd like to have the beef pan fried noodle" Waiter: "Ok" Girl #2: "Hi, I'd like to have the seafood pan fried noodles" waiter: "Beef pan fried noodle?" Girl #2: "No....Seafood pan fried noodle" Waiter: "Ok"  first the garlic scallion chicken comes out first....almost halfway through eating it, we had to remind the waiter of our shumai. He clearly had forgotten about it and ran to go get it. Fortunately, the shumai was DELICIOUS. the second i bit in, my mouth automatically went MMMMMMMMMM. it was uncontrollable.   then our gf's pan fried noodles FINALLY come out.........guess what comes out? TWO beef pan fried noodles!!!!!!!  my gf pointed it out that she ordered the seafood noodle........and it was hte most awkward exchange ever. the waiter pauses "OH No my mistake......." pauses and looks at her.......and did not immediately even offer to take it back........and my gf is just like it's fine don't worry about it (she obviously didn't want to wait while we were almost done with our food) and he has a sigh of relief an djust leaves it.  NO one comped her meal and he didn't even offer to take it back and just looked at her to see if she would just accept it! Thank goodness she even eats beef!  terrible service, decent food (shumai helped, the chicken was too salty).

m5ifK0uBXLh3I4CU12kzmA.text: I was surprised that the Rio opened a dim sum place, but I was excited about trying it out.  I loved the interior. It's probably the nicest cleanest dim sum place you might find in Vegas. Not that others aren't nice, it's just been remodeled very nicely!  As for the dim sum, I'd have to say it's A-OK. Even the prices, I believe probably a tad higher than most, but I didn't mind if I'm sitting in a place I enjoy. The service, probably much the same as other Chinese dim sum restaurants, semi-friendly (?), efficient, but very rushed and a bit frantic.  I'd recommend KJ's for your next dim sum lunch :)
