WpVzV9aFqaAlFQ_OvkdPTA.text: To start off they ran out of egg rolls who has ever heard of a Chinese restaurant running out of egg rolls the food was unedible we were spitting out the meat it wasn't cooked we couldn't chew it terrible horrible go anywhere else

vX4QnLqsnIvLD3P2M5itsA.text: So, after my experience with Dim Sum at Cathay House, and so many of my friends swearing by this place, I had to try it. Sadly, it was, IMO, not as good as CH. There wasn't one vegetable at all. Not one. I dont need a massive amount, but it's nice to get some greens when eating all that pork! We tried quite a few of the same things that we had at CH, and I just liked the flavor better at CH. The service is very good, and the price can't be beat. Our table was full with food, and it came to $14PP. I left full and satisfied, but doubt I will return.

YzO1EGLHG8W2pN_0YWB-bA.text: We came here on a Monday afternoon, during a lunch break.  - Fast service. They seat you immediately and food is aleardy waiting! - Very spacious. Usually in a dim sum restaurant, the tables are really close together and it gets pretty intimate, very loud and noisy, but not here. haha - All fresh and hot. We came at 12pm, so I'm sure most were just made. - I would definitely get the shrimp rice noodle and crystal shrimp dumpling! My FAVES! - For desserts, get the egg custard and tofu pudding! DELICIOUS!  - Pricing can be pretty steep. Although expensive, this place is WAY BETTER than Orchids.  - If you want dim sum in LV, KJ is a for sure HIT!

1YaJFqwOdI1OTcwlUqwpNg.text: This review is not about the food, since we left before we got the meals we'd ordered.  I asked the waiter, an older Asian gentleman, a couple of questions about the menu -- why there were two prices listed for some of the dishes, whether there were nuts in the dish (since I have an allergy). Even though I was the one inquiring, he proceeded to respond to the boyfriend making eye contact only with him, completely ignoring me. After ordering, we got up and left before our meals arrived. The hostess came after us to inquire whether we'd be back. When we responded that we didn't intend to 'cause of the poor service, she left without asking us anything more.

3br5AgbW45R814x-Ag4iDQ.text: A great dim sum place near the strip at the Rio.  You can get here from the strip from the free shuttle bus from Bally's or simply take a cab.  Brightly lit, clean interior with great service too.  In my opinion the dim sum here rivals those of Seattle and San Francisco Chinatowns.  Even the tea (goke fah or chrysanthemum) was fragrant  and high quality.  Our total bill before tip came to about 70 for seven people, and we ordered lots.  Some standout items included curry fish balls, sticky chicken rice, beef balls, Siu Mai, black bean spareribs, and fried bean curd filled with shrimp.  All of these items had just enough salt and weren't too oil - in fact all still had good texture.  A minor miss is the beef chow fun.  Beef was seasoned well and there was plenty of "wok breath", but the chefs here sliced up the rice noodles.  Most of our group were used to llonger wide noodles, and I tend to agree - it would make the dish better.  Imagine eating pasta with spaghetti sliced up and you'll notice the difference!  Still, extremely good quality to price ratio and authentic dim sum.  Service was great and the food does come out fast!

A34GGN-uBud1wzRzJ2n8Jg.text: Horrible service. We have to w8 like forever before we can order anything to eat. And the veggie we ordered never comes up. It's better to go to Chinatown. It's way better there

fljyBh6Q8Os1Osu6TPglLg.text: Price: Reasonable, way cheaper than any dim sum place in Pasadena, CA.  Dim sum: Compared with the dim sum that I tried in Pasadena, CA, this place is definitely authentic.   Service: All of their servers speak Cantonese but their efficiency was just so so.   Overall: I still want to try their dim sum once every few weeks.

KRl_b-OCeTV79KFUaguHNA.text: Has gone downhill.  Not sure if they changed cooks but the meat they use is of very poor quality - very low grade.  Like the type that has been soaked in water to try to add weight.   Hot and sour soup was very bland and the pork they used was also of very bad quality.  Black bean chow fun was very slimy and tasted like super market microwave instant food.   Salt and pepper fish was all batter with very little fish inside.   Minced pork with salted fish was like a slab of purified pork steamed into a grayish patty.   With so many amazing Chinese restaurants in Vegas this is a pass.    You would think when the customer barely touch the food it is a sign that the food is bad.  Plus they charged us for rice that they never give us.   Awful awful experience

YZn1_7GjAPi5pVpPwmr1qw.text: Too noisy, people here don't speak english, uncomfortable.   The place has good food. I just don't enjoy the atmosphere of this place. It's just one big open room with tables. It's annoying when people stare at you when you eat.

l3tBNDkLYDCz7-Pt-GeuYQ.text: Not bad for Vegas standard! Siumai so so, cha siu bao so so, steamed taro good, steamed beef and cilantro roll good, chicken feet not sweet, beef ball no good, xlb not good, shrimp ball so so, ribs vey good! Price is very affortable. Bay area dim sum is still superior!!

dfHsEZEPyLeZnrWtVTaxug.text: KJ is located inside of the Rio. It's a little fancier than your run of the mill dim sum joint. It's clean, well-decorated, and the service is excellent.! Feel free to bring your non-Asian friends here--they'll be comfortable!   I'm a big fan of small plates. You get to try everything without feeling like a total glutton. But I can remember coming here a few times (ok, maybe more than a few) where our eyes overestimated our stomach. Perfectly steamed dumplings, chicken feet (yeah, I said it), pork ribs, tripe, and vegetables rolling around on steel carts. Excellence!  My favorites being the aforementioned + the shrimp noodle, Shu Mai, shrimp dumpling & leek dumplings. Basically, you can order anything and be satisfied. I can truly say everything is excellent except for the temp that the food comes off the carts. Some days it's steaming hot. Other days, lukewarm. Either way, it's a small sacrifice for Chinese restaurant servers that actually want to serve you and a place you feel comfortable bringing your friends who would be mortified by the hole in the wall down the street. :) enjoy!

2dGR8jDKbYHcmYUXd4FSpA.text: 6 hr flight from NY and starving for lunch so what better way than to quench my hunger quickly then with Dim Sum, Hong Kong cart style. Problem is, food was just alright.  As typical of cart style dim sum, your attacked as you sit and all at once your table is full with plates of dumplings, rice dishes, pork dishes and more.  The food wasn't bad, just a wee bit too salty, a wee bit too greasy and wee bit too much too fast for my liking.  Best of the meal was the Dat Tam dessert. Piping hot, sweet, creamy and a nice flaky crust.   Worth a try if your in the mood but would not be my first stop next time.

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It&#39;s Dat Tam!
Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet, creamy and delicious!

808fae3GBdhXikArvmuYsA.text: I said it before and I'll say it again... if you walk into a Chinese restaurant and all of the patrons and servers are Chinese, I would say it's a good sign.  And it was.  This dim sum place reminded me of a famous dim sum place in Hong Kong.  So many options and the servers were around often with the carts so there was no waiting at all.  They had a lot of authentic dim sum.... on the day we went, they had a special duck egg bao.  My friend's Chinese mom was quite pleased.  And those egg tarts... wow!   And I've read some of the other reviews about the prices, but I thought the prices were very reasonable.  In fact, there were 6 of us dining and the bill was only $75!!!  Amazing!  And we even ordered a noodle dish off the menu!    And FYI, they don't have their liquor license yet, so BYOB!  We had a little cooler of our own beer and it worked out just great!

tFdALafadhhkN8Ufg7GlRg.text: Although the term "dim sum" is in the name, don't assume they serve it all day or that you can order it in the early afternoon. They run out of dim sum almost every day. The sooner they run out, the sooner they can charge for full meal orders. There are better dim sum houses in the Bay Area and LA. It can be extremely busy. On all 3 of my visits, most of the patrons were asian, speaking several dialects of Chinese. That was taken as a good sign, as dim sum is of Chinese origin.   Food Although the menu is pretty big, the food is average to pretty good. The entree  recommendations are roasted duck (1/2 serves 2 people), #4 fried beef rice noodles, and sauteed beef with orange, extra crispy. I haven't tried the soup but it didn't look great. Dim sum highlights are short ribs, BBQ pork buns, crispy shrimp balls, and egg tarts. I can't really recommend anything else. The rest is ok.   Service When busy, the chaos sends the staff into panic mode and anything can happen. The manager, an older Asian man speaking Cantonese and Mandarin, in a dress shirt and Lacoste sweater vest was rude to people in at least 3 languages. Our server was a nice woman from Hong Kong. Many of the bus staff seemed slow to help and quick to argue with other staff.   It's a fun place to watch people, staff and customers when it is busy. There's always some little drama. For the best value, go early for dim sum. Be prepared to wait. Try only recommended dishes. Call ahead and ask about dim sum availability, wait time, and hours. They all seem to change with seasons and holidays.

GyPCDDSKU4dHH4S829WYkQ.text: Service is awesome and the comps i got from Rio helped a whole lot. I did the regular chinese dinner and the dim sum was good. Although no regular rice during dim sum

YfQMaYLjUhyL4sa16kHS3Q.text: If you want some good dim sum. This is the place to go to. They have all kind of dishes that other place don't have it.  Good place for family gathering.

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States

e43YXTU67rmzYCY8HCqv-g.text: First time here and a while since I had dim sum. Fairly busy time we went but only waited about 10 minutes. Service was fast and very friendly. The dim sum carts came around often as well. A little disappointed in a few of the items lacking flavor as well as them running out of their egg bun custard. I do have to say it was definitely the cleanest dim sum place I've gone to.  Ambiance - 4 Food/Drinks - 4 Service - 5 Cleanliness - 5 Overall - 4

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Variety of items

MGLpqhqvlDUteCr6dc19yQ.text: We decided to come here for dim sum. The food was pretty good and the ladies were nice and friendly. Table service was a bit slow with the water refills.

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum!
Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg Custard Buns
Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Crepes

EH5W8dZULDlW6Ke816d7VQ.text: I came here a couple of years ago and vaguely remember the food being alright but apparently it wasn't memorable enough for me to write a review. Gave them another shot recently when at the Rio for a few days for the Colossus, at the recommendation of a few other players. I won't be back.  Walked in between lunch/dinner and they still had steady business. Waited at unattended hostess stand for about 5 minutes before being acknowledged, despite several servers within eyesight. Couple in front of us left before we were finally seated. The three of us oddly received just one copy of the menu, and we let the server know we were there for dim sum... After ten minutes, we had yet to receive our drinks and the carts were exclusively revisiting the same few perimeter dining tables that were seated with families and no one had even indicated that they would be addressing the tables in the middle of the dining room. We left and went to Orchid Garden up the street instead, were seated and served immediately by friendly staff.

CbfeXr1a-u7t4ih77uSBVg.text: I would definitely rank it 3.5 stars and maybe close to 4. It is a Chinese restaurant after all. We had my daughter's one month old party here for dinner with about 8 tables. We had shared the day with a wedding as well so it was chaotic. I can't really tell you about the food that night because it was gone by the time I would sit down so I'm assuming it was delish. We started off with the jelly fish cold cuts platter and it went into assorted dishes such as steamed fish, roast pork, more seafood and veggies. Overall, I could tell everyone was happy and full.   Now dim sum, I can tell you more about. I like that it's at the entrance of the Rio so you don't have to walk across the whole casino to get to it. The casino itself doesn't smell too smokey and did I mention that it opens at 10 am? We just went this past weekend and ordered our favorites. Sticky rice, turnip cake, pineapple bun with custard and with coconut, bbq pork buns, the two staples of dim sum (sew mai and hai gow) and tripe, etc. The dim sum is always delish and even though we spent a good $35 dollars it was well worth it. Service was good considering it just opened for the day and it was a Chinese restaurant. I like that it is clean and nicely decorated.   Overall, KJ is my fav dim sum place and I definitely love it!

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Assorted dim sum items
Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pineapple bun with custard
Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turnip cake!

qxELWaUCXShwnF9wEekknA.text: I was pleasantly surprised when I came here for dim sum over the weekend! I never knew this awesome dim sum place existed at the Rio so close to the strip. I had previously always went to Chinatown to get dim sum whenever I was in Vegas.   There were many dim sum carts, and a large variety of plates to chose from. Everything I tried was pretty good. My favorites were the fried taro, steamed bean curd, and shu mai.   I really like how large and modern this place is. I also like that it feels clean, unlike some other Chinese restaurants.

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Awesome dim sum at the Rio

mGGimPSJqMbGoKzUQpZMQQ.text: Located in The Rio Hotel in Las Vegas across the Carnival Buffet.    Very good dim sum... Easy to get seated but they do get very busy.   Clean restaurant and very nice staff except for one male server.  He was a little rude.

layK735hP1tdd7b9LFJOMA.text: The authentic dim sum scene in Las Vegas has always been lacking.  Ping Pang Pong and Chang's Hong Kong have been the two well-known local favorites for a long time.  KJ is certainly a very welcomed new addition.  Located in the Rio Hotel off-strip, KJ is actually just across the street from the Gold Coast Casino where Ping Pang Pong is located.  I can see some friendly competition there LOL!  KJ is a bit more upscale; the ambience is nicer, and of course the place is newer.  The service we had was also actually very good for a Chinese dim sum place.  The last 2 times I was in Ping Pang Pong I actually found the service rather chaotic.  So this is definitely a +1 for KJ.  The dim sum was above average, and actually really good by Vegas standard.  The congee rivaled some of the best in the SGV.  Pork spareribs were yummy and there was more meat than bones.  Cool!  Bean curb wrap was good and so was the steamed taro cake.  We also liked the beef balls although I found the Chinese bbq sauce flavor a bit too overwhelming.  The basic staples - har gow and siu mai - were only average.  The har gow skin was thick and mushy and the shrimp filling didn't taste fresh.  This is really 3.5 stars  but in Vegas we'll need to keep our expectations reasonable, so I'll give it 4 Vegas stars.

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork spareribs.
Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bean curb wraps.
Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef balls.

1DAPEBeCKpvCi88vgAXRjQ.text: Decent dim sum restaurant located inside Rio.  We came here on Sunday for Mother's Day and surprisingly the wait wasn't too bad. We waited about 30 mins for a table for 5.    There wasn't that many ladies pushing the carts but they seemed to stop by pretty often.  We ordered Chinese Broccoli and Crispy Noodles from our server and the rest from the ladies with the carts.   Everything tasted decent.  My favorite was the Shu Mai- I could eat like ten of these. I don't know the names for the rest of them but they were all pretty decent, just a tad bit oily.  I also liked the custard egg tarts; it was freshly made as the custard was piping hot but so good.    Again, decent dim sum place but nothing really stood out.  The ladies seemed to only have a couple of different dim sums as there wasn't much variety available when they came by to our table.  I was looking for a few specific ones but they were nowhere to be found :(.

qW9H0wD7ynaH2Od_7l0ZVg.text: KJ Dim Sum and Seafood Restaurant is one of the better dim sum restaurants in Las Vegas. However, it's not on the Strip so you have to either taxi or drive there. The restaurant is decorated with floral, koi, and city scape prints. There's several tvs to watch sports.   They have really good Chinese pastries such as the Pineapple Bun (which was served warm, sweet, and coconutty), BBQ Roast Pork Pastry (which is triangular, sweet, savory, and sprinkled with sesame seeds), and Egg Custard Tart.   Other favorites included the Crystal Shrimp Dumplings, Shumai, Beef Balls (which consists of beef, water chestnut, and parsley and served with Lea and Perrin sauce), Chicken Feet, Crispy Beancurd (which was wrapped with shrimp and parsley), Beef Crepes, Shrimp Crepe (which was filled with large shrimp), and Chinese Broccoli (which was served with oyster sauce)  I don't recommend the following dishes: Vegetarian Spring Roll (as it wasn't warm) and Beef Ribs with bones (as there were bone fragments everywhere).

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg Tarts
Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pineapple Buns
Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chinese Broccoli

uzP8uXB6QLrK6Uo3LM0PyQ.text: Dim sum here is excellent. This is the one go-to spot for my mom and I. There is sometimes a wait during the weekends but it's nothing atrocious. Food here is always fresh and tasty, I've never had a complaint. The only place that is comparable to here is probably ping ping pong. Other than that this is one of the best dim sum places in Vegas.

gEKCCRJGLItSl6DZC13YHg.text: Loved this place. Dim sum here was great. Especially loved the pineapple custard bun. Sinful, but to die for. Would highly recommend this place.

Mb63PVVwOKN1qkP6HGMbWQ.text: I'm in for 4 stars. Not a big Dim Sum guy so I ordered the spring rolls and chicken fried rice. Spring rolls were spot on delicious. Only 2 little rolls per order but delicious. The fried rice was good but had very little soy sauce used in making it. Luckily I got some packages of soy sauce from the Vietnamese joint a short walk away. Also make sure you ASK for spoons, chop sticks, hot mustard, etc if you're getting take out like I did. They gave me none of those items.

tbY2kSLBtl_2WC7ohJABog.text: Literally the best dim sum I've ever had.  I've had dim sum from NY, LA and Houston, but nothing compares to this.

ETiWWpGdTJ2VGuiOJQKPqw.text: Wait staff was rude and condescending when asking for recommendations or when asked to describe a dish. Forgot many drink orders but we're still billed for them. Food is alright but for the price I'd rather go somewhere with a better wait staff.

1i4tfRE9v8ZtU8icon6LzQ.text: The food here is average. We came at midnight and they had stopped offering the dim sum menu which was disappointing. We had potstickers and wonton soup. The potstickers were standard and the soup a little bland. The service was great.

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wonton soup

CrH59yW4WFERsPTvxXXEiw.text: Came here with my family for dim sum. We had no problem getting a reservation for a party of 6. I am from San Francisco but heard this was a good place to eat dim sum.  Service 4 stars: service was fine. We were seated very quickly as soon as we got to the restaurant at the rio. There were lots of people with food carts coming around like in traditional dim sum place.  Food 3 stars: dim sum there was a lot of variety but dishes were warm at best. The shrimp dumpling and other dishes with rice wrappers were kind of had dish meaning it had been sitting out for awhile.   All in all not the best dim sum spot I've had in vegas but it is probably one of the closest to the strip.

7q2-WcSaTEt1x8FfcIp32g.text: Pretty good!!!! I asked for the orange chicken with white rice , my fiance ordered his favorite honey walnut shrimp and Singapore rice noodle wAs delicious!!

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ac8i5FwWOX1bQp6XvUdy4g.text: They were very helpful, the food was outstanding, and the food was better and the prices were much lower than the dim sum at Paris

vFzK3HwbgE8Vpe5Koy7M0g.text: Very lovely restaurant at first my waiter was very nice and asked me what i wanted to drink he made sure  i was positive i didnt want wine.. as much as i did want wine i had lost my i.d so oh well .... Very good food I love the vegetarian options they showed me... as soon as I ordered I asked for tea... he was then surprised I was ordering tea for myself... and asked me if I was sure I wanted tea because it was a big pot ... yes sir I want tea...  ... later when my friend finished his dish he wanted more so I asked him if we could get a new dish and I think he thought we were complaining about the food but we were not the food was just really good we wanted more ....love the fact that they are open late .... I will be returning because the food was so amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The pots not that big haha
Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy tofu

vEsPnBO-qR2-1JQZ8-bbZg.text: Went to the Rio to accomplish a "task" and stayed for dim sum at KJ.  That was a great find.  It is as authentic as it gets.  What was surprising was the restaurant had a good variety of dim sum items; was relatively quiet for a Chinese restaurant; super clean; and the servers were all very attentive.   Our tea pot was constantly being refilled.  They have carts coming around and they always ask if you need anything.  Then when it gets a little more busy they walk around with the items just to make sure you are all being served.  My husband wants to go back again.

CFRF2xgwvE8wPZnxZ-A7Eg.text: We stumbled upon KJ while heading to a poker tournament.  By the time we finished, we were famished and hoped for the best.  The reviews for this place on Yelp must be written by people who don't quite understand dim sum. It's not Yank Sing or Din Tai Fung, but the food is pretty tasty! They also have pineapple buns, about which we were ecstatic!  We weren't sure what the tab would be, but we had at 7-8 orders off the carts and tea. $37.  We both nearly spit out our tea at the notion of getting authentic dim sum IN CARTS, in Vegas for $45, including tip.   The only reason I gave it 4 stars is that I don't care for the individual items being wrapped in paper or metal cups.  Those things were tough to remove, but didn't change the flavor at all.

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1_tO7k7eSv0WvL8E5NsI0w.text: Dim sum at the rio. That's how I started my day today 1-5-17. On the weekdays their seats are more flexible and the wait is a lot less. I only come early for their dim sum because I like my dishes hot like fire.   Available parking outside by the hotel or in the rio parking garage. If you go early you'll probably get slammed with people or get lucky and find seats super quick. Aside from their super oriental interior design the service is superb. Being Asian American has its perks, I can order in Chinese and sometimes point of course.   The dim sum ladies are everywhere. If you find a cart pushing towards you better order as much as you can because everything looks super delicious. It's delicious, only reason I always come back to the rio.   My favorite couple dishes are the marinated ribs and the meatballs. You can also order the proteins, but the desserts 10/10. Taro bun and the red bean puddings are my two go to desserts.   Service, food and the atmosphere really adds to the overall dining experience. I always have a great time eating here and so are the guests I bring along with me.   Highly recommend everyone to try this fine establishment. You cant go wrong with dim sum for breakfast or brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3Ju8XpjGfdGRoCiMAaqubw.text: For a restaurant to call itself a Dim Sum restaurant as the first food item mentioned in its name, you'd expect Dim Sum to be available when they're open. This is not the case. They serve Dim Sum during the most limited time window of any "Dim Sum" restaurant I've ever seen in my life, basically only for a few hours around lunch.. I just wasted a drive here to learn this after midnight when I was already down the road from another Dim Sum restaurant that actually serves Dim Sum until 4am. I'd just wanted to try out a new place. And apparently according to the server this is an ongoing issue but the owner won't do anything about it. The table that was seated next to me had the same problem. Change your name or serve Dim Sum whole you are open. It's not rocket science. You're not actually Dim Sum restaurant. You're a place with a dim sum lunch special. To name yourself such is downright dishonest.

fkf9ZEhorDQn1OQtpqekLw.text: Worked the convention all day and was starving on my way out! I decided to try this place. It was not busy at 6:15, which was perfect! I had the cashew nut shrimp with a side of white rice, which is extra. It was simple, yet tasty. I have enough for breakfast tomorrow. The waiter checked on me often, and even gave my my leftover tea in a soup container, along with my food. The thing I hate is how the restaurants reek of cigarette smoke. This makes me eat my food fast, just to get the hell out of there! I know its not their fault, but damn! Meal was 22.00 not bad at all. They also said they don't use MSG which is great, because I'm allergic to it. Would come again if ever in Vegas, but I will wait another 16 years, like the last time I was here. LOL

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cashew nut shrimp!

j-OE59RhfI8ecgKM5qwPZA.text: This place Dim sum was very delicious and the staff are very friendly.  Went on a Sunday and it this place gets packed quick, so make sure you go before 12 if you're trying not to wait.

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bfMh3iYXjpLwymtcV2GzZQ.text: I moved to the Midwest from Seattle and have been craving dim sum. There is none within a hundred mile radius from where I live. I was super excited when I saw there was a dim sum place in the hotel where we were staying. Even if it wasn't great, I was hoping it would satisfy the craving. Turns out it was delicious! On par with what you'd get in Chinatown in Seattle. The first cart came by as soon as we sat down. There are a ton of choices and extremely reasonably priced (especially for Vegas). We got 4 selections and our bill was only $15. The only reason for 4 stars instead of 5 is that we were through about half of our dumplings before the actual waitress came by to give us drinks. I'm planning on going again before we leave.

BLoA2OmmGMF6ANzd22-OLQ.text: Worst customer service in Vegas!! I was the first one to get in the door when they open. Because I was alone, they pushes all the carts to the other tables and skip me. After 20 min of waiting, I had to say something. Then I requested for soy sauce from two different waiters; they say "Ok" but no one came back with my sauce. I waited 25 min for my check, everyone here is so rude. The foods is good, but I'm not coming back!

YXen_1dJEKxbTtY_Dmw-lw.text: My guidelines to enjoying good dim is to only go on the weekends and during prime time. There is almost always a wait, but at least the food is hot and fresh.   This is my go-to spot when I get a craving. Food is pretty consistent and the service is better than what I've received at other dim sum places. Their tripe is really good, and custard filled pineapple buns are a must!

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg custard pineapple buns = orgasm in my mouth

UZIRTIvexLCFV4D6fE7nsw.text: Dim sum was really good compared to Atlanta I think the different is over here it comes out HOT n fresh sometime other places sit n cold  A plus

BaA6AMgmeZ04PP_dbuDR3A.text: Pleasantly surprised that the food here is quite good and prices are reasonable. Had dinner for 6 that included Peking Duck (duck had lots of meat and was not greasy), Scallops with black bean sauce, Seafood crispy pan fried noodles, Sea Bass in clay pot and House made Spareribs in clay pot.  All were very tasty and more than enough food for 6 adults. Went for dimsum today and all were good quality and tasty! Only reason I didn't give it 5 stars was that a few things could have been hotter, shao long bao and taro gok. As a discerning person of Chinese ancestry, I will definitely continue to eat at this restaurant!

a7ymGuYf7jyUmfjUEHz4lQ.text: If you like intestines order the house special appetizer, which we did by accident, wasn't actually as bad as it sounds.  The sweet and sour pork and honey walnut shrimp were 4 stars but the sizzling beef got 5 stars!

JJ0lW6cKYrvfOp3bLvVjGQ.text: This is a pretty good Dim Sum place with long opening hours, fast service, and plenty of seating, located inside the Rio (across from the buffet; park on the side away from masquerade tower). It wasn't the best food I've had, but it is fairly cheap (almost Spring Mountain Road pricing, not Strip pricing), and because it is served from carts, service is fast.  My tea pot was also kept full, and checking out was fast.  I'd definitely come back when at the Rio, and it isn't a bad choice if you have a car and are nearby.

8IZRe9rAiB7vVNxDZzvQqg.text: Just recently took a trip to Vegas last weekend and stayed at the Rio hotel. My friend and I decided to give this dim sum place a shot since it's located inside the same casino. All of the items we ordered were either average or sub par. Yeah taste wise, nothing really stood out and I was pretty disappointed. Mehhh I wouldn't come back here again.

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast

D2FFXqjVDKn7GmP12xlE_w.text: I come here a lot but always with someone who speaks mandarin since most of the waitresses and waiters speak mandarin. If you don't speak the language you can always point at the dishes that look good to you. The food is really good though and my favorite for desert is the egg tart. They also have very good short ribs here as well as a biscuit type of food with meat in the middle. It is in the middle of the rio so they have a parking garage to park in which has plenty of spots. You can come here for lunch or dinner and it is a good spot to go after a show or gambling at the rio. If you like to play Pokemon then the rio is a good place to catch poke balls.

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Soup dumplings--definitely a favorite!
Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short ribs and and greens
Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A common breakfast item!

jfRtyIoeC_IGO0xCD0-uUQ.text: This is my go to place for local dim sum. They have most the popular dim sum dishes as well as some more unique plates. The staff is always fast and courteous. Everything about this place is good, which is why I always come back, but there just isn't anything that makes it stand out as amazing. Worth the try if you are looking for dim sum in Las Vegas.

BrnITxN7qeskQ3dIQJPMoA.text: This place likes to close early.  The like to False advertise. They close at least 30 minutes early before 2am. Bad for business

QiuydzU5H3Qmpta4QDmMFw.text: This place is a lot of fun and not too far from the strip if you have a car.   There is parking there as well.   The ribs are amazing there is an amazing flavour to them. They have nutmeg and cinnamon in them and ginger I believe.

COaD15T4hbQl046CycllCA.text: A dim sum restaurant outside the confines of Chinatown?  We were skeptical at first, but heard good reviews from True dim-sum'ers.   We decided to give it a try during our vacation visit and ate there for lunch. The wait was well over 45-minutes (weekday) so expect to wait patiently.   Once we finally sat down, we ordered the usual foodies and was not disappointed. The typical dishes were fresh and not heavy and greasy as we have come to expect at similar venues.   Service was rather attentive and the push cart ladies were friendly and generally sincere in trying to help you get a particular dim sum dish.   In addition to the hoard of dim sum dishes we ate, we also ordered a few rice/noodle dishes. The salted fish chicken fried rice was a disappointment as it was bland and seemed out of place with the use of uncooked shredded cabbage. We also ordered a few other noodle dishes. Nothing spectacular, just okay.   Stick with the dim sum and you will not be disappointed.

v-Jg457u8D-b1P0HXGifaQ.text: HATE  Nothing.  DISLIKE  Lack of booths. Not as much of a selection offered in carts (though you can order it from the kitchen).  LIKE  The classier atmosphere (than most dim sum restaurants). The cart attendants were friendlier than your average dim sum server. The Shrimp in Rice Noodles. The Sticky Rice in Lotus Leaves had egg yolk. The Pineapple Buns. The Har Gow. The Scallop Dumplings.  LOVE  Nothing.

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A few of my favorite dim sum!

3vyUmYAYrILUTVUlEgYTNQ.text: Dimsum was VERY ordinary, nothing's taste special/ good. 168 market has a better tastier dimsum.  Few of the ladies works there doesn't even speak English, I'm surprised casino would hire people who don't understand English even for a VERY simple conversations. Long story short, we're not happy with the food and Will never comeback again.

268bV5GYaYbCBME2tjfPTw.text: Ok, my main issue with this place is that the words Dim Sum are in the name!   Every time i have been here, they don't serve dim sum!    That is enough to get 1 star less from me.    I did very much enjoy the food that I did get, and I felt the service was good.   Prices were a bit high, but it is Vegas.      steamed dumplings.  Very good.          Roasted Duck I ordered both times I was there.  Very tasty.      Sweet n Sour Pork, was good, but I have had better.  FYI....They don't serve rice with your dishes, you have to order/pay for it separate.

wdeQnCCgGxf3ypKERPSgzQ.text: The service was impeccable. Super attentive and quick. The interior was ok. The food was not that good. Not sure what the issue is but it just didn't taste very fresh or exciting. We are spoiled by the great dim sum places in Honolulu, LA, and Vancouver, however. Will not be going back.

mYRXyoe1LulHc2zVBIf1Kg.text: I haven't had dim sum in a while so my husband and I came here to satisfy my long-awaited dim sum craving. We went on a Sunday before noon. No wait. First impression - I like that the restaurant feels inviting. One spacious, modern, open room, not a hole in the wall.  To my dismay, my feelings changed as soon as I tried some of the dishes. The food was disappointing. I regretted my craving choice. Most of the things we ordered were cold or just awful. The worst one was the beef spare ribs. So greasy, fatty, gummy, and boney. My shrimp wontons were cold. Chow fun were short pieces and dry, just the opposite of how I like them. Those ribs left a horrible taste in my mouth the whole day. The only thing that were decent were the shu mai and the shrimp flat rice noodle.  Other saving graces were the decor, no wait, and the excellent service even though I'm not Chinese. The dim sum ladies were nice, explained what some of the items are, the server checked up on us, etc.   Our bill was $38 for two before tip.

eq4eUD1C6maFVg1qwvYyIw.text: I've never had dim sum before, this was a good experience. All of the food was good. My only complaint was the language barrier, but that's not their fault.

OvXW906MF41pzRbmrKm_rA.text: I'm not sure why some people hate on this place, but I've been getting great food and great service the couple times that I've been here. Yes the food is a little bit pricy, but you kind of expected that inside a casino.   Great place for a good Chinese food fix after couple days of fancy food! Love it!!

9HM48QCTT9qNcyWpi-6JyA.text: Dim Sum here is good. Remember to show local ID for 20% off. I like the atmosphere and the food. The service is not that great. Typical Chinese restaurant service.

c52f3P4_w5WUaq-rwHwHLg.text: One of the better dim sum places in town. It does help to know Cantonese or Mandarin, but you can get by fine with out it too.

7z4GHyAYO7bGvKD3eo90kQ.text: Horrible service!!!! Very inattentive staff!  I think being filipino/pinoy played a big factor in getting horrible service.  Unless you're Chinese, I wouldn't dine here. The food was forgettable, downright sucked!  $13 for a small plate of broccoli chicken.  We didn't get fortune cookies either!    You're better off going to Panda Express & get your money's worth, Fortune cookies to boot!

DxymS6nL37AmrCFdDXeVAQ.text: If I can give it a zero star, I would.  Hostess had a horrible attitude (perhaps I didn't speak in English but rather Mandarin Chinese). The rest were ok (typical dim sum attitude).  Food taste pretty bland. Most are probably reheated frozen dim sum.  The only thing worth getting is the cha shu bao (not the steam one but the toasted one).

UpUelzAm1cs9oSHHWJFXqQ.text: Wow one of if not the worst buffet in Vegas! Over priced, none of the fruit was ripe, food tasted like wax , and worst of all the water taste like TOILET WATER. AWFUL

G6BoLlx77yzVZ5g2m8EOqg.text: There is something very comforting about dim sum... it's fast, it's cheap, it's warm and savory and it gives you the same freedom of variety as tapas does.  I love dim sum, and I have been used to the best in Manila because of our proximity with China.  But when we moved here to Vegas, it's been quite a challenge looking for good dim sum.  Thanks to the suggestion of a dear friend, we've decided to give it a go.  The first thing you immediately notice is the vibrancy of the place.  High ceilings, uncrowded tables, red walls, soft lighting and very clean/crisp table cloths.  So often you see dim sum places pay little attention to details. (The bathroom is just next door and very nice.)    We came early thinking to avoid the crazy rush hour which we did, but unfortunately could not order anything off the dim sum menu since the chef arrives at 11:15am.  Make sure you go after that time of you want to enjoy their fried rice, noodles or other entrees.  But you will have plenty to choose from the dim sum carts whizzing by - from congee/rice porridge with century egg, silken tofu, fried shrimp wantons, egg custards, taro cakes, pork buns and dumplings.  Our favorites were the steamed pork buns, hargaw or shrimp dumplings and the sweet spare ribs.  They tasted like they were all freshly made and although they still do not quite compare to the stuff we grew up with, esp from Binondo (Chinatown)... they are the best dim sum I've had so far in Vegas.  If I had one small quibble, it's that the soy sauce in their Kikkoman jars did not taste like Kikkoman.  Heh.

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tofu skin stuffed with meat and mushrooms
Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spare Ribs (we loved these, even if it was very sweet)
Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hmmm... this one was with shrimp and scallops

AIevE2RwZl1v-wTbMfYOpw.text: Came here on a Monday morning w/family about 15 minutes after they opened.  Seated quickly and service is decent.  We were there for about 45 minutes, and tables were filling up slowly. Dim sum is decent.  No surprises.

h37jwlKnTVNlhZrLbn6zww.text: My wife and I ate here twice. The first time, it wasn't that bad. The food was okay. Nothing spectacular and nothing special. The service was just okay. We ordered some fried rice that they never put in and we had to inquire repeatedly about it. It finally arrived after we were full.   FLASH FORWARD to today. We dined there with some friends. It took FOUR servers to come to our table to get our drink orders and then another few for us to FINALLY get some water, soy sauce and some orders in. Was it because we weren't Chinese. Yes, I'm using the race card because all the other Patrons who were Chinese got waters without having to repeatedly be ignored and passed by. Lastly, although we were done, not a single person came to even ask if we're ready for our checks, refill waters, ask us if we're alive!! WORST SERVICE EVER! AND THE FOOD... well it's not worth the service. Not even a small bit!! Never coming back to this joint!

9IWFnmV_N7dXdvl8XOhBRw.text: Even 1 star is more here. We used to be regular customer. My husband plays wsop and we stay at rio for the whole mints. Almost everyday we eat here.  Today we ordered chicken sweet corn soup and found a piece of plastic in the soup ! We couldn't eat anymore. All they did said sorry and gave $2 discount! Didn't bother to change the soup ! We came back not eating at last. I am never coming back again.

SWjKoafumpq6h3y01RtnKw.text: Pretty decent place for hot fresh dim sum pushed around in carts. Service was good too

k6hfTDeaQr4aOzFeH7DWPQ.text: While I really don't understand why there is so hard to find a good dim sum restaurant in H town, but you can easily find a good one in Vegas.   The dim sum here is pretty delicious and authentic. Quantity, quality and price are pretty fair.  The only thing I did not like was the service. However, I always don't understand why you can never get good service in Chinese restaurant in west coast.   So here will be a must go place in my list when every time I visit Vegas!

h-a6LY_frk5oC8ihlUHJjw.text: This place is a hit or miss on food and service. There really isn't a great dim sum place in Vegas, in my opinion. The one thing that's good here is the tripe. Shanghai dumplings are always a hit or miss. I feel like the service is always out there. Either they are on it or you will never see them ever and you starve to death because no one ever comes with the cart. But hey, I feel like that with all the dim sum places. The plus side is, they got rock sugar for your tea. Talk about crack!

Eq2RsIsCa6lXSgOzLDf2Ng.text: Pretty good dim sum and prices are reasonable. I like the congee and leek dumplings. The tofu pudding is also pretty good. Also tried the beef chow fun - ok but slightly saltier than what I had hoped for.

DsVdMwwFbAjy7yXIgoeckQ.text: Dim sum is an art to be mastered. Not just the making of it, the timing on when to get there is important as well. Do not come to early because the all food might not be ready yet, do not come too late otherwise there might not be anything left. That sweet spot when it is busy enough for fresh turn over is the sweet spot. Around here, it is sometime between noon and 1:30.   Beware of the flood gates. When you do come around the before mentioned time, the thongs of antsy Chinese people will bum rush the hostess stand. Get your number and back away slowly. No one needs to get hurt. Stand too close to the podium and you will get stampeded.   It is hard to go wrong when you come with a group of eight people, load up the lazy susan and still walk away with a relatively small bill. The food is good and was steaming hot when it hit the table. The taste was some of the best in town. The only complaint is that they ran out of so many dishes. By the end of our lunch, the meager pickings would not satisfy the avid dim sum goer.   The food: all the classics are solid. Har gow, shu mai, chicken feet, veggies in bean curd wrappers, pan fried noodles, and veggies sauteed with garlic are all tasty. The desserts are the star here. We were warned to save room for all the sweet treats. In the end, half of them were out and we were disappointed. No sesame balls, no soft bean curd, only eight sad faces. Like Tony T. mentioned, the Baked Salty Egg Yolk Cream Bun is worth mentioning.

yeyNXOuOw9q8uiG3kFqwXw.text: Walked in to see two tables in the restaurant sat. Hostess walked my friend and I to our table, took our drink order (hot tea and water) and waked away. A young guy brings us our tea and water and says our waitress will be back to take our order (we were ready with our dim sum order).  20 MINUTES later after flagging down the hostess (seated at another table ignoring us) and "drinks only guy" we walked after getting no service at all, we walked out.  I stress the only other tables had finished eating, the other just got their food.

Hf-sIlg6S2Uiz14suXNleg.text: Servers were quick with getting food to your table. Waiters were very good at getting orders down.  Only downfall is paying the bill. Be careful using Total Rewards along with other credit cards...they might not b able to understand how you want to split the bill. Make it CLEAR!!!

otbciybxh7FMUP1EMhJUYA.text: I came here on a weekday so there wasn't the wait that you would expect at these types of places on a typical weekend day. The food was just okay and the prices were very reasonable. The service could use some improvement as I had to ask for things several times. Each time, a waiter or waitress would acknowledge my request only to forget after they walked away. That made it kind of a frustrating dining experience. Our party ordered noodles and they said instead of getting it from the dim sum cart they will prepare it fresh from the kitchen. So we waited. And waited. And waited. And when we could wait no more (halfway through our meal), we asked the waiter to check on it for us. Then a few minutes later a plate of cold noodles appeared on our table. We could have sent it back but we figured we would have to wait again so we all just ate what we were dished and called it a passable meal experience.

c2lwnx9YtarmSFmD2mbAdQ.text: Service is  great ! Seating and ambience is great except food. Food wasn't so great for the price you paying.

sgrfd0deP3yT6VTAARAqKQ.text: We waited about half an hour on a Sat morning to get a table. Many Asian American locals frequent this place. Dim sum is good, but they do run out dishes sometimes. We had to 'special order' a couple of dishes that we knew they had but did not see wheeled out in carts. Unlike other restaurants you do not have to share tables at KJ. Don't know how I feel about that since sharing = less waiting, but I suppose they don't want to make tourists uncomfortable. Otherwise, the food is solid and I would come back again.

Xv8VHVk-cq6OrtG0HF5Ebw.text: The real deal and not expensive if you stick to the carts.  For good grub in a major (well, big and sorta old) casino, it's a great deal if you're hungry.  I'd come just for the excellent egg custards and tea even if I wasn't.  Sui mai, bean curd, shrimp noodle-- all the favorites-- were well prepared.  Spare ribs weren't great but weren't bad either.    For folks that don't know, menu items and anything on a tray usually cost more at dim sum places, so stick to the carts-- they're frequent and well-stocked.  Also, know that dim sum is not veggie friendly and probably not good for you at all unless you just want a huge plate of Chinese broccoli.  Once that's established, bring your friends and expect to be well full for $12.

86qH7nc8gkYhntLrlsY3Dw.text: Located in the RIO hotel and casino.  Its a traditional Dim sum restaurant.  They only serve the dim sun from noon till 3pm so get there quick.  If they run out of something, they won't make more.   The dim sum was good and a little sweeter than the dim sum I am used to where I am from, but still good.  The staff and service were exactly like every other dim sum place, so don't be upset if they arent up your rear ends the entire time.  A simple raised hand will suffice and they will be over right away.

mnpWhsLm9sD1VfKekapA0g.text: I like this place a lot. I normally never eat at a casino but when my mom brought me here for the first time, it's the only place ill eat dim sum at now.   Sometimes the service is quite slow and you don't get any carts to come to your table. There's been a few times where the items I want is not available at the time I go which is fine cause there are other dishes.   Pricing is about the same as restaurants off the strip. Just make sure to double check your bill at the end. Last time my mom got someone else's bill because the waiter gave our bill to someone else and they wanted us to pay for their bill but their bill was more expensive than what they actually ate.

3NoJFsEdA3ex9vaPkxmoyg.text: My new obsession for this place can be equated to these words: Baked Salty Egg Yolk Cream Bun. When I went to KJ for the second time in about a week with a friend, my husband made me get three orders of the mouth watering treat to go. He said don't bother coming home without it. True story.  KJ Dim Sum is located in Rio, across from the Carnival World Buffet. Tip: Prime parking is if you turn on Valley View, there is a parking lot and garage that is MUCH closer than if you enter through the main entrance.  The restaurant is large and can accommodate large groups. Just be prepared for a wait if you go during prime hours. The wait staff is good. They kept checking that our tea pot was full every few minutes.  They have a great selection of dim sum, a lot of the usual that I get in other dim sum places in town. Surprisingly, the prices are very good for being in a casino. I wish I knew the names of the items I love... I just point to whatever looks good! I love this fried seafood ball that comes with a mayo dipping sauce. Their shu mai is also very tasty. But like Tony T. said twice, and I will also mention two more times, the Baked Salty Egg Yolk Cream Bun will win you over!

8J-kBGOZNy8NoSx0Csfu_w.text: We ordered duck and orange chicken.  They were high quality for about $12 each.  the service was great but we were one of the handful of tables, so slow night.    this was one of the only places that was still open to eat late at night.

wVguNRo1WUTjUxNThELH3g.text: Really good dim sum place located inside the Rio!   Minus one star because some of the items off the cart weren't that hot and I hate when they try to shove plates on you that you don't want to order, or perhaps you already have enough to eat.    I noticed a lot of Chinese people in here, which is always a good sign!  Our bill for 2 people came to $26 and we took a bunch home.  We did order too much, so possibly next time it would be less.  If you like Dim Sum, definitely stop by this spot.  They serve from 11am-2pm.  P.S.  You really don't need to valet to eat here.  They have a big lot right outside the entrance where you can self park.  Save your tip money and park yourself.

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp dumpling, chicken mushroom, char siu bao
Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Look fun
Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Taro

fJGQD5kHsDf-XNXHc-4AMA.text: Everything was DELICIOUS. Definitely one of the best dim sum I've ever had. They charge $1 for tea per person which it's pretty expensive in my opinion. Service wasn't great. They probably took over 30 minutes to bring us our shrimp noodle and the waiter we asked to check on it was to lazy to check and just brushed us off saying he doesn't know when it will be out. I assume service isn't always like this therefore I would come back when I want dim sum while visiting.

photos.caption: Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg tarts
Photo of KJ Dim Sum & Seafood - Las Vegas, NV, United States

f3t__i_y7WoqR6zIAgx9pg.text: This was a good casual dim sum restaurant. Some dim sum were extremely well made(xiao long bao and shrimp rice rolls) but there were some that weren't as good as other dim sum restaurants I've been to. Nevertheless the service was great and there were wide variety of dim sum offered.

_JLbQPRkcrS0NJAe-BYc8A.text: This is a pretty good place to go if your  craving Chinese food. I have been here for dim sum and dinner. Dimsum: selections are small compared to others dim sum places I have been too. The food was served from the carts, which is personally my favorite. The food was good and flavorful.   Dinner. I ordered the fried rice with beef. Yummy!  String beans:wowzers  Fried tofu with shrimp: okay  Chicken : can order whole or half. Pretty delicious.  All the food came in a generous portion. The price for the food is expensive but it is the way it is bc its in a casino. Overall delicious

WPJloGXt6uM3qkTjjG00SA.text: Service isn't that good. Dim sum was okay except I got food poisoning from it. Not what you want to have while in Vegas.

fPRnsq5Q75u3YRA4edfD1w.text: Dined here on Sat, Feb 22. The service was one of the worst I've ever experienced.  The restaurant was less than half full, and it was close to 10pm, with plenty of waiters. So there was no excuse.  My husband and I ordered soup, mongolian beef, and steamed rice to share.  After 15-20 minutes, no soup had appeared. But our waiter dropped the mongolian beef on our table and before he ran off, my husband reminded him that we had ordered soup. More time passed, and no soup. Also, no rice had been delivered to us, so we couldn't really enjoy the Mongolian Beef, which was getting colder by the minute.  Finally a different waitress stopped by and we told her we were waiting for our soup.  She disappeared into the kitchen, and finally our original waiter came out with the soup and served it to us. We reminded him about the rice, and he said the rice wouldn't be ready for five minutes.  We ate our soup, all the while our beef dish sitting getting cold, and still no rice.  A different waiter stopped at our table, and we asked for rice and she said it was ready. Eventually someone brought it to us.  The food wasn't bad, but being from the Bay Area, it's nothing above average.  But the service pretty much ruined the meal for us.  Also, it was very overpriced. $13.95 for hot & sour soup, the other soups were $19.95. Mongolian Beef was I think $12.95.  All the food at the Rio is overpriced though. See my other review about their "All American Bar & Grill." Another bad experience. I would be really afraid to have Dim Sum there and not know how much you were being charged until the end. Oh, and the family at the table next to us got into an argument with the waiter about their bill at the end of their meal.  Would definitely not recommend this place.

AfDvjH2gSxVGYPJecgexlA.text: I was pleasantly surprised to find this dim sum restaurant in the Rio hotel.  It was very crowded on a Sunday morning so be sure to get there early.  The restaurant is clean, and service is ok as expected for an Asian restaurant. They push around the dim sum carts and you can just point to whatever you want to eat. The quality of their dishes are pretty good and the price was reasonable.

fgPwmkLNJSisZ0Bgzy6hAA.text: Great Dim Sum. I was raised in NYC and spent a lot of time in NYs Chinatown. KJs is as good as those restaurants. The group I brought thoroughly enjoyed all the dishes.
